built with pdoc

guiQt.view

guiQt.view module: PyQt5 view components for uHDR GUI application.

This module implements the View component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains PyQt5 widgets and interfaces that handle user interaction and visual presentation of HDR image editing tools.

The module provides:

  • Main application window with menu system and docking
  • Image gallery with grid layout and pagination
  • HDR image editing controls and parameter adjustment
  • Tone curve editing with B-spline visualization
  • Color space editing in LCH coordinates
  • Lightness masking for selective adjustments
  • Geometry transformation controls
  • Image information and metadata display
  • Aesthetics analysis visualization
  • HDR display and external monitor support

Key View Classes: - AppView: Main application window with menus and docking - ImageGalleryView: Grid-based image gallery with pagination - EditImageView: Complete HDR editing interface - ImageInfoView: Image metadata and information display - ToneCurveView: B-spline tone curve editing with matplotlib - LchColorSelectorView: LCH color space selection interface - HDRviewerView: HDR display controls and preview - ImageAestheticsView: Color palette and aesthetics visualization

Widget Utilities: - ImageWidgetView: Basic image display widget - FigureWidget: Matplotlib integration for curve editing - AdvanceSliderView: Enhanced slider with auto/reset functionality - AdvanceLineEdit: Labeled line edit widget - AdvanceCheckBox: Labeled checkbox widget

The views handle user interaction events and delegate business logic to their associated controllers while providing visual feedback and real-time parameter adjustment capabilities.

   1# uHDR: HDR image editing software
   2#   Copyright (C) 2021  remi cozot 
   3#
   4#    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
   5#    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
   6#    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
   7#    (at your option) any later version.
   8#
   9#    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
  10#    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
  11#    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
  12#    GNU General Public License for more details.
  13#
  14# hdrCore project 2020
  15# author: remi.cozot@univ-littoral.fr
  16
  17
  18
  19# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  20# --- Package hdrGUI ---------------------------------------------------------
  21# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22"""
  23guiQt.view module: PyQt5 view components for uHDR GUI application.
  24
  25This module implements the View component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC)
  26architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains PyQt5 widgets and interfaces
  27that handle user interaction and visual presentation of HDR image editing tools.
  28
  29The module provides:
  30- Main application window with menu system and docking
  31- Image gallery with grid layout and pagination  
  32- HDR image editing controls and parameter adjustment
  33- Tone curve editing with B-spline visualization
  34- Color space editing in LCH coordinates
  35- Lightness masking for selective adjustments
  36- Geometry transformation controls
  37- Image information and metadata display
  38- Aesthetics analysis visualization
  39- HDR display and external monitor support
  40
  41Key View Classes:
  42    - AppView: Main application window with menus and docking
  43    - ImageGalleryView: Grid-based image gallery with pagination
  44    - EditImageView: Complete HDR editing interface
  45    - ImageInfoView: Image metadata and information display
  46    - ToneCurveView: B-spline tone curve editing with matplotlib
  47    - LchColorSelectorView: LCH color space selection interface
  48    - HDRviewerView: HDR display controls and preview
  49    - ImageAestheticsView: Color palette and aesthetics visualization
  50
  51Widget Utilities:
  52    - ImageWidgetView: Basic image display widget
  53    - FigureWidget: Matplotlib integration for curve editing
  54    - AdvanceSliderView: Enhanced slider with auto/reset functionality
  55    - AdvanceLineEdit: Labeled line edit widget
  56    - AdvanceCheckBox: Labeled checkbox widget
  57
  58The views handle user interaction events and delegate business logic
  59to their associated controllers while providing visual feedback and
  60real-time parameter adjustment capabilities.
  61"""
  62
  63# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  64# --- Import ------------------------------------------------------------------
  65# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  66from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QWidget, QLabel, QApplication, QMainWindow, QSplitter, QFrame, QDockWidget, QDesktopWidget
  67from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QSplitter, QFrame, QSlider, QCheckBox, QGroupBox
  68from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QHBoxLayout, QVBoxLayout, QGridLayout, QLayout, QScrollArea, QFormLayout
  69from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QPushButton, QTextEdit,QLineEdit, QComboBox, QSpinBox
  70from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QAction, QProgressBar, QDialog
  71from PyQt5.QtGui import QPixmap, QImage, QDoubleValidator
  72from PyQt5.QtCore import Qt
  73from PyQt5 import QtCore, QtWidgets 
  74
  75from matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg import FigureCanvasQTAgg as FigureCanvas
  76from matplotlib.figure import Figure
  77
  78from datetime import datetime
  79import time
  80
  81import numpy as np
  82import hdrCore.image, hdrCore.processing
  83import math, enum
  84import functools
  85
  86from . import controller, model
  87import hdrCore.metadata
  88import preferences.preferences as pref
  89
  90# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  91# --- class ImageWidgetView(QWidget) -------------------------------------------------------
  92# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  93class ImageWidgetView(QWidget):
  94    """
  95    Basic image display widget for showing numpy arrays or HDR images.
  96    
  97    Provides a simple image viewer widget that can display color data
  98    as QPixmap with automatic scaling and aspect ratio preservation.
  99    Handles clipping and conversion from floating-point HDR data to
 100    8-bit RGB for Qt display.
 101    
 102    Attributes:
 103        - controller: Reference to controlling ImageWidgetController
 104        - label (QLabel): Qt label widget for pixmap display
 105        - imagePixmap (QPixmap): Current pixmap for display
 106    """
 107
 108    def __init__(self,controller,colorData = None):
 109        """
 110        Initialize image widget view.
 111        
 112        Args:
 113            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
 114            colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display
 115        """
 116        super().__init__()
 117        self.controller = controller
 118        self.label = QLabel(self)   # create a QtLabel for pixmap
 119        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
 120        # self.colorData = colorData  # image content attributes           
 121        self.setPixmap(colorData)  
 122
 123    def resize(self):
 124        """
 125        Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.
 126        
 127        Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget
 128        while preserving aspect ratio.
 129        """
 130        self.label.resize(self.size())
 131        self.label.setPixmap(self.imagePixmap.scaled(self.size(),Qt.KeepAspectRatio))
 132
 133    def resizeEvent(self,event):
 134        """
 135        Handle Qt resize events.
 136        
 137        Args:
 138            event: Qt resize event object
 139        """
 140        self.resize()
 141        super().resizeEvent(event)
 142
 143    def setPixmap(self,colorData):
 144        """
 145        Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.
 146        
 147        Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.
 148        Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.
 149        
 150        Args:
 151            colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)
 152            
 153        Returns:
 154            QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display
 155        """
 156        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): 
 157            colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
 158        # self.colorData = colorData
 159        height, width, channel = colorData.shape   # compute pixmap
 160        bytesPerLine = channel * width
 161        # clip
 162        colorData[colorData>1.0] = 1.0
 163        colorData[colorData<0.0] = 0.0
 164
 165        qImg = QImage((colorData*255).astype(np.uint8), width, height, bytesPerLine, QImage.Format_RGB888) # QImage
 166        self.imagePixmap = QPixmap.fromImage(qImg)
 167        self.resize()
 168
 169        return self.imagePixmap
 170
 171    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 172        """
 173        Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.
 174        
 175        Args:
 176            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display
 177        """
 178        self.imagePixmap = qPixmap
 179        self.resize()
 180
 181    def emptyImageColorData(): 
 182        """
 183        Generate default placeholder image for empty display.
 184        
 185        Returns:
 186            numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3) 
 187        """
 188        return np.ones((90,160,3))*(220/255) 
 189# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 190# --- class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas ------------------------------------------------------
 191# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 192class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas):
 193    """
 194    Matplotlib figure widget for embedding plots in Qt interface.
 195    
 196    Provides matplotlib integration for displaying curves, histograms,
 197    and other plots within the Qt GUI. Used primarily for tone curve
 198    visualization and editing.
 199    
 200    Attributes:
 201        - fig (Figure): Matplotlib figure object
 202        - axes: Matplotlib axes for plotting
 203    """
 204
 205    def __init__(self, parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100):
 206        """
 207        Initialize matplotlib figure widget.
 208        
 209        Args:
 210            parent: Parent Qt widget
 211            width (int): Figure width in inches
 212            height (int): Figure height in inches
 213            dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch
 214        """
 215        # create Figure
 216        self.fig = Figure(figsize=(width, height), dpi=dpi)
 217        self.axes = self.fig.add_subplot(111)
 218        FigureCanvas.__init__(self, self.fig)    # explicite call of super constructor
 219        self.setParent(parent)
 220        FigureCanvas.updateGeometry(self)
 221        self.setMinimumSize(200, 200)
 222
 223    def plot(self,X,Y,mode, clear=False):
 224        """
 225        Draw line plot with specified data and style.
 226        
 227        Args:
 228            X (array-like): X-coordinate data points
 229            Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points
 230            mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-')
 231            clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing
 232        """
 233        if clear: self.axes.clear()
 234        self.axes.plot(X,Y,mode)
 235        try:
 236            self.fig.canvas.draw()
 237        except Exception:
 238            time.sleep(0.5)
 239            self.fig.canvas.draw()
 240
 241# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 242# --- class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter) ----------------------------------------------------
 243# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 244class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter):
 245    """
 246    Grid-based image gallery with pagination and navigation controls.
 247    
 248    Displays multiple images in a configurable grid layout with pagination
 249    support for large image collections. Provides interactive navigation
 250    buttons and supports different grid configurations (1x1, 3x2, 6x4, 9x6).
 251    
 252    Layout Structure:
 253        +-------------------------------------------+
 254        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | \
 255        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 256        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 257        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 258        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 259        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 260        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |   >   GridLayout
 261        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 262        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 263        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 264        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 265        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | /
 266        +-------------------------------------------+  <    splitter
 267        | [<] [1x1][3x2][6x4][9x6][page number] [>] |       [pushButton] HorizontalLayout
 268        +-------------------------------------------+
 269    
 270    Attributes:
 271        - controller: Reference to ImageGalleryController
 272        - shapeMode: Current grid layout mode (GalleryMode enum)
 273        - pageNumber (int): Current page index (0-based)
 274        - imagesControllers (list): List of ImageWidgetController instances
 275        - images (QFrame): Frame containing image grid
 276        - imagesLayout (QGridLayout): Grid layout for images
 277        - buttons (QWidget): Navigation button container
 278        - pageNumberLabel (QLabel): Current page display
 279    """
 280    def __init__(self,controller_=None,shapeMode=None):
 281        """
 282        Initialize image gallery view.
 283        
 284        Args:
 285            controller_: Parent ImageGalleryController instance
 286            shapeMode: Initial grid layout mode (defaults to 3x2)
 287        """
 288        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.__init__(",")")
 289
 290        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
 291
 292        self.controller= controller_
 293        self.shapeMode = controller.GalleryMode._3x2 if not shapeMode else shapeMode    # default display mode 
 294        self.pageNumber =0
 295
 296        self.imagesControllers = []
 297
 298        self.images = QFrame()
 299        self.images.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
 300        self.imagesLayout = QGridLayout()
 301        self.images.setLayout(self.imagesLayout)
 302
 303        self.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 304
 305        self.previousPageButton =   QPushButton('<')
 306        self.previousPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_previousPage)
 307        self._1x1Button =           QPushButton('1x1')
 308        self._1x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_1x1)
 309        self._2x1Button =           QPushButton('2x1')
 310        self._2x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_2x1)
 311        self._3x2Button =           QPushButton('3x2')
 312        self._3x2Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_3x2)
 313        self._6x4Button =           QPushButton('6x4')
 314        self._6x4Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_6x4)
 315        self._9x6Button =           QPushButton('9x6')
 316        self._9x6Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_9x6)
 317        self.nextPageButton =       QPushButton('>')
 318        self.nextPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_nextPage)
 319
 320        self.pageNumberLabel = QLabel(str(self.pageNumber)+"/ ...")
 321
 322        self.buttons = QWidget()
 323        self.buttonsLayout = QHBoxLayout()
 324        self.buttons.setLayout(self.buttonsLayout)
 325        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.previousPageButton)
 326        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._1x1Button)
 327        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._2x1Button)
 328        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._3x2Button)
 329        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._6x4Button)
 330        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._9x6Button)
 331        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.nextPageButton)
 332
 333        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.pageNumberLabel)
 334
 335        self.addWidget(self.images)
 336        self.addWidget(self.buttons)
 337        self.setSizes([1525,82])
 338
 339    def currentPage(self): 
 340        """
 341        Get current page number.
 342        
 343        Returns:
 344            int: Current page index (0-based)
 345        """
 346        return self.pageNumber
 347
 348    def changePageNumber(self,step):
 349        """
 350        Navigate to different page with wraparound.
 351        
 352        Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic
 353        wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.
 354        
 355        Args:
 356            step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)
 357        """
 358        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(",step,")")
 359
 360        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
 361        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
 362
 363        if len(self.controller.model.processPipes) > 0 :
 364
 365            oldPageNumber = self.pageNumber
 366            if (self.pageNumber+step) > maxPage-1:
 367                self.pageNumber = 0
 368            elif (self.pageNumber+step) <0:
 369                self.pageNumber = maxPage-1
 370            else:
 371                self.pageNumber  = self.pageNumber+step
 372            self.updateImages()
 373            self.controller.model.loadPage(self.pageNumber)
 374            if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(currentPage:",self.pageNumber," | max page:",maxPage,")")
 375
 376    def updateImages(self):
 377        """
 378        Refresh image display for current page.
 379        
 380        Updates all image widgets in the grid with placeholder content
 381        and refreshes the page number display. Actual images are loaded
 382        asynchronously by the model.
 383        """
 384        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImages(",")")
 385
 386        """ update images content """
 387        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
 388        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
 389        
 390        index=0
 391        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
 392            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
 393                # get image controllers                                                                                         
 394                iwc = self.imagesControllers[index]
 395                iwc.view.setPixmap(ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData())                                                 
 396                index +=1                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 397        self.pageNumberLabel.setText(str(self.pageNumber)+"/"+str(maxPage-1))
 398
 399    def updateImage(self, idx, processPipe, filename):
 400        """
 401        Update specific image in grid with loaded content.
 402        
 403        Args:
 404            idx (int): Index of image within current page
 405            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Loaded image processing pipeline
 406            filename (str): Image filename for status display
 407        """
 408        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImage(",")")
 409        imageWidgetController = self.imagesControllers[idx]                                 
 410        imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
 411        self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("loading of image "+filename+" done!")
 412
 413    def resetGridLayoutWidgets(self):
 414        """
 415        Clear current grid layout widgets.
 416        
 417        Removes all image widgets from the grid layout and cleans up
 418        memory by deleting widget references.
 419        """
 420        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.resetGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
 421
 422        for w in self.imagesControllers:
 423            self.imagesLayout.removeWidget(w.view)
 424            w.view.deleteLater()
 425        self.imagesControllers = []
 426
 427    def buildGridLayoutWidgets(self):
 428        """
 429        Create new grid layout widgets based on current shape mode.
 430        
 431        Generates ImageWidgetController instances for each position in
 432        the grid and adds them to the layout with proper positioning.
 433        """
 434        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.buildGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
 435
 436        imageIndex = 0
 437        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
 438            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
 439                iwc = controller.ImageWidgetController(id=imageIndex)
 440                self.imagesControllers.append(iwc)
 441                self.imagesLayout.addWidget(iwc.view,i,j)
 442                imageIndex +=1
 443
 444    def wheelEvent(self, event):
 445        """
 446        Handle mouse wheel navigation between pages.
 447        
 448        Args:
 449            event: Qt wheel event with scroll direction
 450        """
 451        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.wheelEvent(",")")
 452
 453        if event.angleDelta().y() < 0 :     
 454            self.changePageNumber(+1)
 455            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
 456                self.controller.selectImage(0)
 457
 458        else :                              
 459            self.changePageNumber(-1)
 460            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
 461                self.controller.selectImage(0)
 462        event.accept()
 463
 464    def mousePressEvent(self,event):
 465        """
 466        Handle image selection clicks.
 467        
 468        Determines which image was clicked based on mouse position
 469        and notifies the controller for selection handling.
 470        
 471        Args:
 472            event: Qt mouse press event with position
 473        """
 474        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.mousePressEvent(",")")
 475
 476        # self.childAt(event.pos()) return QLabel .parent() should be ImageWidget object
 477        if isinstance(self.childAt(event.pos()).parent(),ImageWidgetView):
 478            id = self.childAt(event.pos()).parent().controller.id()
 479        else:
 480            id = -1
 481
 482        if id != -1: # an image is clicked select it!
 483            self.controller.selectImage(id)
 484        event.accept()
 485# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 486# --- class AppView(QMainWindow) -----------------------------------------------------------
 487# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 488class AppView(QMainWindow):
 489    """
 490    Main application window for uHDR HDR image editing software.
 491    
 492    Provides the primary user interface for uHDR with comprehensive menu system,
 493    dockable panels, and central image gallery. Manages window geometry, screen
 494    configuration, and application-wide functionality including file operations,
 495    HDR display management, and export capabilities.
 496    
 497    Window Structure:
 498    - Central Widget: Image gallery with pagination
 499    - Right Dock: Multi-panel interface (Edit/Info/Aesthetics)
 500    - Menu Bar: File, Display HDR, Export, Dock, Preferences
 501    - Status Bar: Real-time operation feedback
 502    
 503    Attributes:
 504        - controller (AppController): Parent application controller
 505        - imageGalleryController (ImageGalleryController): Central gallery management
 506        - dock (MultiDockController): Right panel controller
 507        - topContainer (QWidget): Central widget container
 508        - menuExport (QAction): Export menu action reference
 509        - menuExportAll (QAction): Export all menu action reference
 510    """
 511    def __init__(self, _controller = None, shapeMode=None, HDRcontroller=None):
 512        """
 513        Initialize main application window.
 514        
 515        Args:
 516            _controller (AppController): Parent application controller
 517            shapeMode: Initial gallery layout mode
 518            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller reference
 519        """
 520        super().__init__()
 521        # --------------------
 522        scale = 0.8
 523        # --------------------   
 524        # attributes
 525        self.controller = _controller
 526        self.setWindowGeometry(scale=scale)
 527        self.setWindowTitle('uHDR - Rémi Cozot (c) 2020-2021')      # title  
 528        self.statusBar().showMessage('Welcome to uHDR!')         # status bar
 529
 530        self.topContainer = QWidget()
 531        self.topLayout = QHBoxLayout()
 532
 533        self.imageGalleryController = controller.ImageGalleryController(self)
 534
 535        self.topLayout.addWidget(self.imageGalleryController.view)
 536
 537        self.topContainer.setLayout(self.topLayout)
 538        self.setCentralWidget(self.topContainer)
 539        # ----------------------------------
 540        self.dock = controller.MultiDockController(self, HDRcontroller)
 541        self.addDockWidget(Qt.RightDockWidgetArea,self.dock.view)
 542        self.resizeDocks([self.dock.view],[int(self.controller.screenSize[0].width()*scale//4)],Qt.Horizontal)
 543
 544        # ----------------------------------
 545        # build menu
 546        self.buildFileMenu()
 547        self.buildDockMenu()
 548        self.buildDisplayHDR()
 549        self.buildExport()
 550        self.buildPreferences()
 551    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 552    def getImageGalleryController(self): 
 553        """
 554        Get reference to the central image gallery controller.
 555        
 556        Returns:
 557            ImageGalleryController: Central gallery management controller
 558        """
 559        return self.imageGalleryController
 560    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 561    def resizeEvent(self, event): 
 562        """
 563        Handle Qt window resize events.
 564        
 565        Args:
 566            event: Qt resize event object
 567        """
 568        super().resizeEvent(event)
 569    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 570    def setWindowGeometry(self, scale=0.8):
 571        """
 572        Configure window size and position based on available displays.
 573        
 574        Automatically detects multiple displays and positions window on
 575        secondary display if available, otherwise uses primary display.
 576        
 577        Args:
 578            scale (float): Window scaling factor (default 0.8)
 579        """
 580        displayCoord = QDesktopWidget().screenGeometry(1)
 581        if len(self.controller.screenSize) > 1:
 582            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[1].width(), self.controller.screenSize[1].height()
 583        else:
 584            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[0].width(), self.controller.screenSize[0].height()
 585
 586        self.setGeometry(displayCoord.left(), displayCoord.top()+50, math.floor(width*scale), math.floor(height*scale))
 587        self.showMaximized()
 588    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 589    def buildFileMenu(self):
 590        """
 591        Create file operations menu with directory selection, save, and quit.
 592        
 593        Menu Items:
 594        - Select directory (Ctrl+O): Choose working directory
 595        - Save (Ctrl+S): Save ProcessPipe metadata 
 596        - Quit (Ctrl+Q): Exit application with cleanup
 597        """
 598        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 599        fileMenu = menubar.addMenu('&File')# file menu
 600
 601        selectDir = QAction('&Select directory', self)        
 602        selectDir.setShortcut('Ctrl+O')
 603        selectDir.setStatusTip('[File] select a directory')
 604        selectDir.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSelectDir)
 605        fileMenu.addAction(selectDir)
 606
 607        selectSave = QAction('&Save', self)        
 608        selectSave.setShortcut('Ctrl+S')
 609        selectSave.setStatusTip('[File] saving processpipe metadata')
 610        selectSave.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSave)
 611        fileMenu.addAction(selectSave)
 612
 613        quit = QAction('&Quit', self)        
 614        quit.setShortcut('Ctrl+Q')
 615        quit.setStatusTip('[File] saving updates and quit')
 616        quit.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackQuit)
 617        fileMenu.addAction(quit)
 618    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    
 619    def buildPreferences(self):
 620        """
 621        Create HDR display preferences menu with dynamic display selection.
 622        
 623        Automatically generates menu items for each configured HDR display
 624        from preferences, allowing runtime switching between different HDR
 625        monitor configurations.
 626        """
 627
 628        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 629        prefMenu = menubar.addMenu('&Preferences')# file menu
 630
 631        displayList = pref.getHDRdisplays().keys()
 632
 633        # function for callback
 634        def cbd(tag): 
 635            pref.setHDRdisplay(tag)
 636            self.statusBar().showMessage("swithcing HDR Display to: "+tag+"!")
 637            self.menuExport.setText('&Export to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])
 638            self.menuExportAll.setText('&Export All to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])        
 639
 640        prefDisplays = []
 641        for i,d in enumerate(displayList):
 642            if d != 'none':
 643                prefDisplay = QAction('&Set display to '+d, self) 
 644                p_cbd = functools.partial(cbd, d)
 645                prefDisplay.triggered.connect(p_cbd)
 646                prefMenu.addAction(prefDisplay)
 647
 648    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 649    def buildDisplayHDR(self):
 650        """
 651        Create HDR display menu for real-time preview and comparison.
 652        
 653        Menu Items:
 654        - Display HDR image (Ctrl+H): Show on HDR monitor
 655        - Compare raw and edited (Ctrl+C): Side-by-side comparison
 656        - Reset HDR display (Ctrl+K): Clear HDR preview
 657        """
 658        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 659        displayHDRmenu = menubar.addMenu('&Display HDR')# file menu
 660
 661        displayHDR = QAction('&Display HDR image', self)        
 662        displayHDR.setShortcut('Ctrl+H')
 663        displayHDR.setStatusTip('[Display HDR] display HDR image')
 664        displayHDR.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackDisplayHDR)
 665        displayHDRmenu.addAction(displayHDR)
 666        # ------------------------------------
 667        displayHDR = QAction('&Compare raw and edited HDR image', self)        
 668        displayHDR.setShortcut('Ctrl+C')
 669        displayHDR.setStatusTip('[Display HDR] compare raw HDR image and edited one')
 670        displayHDR.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackCompareRawEditedHDR)
 671        displayHDRmenu.addAction(displayHDR)
 672        # ------------------------------------
 673        closeHDR = QAction('&reset HDR display', self)        
 674        closeHDR.setShortcut('Ctrl+K')
 675        closeHDR.setStatusTip('[Display HDR] reset HDR window')
 676        closeHDR.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackCloseDisplayHDR)
 677        displayHDRmenu.addAction(closeHDR)
 678    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
 679    def buildExport(self):
 680        """
 681        Create export menu for saving processed HDR images.
 682        
 683        Menu Items:
 684        - Export to [display] (Ctrl+X): Export current image for HDR display
 685        - Export All to [display] (Ctrl+Y): Batch export all images
 686        
 687        Display target automatically updates based on preferences selection.
 688        """
 689        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 690        exportHDR = menubar.addMenu('&Export HDR image')# file menu
 691
 692        self.menuExport = QAction('&Export to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'], self)        
 693        self.menuExport.setShortcut('Ctrl+X')
 694        self.menuExport.setStatusTip('[Export HDR image] save HDR image file for HDR display')
 695        self.menuExport.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackExportHDR)
 696        exportHDR.addAction(self.menuExport)
 697
 698        self.menuExportAll = QAction('&Export All to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'], self)        
 699        self.menuExportAll.setShortcut('Ctrl+Y')
 700        self.menuExportAll.setStatusTip('[Export all HDR images] save HDR image files for HDR display.')
 701        self.menuExportAll.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackExportAllHDR)
 702        exportHDR.addAction(self.menuExportAll)
 703    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------        
 704    def buildDockMenu(self):
 705        """
 706        Create dock panel switching menu for right-side interface.
 707        
 708        Menu Items:
 709        - Info and Metadata (Ctrl+I): Image information panel
 710        - Edit (Ctrl+E): HDR editing controls panel  
 711        - Image Aesthetics (Ctrl+A): Aesthetics analysis panel
 712        """
 713        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 714        dockMenu = menubar.addMenu('&Dock')# file menu
 715
 716        info = QAction('&Info. and Metadata', self)        
 717        info.setShortcut('Ctrl+I')
 718        info.setStatusTip('[Dock] image information dock')
 719        info.triggered.connect(self.dock.activateINFO)
 720        dockMenu.addAction(info)
 721
 722        edit = QAction('&Edit', self)        
 723        edit.setShortcut('Ctrl+E')
 724        edit.setStatusTip('[Dock] image editing dock')
 725        edit.triggered.connect(self.dock.activateEDIT)
 726        dockMenu.addAction(edit)
 727
 728        iqa = QAction('&Image Aesthetics', self)        
 729        iqa.setShortcut('Ctrl+A')
 730        iqa.setStatusTip('[Dock] image aesthetics dock')
 731        iqa.triggered.connect(self.dock.activateMIAM)
 732        dockMenu.addAction(iqa)
 733    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 734    def closeEvent(self, event):
 735        """
 736        Handle application shutdown with proper cleanup.
 737        
 738        Saves all ProcessPipe metadata and closes HDR display before exit.
 739        
 740        Args:
 741            event: Qt close event
 742        """
 743        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppView.closeEvent()>> ... closing")
 744        self.imageGalleryController.save()
 745        self.controller.hdrDisplay.close()
 746# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 747# --- class ImageInfoView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------------
 748# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 749class ImageInfoView(QSplitter):
 750    """
 751    Image information and metadata display panel.
 752    
 753    Provides comprehensive display of image metadata including EXIF data,
 754    technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Supports interactive editing
 755    of custom metadata fields for workflow management and image classification.
 756    
 757    Layout Structure:
 758    - Top: Image preview widget
 759    - Bottom: Scrollable metadata form with:
 760      * Technical metadata (name, path, size, dynamic range, etc.)
 761      * EXIF data (exposure, ISO, camera, lens, etc.)
 762      * User-defined workflow tags (organized by groups)
 763    
 764    Attributes:
 765        - controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller reference
 766        - imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
 767        - layout (QFormLayout): Metadata fields layout
 768        - imageName, imagePath, imageSize, etc.: Technical metadata widgets
 769        - userDefinedTags (list[AdvanceCheckBox]): Custom metadata checkboxes
 770        - scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for metadata fields
 771    """
 772    def __init__(self, _controller):
 773        """
 774        Initialize image info view with metadata form.
 775        
 776        Args:
 777            _controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller instance
 778        """
 779        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.__init__(",")")
 780
 781        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
 782
 783        self.controller = _controller
 784
 785        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
 786
 787        self.layout = QFormLayout()
 788
 789        # ---------------------------------------------------
 790        self.imageName =            AdvanceLineEdit(" name:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 791        self.imagePath =            AdvanceLineEdit(" path:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 792        self.imageSize =            AdvanceLineEdit(" size (pixel):", ".... x .... ",   self.layout, callBack=None)
 793        self.imageDynamicRange =    AdvanceLineEdit(" dynamic range (f-stops)", " ........ ", self.layout, callBack=None)
 794        self.colorSpace =           AdvanceLineEdit(" color space:", " ........ ",      self.layout, callBack=None)
 795        self.imageType =            AdvanceLineEdit(" type:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)                     
 796        self.imageBPS =             AdvanceLineEdit(" bits per sample:", " ........ ",  self.layout, callBack=None)
 797        self.imageExpoTime =        AdvanceLineEdit(" exposure time:", " ........ ",    self.layout, callBack=None)
 798        self.imageFNumber =         AdvanceLineEdit("f-number:", " ........ ",          self.layout, callBack=None)          
 799        self.imageISO =             AdvanceLineEdit(" ISO:", " ........ ",              self.layout, callBack=None)           
 800        self.imageCamera =          AdvanceLineEdit(" camera:", " ........ ",           self.layout, callBack=None)      
 801        self.imageSoftware =        AdvanceLineEdit(" software:", " ........ ",         self.layout, callBack=None)      
 802        self.imageLens =            AdvanceLineEdit(" lens:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 803        self.imageFocalLength =     AdvanceLineEdit(" focal length:", " ........ ",     self.layout, callBack=None)
 804        # ---------------------------------------------------
 805        # ---------------------------------------------------
 806        line = QFrame()
 807        line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
 808        self.layout.addRow(line)
 809        # ---------------------------------------------------
 810        #  user defined tags
 811        # --------------------------------------------------
 812        userDefinedTags = hdrCore.metadata.tags()
 813        tagRootName = userDefinedTags.getTagsRootName()
 814        listOfTags = userDefinedTags.tags[tagRootName]
 815        self.userDefinedTags = []
 816        for tagGroup in listOfTags:
 817            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
 818            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
 819            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
 820                self.userDefinedTags.append( AdvanceCheckBox(self,groupKey, tag[0], False, self.layout))
 821            line = QFrame()
 822            line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
 823            self.layout.addRow(line)
 824        # --------------------------------------------------
 825
 826
 827        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
 828
 829        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
 830        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
 831        self.container = QLabel()
 832        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
 833        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
 834        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
 835
 836        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
 837        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
 838        self.setSizes([60,40])
 839
 840    def setProcessPipe(self,processPipe): 
 841        """
 842        Update display with new image and populate all metadata fields.
 843        
 844        Extracts comprehensive metadata from the ProcessPipe's image including
 845        EXIF data, technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Updates all
 846        form fields and checkboxes to reflect current image state.
 847        
 848        Args:
 849            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image with metadata
 850            
 851        Returns:
 852            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
 853        """
 854        image_ = processPipe.getImage()
 855        # ---------------------------------------------------
 856        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.setImage(",image_.name,")")
 857        if image_.metadata.metadata['filename'] != None: self.imageName.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['filename'])
 858        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
 859        if image_.metadata.metadata['path'] != None: self.imagePath.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['path'])
 860        else: self.imagePath.setText(" ........ ")
 861        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'] != None: self.imageSize.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'])+" x "+ str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Height']))
 862        else: self.imageSize.setText(" ........ ")
 863        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)'] != None: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)']))
 864        else: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(" ........ ")
 865        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'] != None: self.colorSpace.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'])
 866        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
 867        if image_.type != None: self.imageType.setText(str(image_.type))       
 868        else: self.colorSpace.setText(" ........ ")
 869        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample'] != None: self.imageBPS.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample']))
 870        else: self.imageBPS.setText(" ........ ")
 871        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'] != None: self.imageExpoTime.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][0])+" / " + str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][1]))
 872        else: self.imageExpoTime.setText(" ........ ")
 873        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'] != None: self.imageFNumber.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'][0]))    
 874        else: self.imageFNumber.setText(" ........ ")
 875        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO'] != None: self.imageISO.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO']))       
 876        else: self.imageISO.setText(" ........ ")
 877        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'] != None: self.imageCamera.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'])      
 878        else: self.imageCamera.setText(" ........ ")
 879        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'] != None: self.imageSoftware.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'])      
 880        else: self.imageSoftware.setText(" ........ ")
 881        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'] != None: self.imageLens.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'])
 882        else: self.imageLens.setText(" ........ ")
 883        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'] != None: self.imageFocalLength.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'][0]))
 884        else: self.imageFocalLength.setText(" ........ ")
 885        # ---------------------------------------------------
 886        self.controller.callBackActive = False
 887        # ---------------------------------------------------
 888        tagRootName = image_.metadata.otherTags.getTagsRootName()
 889        listOfTags = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName]
 890
 891        for i,tagGroup in enumerate(listOfTags):
 892            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
 893            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
 894            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
 895                # find advanced checkbox
 896                for acb in self.userDefinedTags:
 897                    if (acb.rightText ==tag[0] ) and (acb.leftText== groupKey):
 898                        on_off = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName][i][groupKey][tag[0]]
 899                        on_off = on_off if on_off else False
 900                        acb.setState(on_off)
 901                        break  
 902        # ---------------------------------------------------        
 903        self.controller.callBackActive = True
 904        # ---------------------------------------------------
 905        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image_)
 906
 907    def metadataChange(self,metaGroup,metaTag, on_off): 
 908        """
 909        Handle user changes to custom metadata tags.
 910        
 911        Args:
 912            metaGroup (str): Metadata group name
 913            metaTag (str): Specific tag name
 914            on_off (bool): New tag state
 915        """
 916        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.metadataChange(metaGroup,metaTag, on_off)
 917# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 918# --- class AdvanceLineEdit(object) --------------------------------------------------------
 919# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 920class AdvanceLineEdit(object):
 921    """
 922    Enhanced line edit widget with label for metadata display.
 923    
 924    Provides a labeled text input widget optimized for displaying and
 925    potentially editing metadata values in forms. Includes automatic
 926    layout management and optional change callbacks.
 927    
 928    Attributes:
 929        - label (QLabel): Display label for the field
 930        - lineEdit (QLineEdit): Text input widget
 931    """
 932    def __init__(self, labelName, defaultText, layout, callBack=None):
 933        """
 934        Initialize labeled line edit widget.
 935        
 936        Args:
 937            labelName (str): Display label text
 938            defaultText (str): Initial/default text value
 939            layout (QFormLayout): Parent layout to add widget to
 940            callBack (function, optional): Text change callback function
 941        """
 942        self.label = QLabel(labelName)
 943        self.lineEdit =QLineEdit(defaultText)
 944        if callBack: self.lineEdit.textChanged.connect(callBack)
 945        layout.addRow(self.label,self.lineEdit)
 946
 947    def setText(self, txt): 
 948        """
 949        Update the displayed text value.
 950        
 951        Args:
 952            txt (str): New text to display
 953        """
 954        self.lineEdit.setText(txt)
 955# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 956# --- class AdvanceCheckBox(object) --------------------------------------------------------
 957# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 958class AdvanceCheckBox(object):
 959    """
 960    Enhanced checkbox widget with label for metadata editing.
 961    
 962    Provides a labeled checkbox widget optimized for editing user-defined
 963    metadata tags. Supports callback functionality for metadata updates
 964    and automatic layout management.
 965    
 966    Attributes:
 967        - parent (ImageInfoView): Parent view for callback delegation
 968        - leftText (str): Left label text (group name)
 969        - rightText (str): Right label text (tag name)
 970        - label (QLabel): Display label widget
 971        - checkbox (QCheckBox): Checkbox control
 972    """
 973    def __init__(self, parent, leftText, rightText, defaultValue, layout):
 974        """
 975        Initialize labeled checkbox widget.
 976        
 977        Args:
 978            parent (ImageInfoView): Parent view for callbacks
 979            leftText (str): Left label text (metadata group)
 980            rightText (str): Right label text (metadata tag)
 981            defaultValue (bool): Initial checkbox state
 982            layout (QFormLayout): Parent layout to add widget to
 983        """
 984        self.parent = parent
 985
 986        self.leftText = leftText
 987        self.rightText = rightText
 988
 989        self.label = QLabel(leftText)
 990        self.checkbox =QCheckBox(rightText)
 991        self.checkbox.toggled.connect(self.toggled)
 992        layout.addRow(self.label,self.checkbox)
 993
 994    def setState(self, on_off): 
 995        """
 996        Set checkbox checked state.
 997        
 998        Args:
 999            on_off (bool): New checked state
1000        """
1001        self.checkbox.setChecked(on_off)
1002
1003    def toggled(self): 
1004        """
1005        Handle checkbox state changes and notify parent.
1006        """
1007        self.parent.metadataChange(self.leftText, self.rightText, self.checkbox.isChecked())
1008# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1009# --- class EditImageView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------------
1010# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1011class EditImageView(QSplitter):
1012    """
1013    Comprehensive HDR image editing interface with all editing controls.
1014    
1015    Provides the complete HDR editing interface with real-time preview and
1016    extensive parameter controls. Includes exposure, contrast, tone curves,
1017    color editing, geometry transformations, and HDR preview capabilities.
1018    
1019    Layout Structure:
1020    - Top: Image preview showing real-time edits
1021    - Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
1022      * Basic adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1023      * Advanced tone curve with B-spline control points
1024      * Lightness masking for selective editing
1025      * Five independent color editors in LCH space
1026      * Automatic color selection tools
1027      * Geometry transformations (rotation, cropping)
1028      * HDR preview controls
1029    
1030    Attributes:
1031        - controller (EditImageController): Parent controller reference
1032        - imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
1033        - exposure, contrast, saturation (AdvanceSliderController): Basic adjustment controls
1034        - tonecurve (ToneCurveController): B-spline tone curve editor
1035        - lightnessmask (LightnessMaskController): Tone range masking
1036        - colorEditor0-4 (LchColorSelectorController): Independent color editors
1037        - colorEditorsAuto (ColorEditorsAutoController): Automatic color selection
1038        - geometry (GeometryController): Rotation and cropping controls
1039        - hdrPreview (HDRviewerView): HDR display preview interface
1040        - scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for all controls
1041    """
1042
1043    def __init__(self, _controller, build=False):
1044        """
1045        Initialize comprehensive HDR editing interface.
1046        
1047        Creates all editing controls and sets up the scrollable interface
1048        with proper callback connections for real-time parameter updates.
1049        
1050        Args:
1051            _controller (EditImageController): Parent controller instance
1052            build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction
1053        """
1054        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.__init__(",")")
1055        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
1056
1057        self.controller = _controller
1058
1059        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1060
1061        self.layout = QVBoxLayout()
1062
1063        # exposure ----------------------
1064        self.exposure = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "exposure",0,(-10,+10),0.25)
1065        # call back functions
1066        self.exposure.callBackAutoPush = self.autoExposure
1067        self.exposure.callBackValueChange = self.changeExposure
1068        self.layout.addWidget(self.exposure.view)
1069
1070        # contrast ----------------------
1071        self.contrast = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "contrast",0,(-100,+100),1)
1072        # call back functions
1073        self.contrast.callBackAutoPush = self.autoContrast
1074        self.contrast.callBackValueChange = self.changeContrast
1075        self.layout.addWidget(self.contrast.view)
1076
1077        # tonecurve ----------------------
1078        self.tonecurve = controller.ToneCurveController(self)        
1079        self.layout.addWidget(self.tonecurve.view)                   
1080
1081        # mask ----------------------
1082        self.lightnessmask = controller.LightnessMaskController(self)        
1083        self.layout.addWidget(self.lightnessmask.view)                   
1084 
1085        # saturation ----------------------
1086        self.saturation = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "saturation",0,(-100,+100),1)
1087        # call back functions
1088        self.saturation.callBackAutoPush = self.autoSaturation
1089        self.saturation.callBackValueChange = self.changeSaturation
1090        self.layout.addWidget(self.saturation.view)
1091
1092        # color0 ----------------------
1093        self.colorEditor0 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor0")
1094        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor0.view)
1095
1096        # color1 ----------------------
1097        self.colorEditor1 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor1")
1098        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor1.view)
1099
1100        # color2 ----------------------
1101        self.colorEditor2 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor2")
1102        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor2.view)
1103
1104        # color3 ----------------------
1105        self.colorEditor3 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor3")
1106        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor3.view)
1107
1108        # color1 ----------------------
1109        self.colorEditor4 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor4")
1110        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor4.view)
1111
1112        # auto color selection ----------------------
1113        # -----
1114        self.colorEditorsAuto = controller.ColorEditorsAutoController(self,
1115                                                                      [self.colorEditor0,
1116                                                                       self.colorEditor1,
1117                                                                       self.colorEditor2,
1118                                                                       self.colorEditor3,
1119                                                                       self.colorEditor4],
1120                                                                       "saturation")
1121        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditorsAuto.view)
1122        # -----
1123
1124        # geometry ----------------------
1125        self.geometry = controller.GeometryController(self)
1126        self.layout.addWidget(self.geometry.view)
1127
1128        # hdr preview ----------------------
1129        self.hdrPreview = HDRviewerView(self.controller.controllerHDR, build)
1130        self.controller.controllerHDR.setView(self.hdrPreview)
1131        self.layout.addWidget(self.hdrPreview)
1132
1133        # scroll ------------------------------------------------
1134        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
1135
1136        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
1137        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
1138        self.container = QLabel()
1139        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
1140        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
1141        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
1142
1143        # adding widgets to self (QSplitter)
1144        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
1145        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
1146        self.setSizes([60,40])
1147
1148    def setImage(self,image):
1149        """
1150        Update the image preview display.
1151        
1152        Args:
1153            image (hdrCore.image.Image): Image to display in preview
1154            
1155        Returns:
1156            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
1157        """
1158        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setImage(",image.name,")")
1159        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image)
1160
1161    def autoExposure(self):
1162        """
1163        Trigger automatic exposure calculation.
1164        
1165        Delegates to controller for automatic exposure value computation
1166        based on image histogram analysis.
1167        """
1168        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoExposure(",")")
1169
1170        self.controller.autoExposure()
1171        pass
1172
1173    def changeExposure(self, value):
1174        """
1175        Handle manual exposure adjustment changes.
1176        
1177        Args:
1178            value (float): New exposure value in EV stops
1179        """
1180        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeExposure(",")")
1181
1182        self.controller.changeExposure(value)
1183        pass
1184
1185    def autoContrast(self):
1186        """
1187        Trigger automatic contrast calculation.
1188        
1189        Placeholder for automatic contrast adjustment functionality.
1190        """
1191        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoContrast(",")")
1192        pass
1193
1194    def changeContrast(self, value):
1195        """
1196        Handle manual contrast adjustment changes.
1197        
1198        Args:
1199            value (float): New contrast value
1200        """
1201        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeContrast(",")")
1202
1203        self.controller.changeContrast(value)
1204        pass
1205
1206    def autoSaturation(self):
1207        """
1208        Trigger automatic saturation calculation.
1209        
1210        Placeholder for automatic saturation adjustment functionality.
1211        """
1212        print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoSaturation(",")")
1213        pass
1214
1215    def changeSaturation(self,value):   ### TO DO
1216        """
1217        Handle manual saturation adjustment changes.
1218        
1219        Args:
1220            value (float): New saturation value
1221        """
1222        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeSaturation(",")")
1223        self.controller.changeSaturation(value)
1224
1225    def plotToneCurve(self): 
1226        """
1227        Update tone curve visualization in the curve editor.
1228        """
1229        self.tonecurve.plotCurve()
1230 
1231    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1232        """
1233        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1234        
1235        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1236        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1237        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1238        consistent editing state.
1239        
1240        Args:
1241            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1242        """
1243        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1244
1245        # exposure
1246        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1247        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1248        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1249        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1250
1251        # contrast
1252        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1253        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1254        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1255        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1256
1257        # tonecurve
1258        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1259        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1260        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1261        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1262
1263        # lightnessmask
1264        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1265        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1266        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1267        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1268
1269        # saturation
1270        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1271        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1272        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1273        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1274
1275        # colorEditor0
1276        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1277        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1278        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1279        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1280
1281        # colorEditor1
1282        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1283        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1284        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1285        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1286
1287        # colorEditor2
1288        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1289        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1290        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1291        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1292
1293        # colorEditor3
1294        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1295        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor3")
1296        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1297        self.colorEditor3.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1298        
1299        # colorEditor4
1300        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1301        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor4")
1302        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1303        self.colorEditor4.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1304        
1305        # geometry
1306        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1307        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
1308        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1309        self.geometry.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1310# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1311# --- class MultiDockView(QDockWidget) -----------------------------------------------------
1312# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1313class MultiDockView(QDockWidget):
1314    """
1315    Multi-panel dockable widget for uHDR right-side interface.
1316    
1317    Provides a switchable dock widget that can display different interface panels
1318    for HDR image editing workflow. Manages three distinct child controllers
1319    that handle different aspects of image processing: editing controls, metadata
1320    information, and aesthetics analysis.
1321    
1322    Panel Types:
1323    - Panel 0: Edit Image Controls (EditImageController)
1324      * HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1325      * Tone curve editing with B-spline controls
1326      * Color space editing in LCH coordinates
1327      * Geometry transformations and HDR preview
1328      
1329    - Panel 1: Image Information & Metadata (ImageInfoController)
1330      * EXIF data display and technical parameters
1331      * User-defined workflow tags and classification
1332      * File information and processing metadata
1333      
1334    - Panel 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis (ImageAestheticsController)
1335      * Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
1336      * Dominant color visualization and analysis
1337      * Aesthetic composition metrics
1338    
1339    Architecture:
1340    The MultiDockView implements a container pattern where child controllers
1341    manage their own views and business logic. The dock handles view switching,
1342    memory management, and state synchronization between panels.
1343    
1344    Docking Behavior:
1345    - Allowed areas: Left or Right dock areas only
1346    - Default position: Right side of main window
1347    - Resizable and detachable following Qt dock widget standards
1348    - Panel switching preserves current ProcessPipe state
1349    
1350    State Management:
1351    When switching panels, the dock:
1352    1. Destroys the current view to free memory
1353    2. Rebuilds the target view with current ProcessPipe
1354    3. Updates the dock widget content
1355    4. Maintains consistent state across panels
1356    
1357    Memory Optimization:
1358    Views are dynamically created/destroyed during switching to minimize
1359    memory usage, especially important for the complex editing interface
1360    with matplotlib components and HDR preview capabilities.
1361    
1362    Attributes:
1363        - controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller for dock management
1364        - childControllers (list): List of three child controllers:
1365            [0] EditImageController - editing interface
1366            [1] ImageInfoController - metadata interface  
1367            [2] ImageAestheticsController - aesthetics interface
1368        - childController: Currently active child controller
1369        - active (int): Index of currently displayed panel (0, 1, or 2)
1370    
1371    Usage Example:
1372        # Create multi-dock with HDR support
1373        dock = MultiDockView(controller, HDRcontroller)
1374        
1375        # Switch to metadata panel
1376        dock.switch(1)
1377        
1378        # Update with new image
1379        dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1380    
1381    Integration:
1382    The MultiDockView integrates with the main AppView through menu
1383    shortcuts (Ctrl+E, Ctrl+I, Ctrl+A) that trigger panel switching
1384    for efficient workflow navigation.
1385    """
1386    def __init__(self, _controller, HDRcontroller=None):
1387        """
1388        Initialize multi-panel dock widget with child controllers.
1389        
1390        Creates the dock widget with three child controllers for different
1391        interface panels. Sets up docking constraints, initializes the
1392        editing panel as default, and establishes parent-child relationships.
1393        
1394        Args:
1395            _controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller managing dock behavior
1396            HDRcontroller (HDRController, optional): HDR display controller for
1397                real-time HDR preview functionality in editing panel
1398                
1399        Child Controllers Created:
1400            - EditImageController: Complete HDR editing interface with tone curves,
1401              color editors, geometry controls, and HDR preview
1402            - ImageInfoController: Metadata display and user tag management
1403            - ImageAestheticsController: Color palette and aesthetic analysis
1404        """
1405        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.__init__(",")")
1406
1407        super().__init__("Image Edit/Info")
1408        self.controller = _controller
1409
1410        self.setAllowedAreas(Qt.LeftDockWidgetArea | Qt.RightDockWidgetArea)
1411      
1412        self.childControllers = [
1413            controller.EditImageController(self, HDRcontroller), 
1414            controller.ImageInfoController(self), 
1415            controller.ImageAestheticsController(self)]
1416            #controller.ImageQualityController(self, HDRcontroller)]
1417        self.childController = self.childControllers[0]
1418        self.active = 0
1419        self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1420        self.repaint()
1421    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1422    def switch(self,nb):
1423        """
1424        Switch to different dock panel and rebuild interface.
1425        
1426        Changes the active dock panel by destroying the current view,
1427        selecting the target child controller, rebuilding the view with
1428        current ProcessPipe state, and updating the dock widget content.
1429        
1430        Panel Selection:
1431        - nb = 0: Edit Image Controls
1432          * HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1433          * Tone curve editing and lightness masking
1434          * Color space editing in LCH coordinates
1435          * Geometry transformations and HDR preview
1436          
1437        - nb = 1: Image Information & Metadata  
1438          * EXIF data display and technical parameters
1439          * User-defined workflow tags and classification
1440          * File information and processing metadata
1441          
1442        - nb = 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis
1443          * Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
1444          * Dominant color visualization and analysis
1445          * Aesthetic composition analysis
1446        
1447        Memory Management:
1448        The method performs proper cleanup by calling deleteLater() on the
1449        current view before creating the new one, preventing memory leaks
1450        from complex widgets like matplotlib figures and HDR previews.
1451        
1452        Args:
1453            nb (int): Target panel index (0, 1, or 2). Values outside range
1454                     are wrapped using modulo operation for safety.
1455                     
1456        State Preservation:
1457        Current ProcessPipe is retrieved and passed to the new panel to
1458        maintain consistent state across interface switches.
1459        """
1460        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.switch(",nb,")")
1461
1462        if nb != self.active:
1463     
1464            self.active = (nb)%len(self.childControllers)
1465            self.childController.view.deleteLater()
1466            self.childController = self.childControllers[self.active]
1467            # rebuild view 
1468            processPipe = self.controller.parent.imageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1469            self.childController.buildView(processPipe)
1470            self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1471            self.repaint()
1472    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1473    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1474        """
1475        Update current panel with new ProcessPipe data.
1476        
1477        Delegates ProcessPipe updates to the currently active child controller,
1478        allowing each panel to refresh its content and interface state based
1479        on the new image and processing parameters.
1480        
1481        Panel-Specific Behavior:
1482        - Edit Panel: Restores all editing parameters (exposure, contrast, 
1483          tone curves, color editors, geometry) from ProcessPipe nodes
1484        - Info Panel: Updates metadata display, EXIF data, and user tags
1485        - Aesthetics Panel: Regenerates color palette and analysis visualization
1486        
1487        Args:
1488            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image
1489                and all associated editing parameters and metadata
1490                
1491        Returns:
1492            Result of active child controller's setProcessPipe() method,
1493            typically the updated image or processing result
1494            
1495        Note:
1496            This method provides a unified interface for ProcessPipe updates
1497            regardless of which panel is currently active, simplifying the
1498            dock management logic in the parent controller.
1499        """
1500        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
1501        return self.childController.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1502# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1503
1504# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1505# --- class AdvanceSliderView(QFrame) ------------------------------------------------------
1506# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1507class AdvanceSliderView(QFrame):
1508    """
1509    Enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality and numerical input.
1510    
1511    Provides a comprehensive parameter adjustment interface combining a horizontal
1512    slider with automatic calculation, manual reset, and direct numerical input
1513    capabilities. Used extensively throughout uHDR for real-time parameter
1514    adjustments in exposure, contrast, saturation, and other image processing
1515    controls.
1516    
1517    Widget Components:
1518    - Descriptive label: Parameter name display
1519    - Auto button: Triggers automatic parameter calculation
1520    - Value editor: Direct numerical input with validation
1521    - Reset button: Restores default parameter value
1522    - Horizontal slider: Continuous parameter adjustment
1523    
1524    Value Handling:
1525    The widget internally scales slider positions based on step size for
1526    precise control. Slider range is calculated as (range[0]/step, range[1]/step)
1527    to provide appropriate granularity for different parameter types.
1528    
1529    Layout Structure:
1530    +------------------------------------------+
1531    | [Label] [Auto] [Value Input] [Reset]    |  <- First row (horizontal)
1532    +------------------------------------------+
1533    | [========== Slider =================]   |  <- Second row
1534    +------------------------------------------+
1535    
1536    Callback Integration:
1537    All user interactions automatically trigger controller callbacks:
1538    - Slider movement: controller.sliderChange()
1539    - Reset button: controller.reset()
1540    - Auto button: controller.auto()
1541    
1542    Value input changes are handled through slider synchronization.
1543    
1544    Attributes:
1545        - controller: Parent controller for callback delegation
1546        - firstrow (QFrame): Container for top row controls
1547        - label (QLabel): Parameter name display
1548        - auto (QPushButton): Automatic parameter calculation trigger
1549        - editValue (QLineEdit): Direct numerical input field with validation
1550        - reset (QPushButton): Default value restoration button
1551        - slider (QSlider): Main parameter adjustment control
1552        - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Vertical layout manager
1553        - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for first row
1554    
1555    Example Usage:
1556        # Exposure control with ±10 EV range and 0.25 step
1557        exposure_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0, (-10, 10), 0.25)
1558        
1559        # Contrast control with ±100 range and 1.0 step  
1560        contrast_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0, (-100, 100), 1.0)
1561    
1562    Technical Notes:
1563        - QDoubleValidator ensures only valid numerical input
1564        - Step size determines slider precision and scaling
1565        - Range values should be compatible with step size
1566        - Controller callbacks handle actual parameter application
1567        - Widget maintains internal consistency between slider and text input
1568    """
1569    def __init__(self, controller, name,defaultValue, range, step):
1570        """
1571        Initialize enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality.
1572        
1573        Creates a complete parameter adjustment interface with slider, buttons,
1574        and text input. Automatically configures scaling, validation, and
1575        callback connections for seamless integration.
1576        
1577        Args:
1578            controller: Parent controller object implementing callback methods:
1579                - sliderChange(): Handle slider value changes
1580                - reset(): Restore default parameter value  
1581                - auto(): Calculate automatic parameter value
1582            name (str): Human-readable parameter name for label display
1583            defaultValue (float): Initial parameter value and reset target
1584            range (tuple): Parameter range as (min_value, max_value)
1585            step (float): Parameter adjustment granularity and slider scaling factor
1586                
1587        Example:
1588            # Create exposure slider: -10 to +10 EV, 0.25 EV steps
1589            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0.0, (-10.0, 10.0), 0.25)
1590            
1591            # Create contrast slider: -100 to +100, 1.0 steps  
1592            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0.0, (-100.0, 100.0), 1.0)
1593        """
1594        super().__init__()
1595        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1596        self.controller = controller
1597        self.firstrow = QFrame()
1598
1599        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1600        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
1601        
1602        self.firstrow.setLayout(self.hbox)
1603
1604        self.label= QLabel(name)
1605        self.auto = QPushButton("auto")
