1606        self.editValue = QLineEdit()
1607        self.editValue.setValidator(QDoubleValidator())
1608        self.editValue.setText(str(defaultValue))
1609        self.reset = QPushButton("reset")
1610
1611        self.hbox.addWidget(self.label)
1612        self.hbox.addWidget(self.auto)
1613        self.hbox.addWidget(self.editValue)
1614        self.hbox.addWidget(self.reset)
1615
1616        self.slider = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1617        self.slider.setRange(int(range[0]/step),int(range[1]/step))
1618        self.slider.setValue(int(defaultValue/step))
1619        self.slider.setSingleStep(1) 
1620
1621        self.vbox.addWidget(self.firstrow)
1622        self.vbox.addWidget(self.slider)
1623
1624        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1625
1626        # callBackFunctions slider/reset/auto
1627        self.slider.valueChanged.connect(self.controller.sliderChange)
1628        self.reset.clicked.connect(self.controller.reset)
1629        self.auto.clicked.connect(self.controller.auto)
1630# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1631# --- class ToneCurveView(QFrame) ----------------------------------------------------------
1632# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1633class ToneCurveView(QFrame):
1634    """
1635    B-spline tone curve editing interface with matplotlib visualization.
1636    
1637    Provides comprehensive tone curve editing capabilities using B-spline interpolation
1638    with individual control over five tonal ranges: shadows, blacks, mediums, whites,
1639    and highlights. Features real-time curve visualization and semi-automatic curve
1640    generation for enhanced workflow efficiency.
1641    
1642    Tone Curve Controls:
1643    - Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions control
1644    - Blacks (20-40%): Dark tone adjustments  
1645    - Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone contrast and brightness
1646    - Whites (60-80%): Bright tone refinement
1647    - Highlights (80-100%): Brightest regions control
1648    
1649    Interface Features:
1650    - Real-time B-spline curve visualization using matplotlib
1651    - Individual sliders for each tonal range (0-100 scale)
1652    - Reset buttons for selective parameter restoration
1653    - Semi-automatic curve generation based on image analysis
1654    - Live curve updates during parameter adjustment
1655    
1656    B-spline Implementation:
1657    The tone curve uses B-spline interpolation with fixed control points
1658    at the five tonal boundaries. User adjustments modify the Y-coordinates
1659    of these control points while maintaining smooth curve transitions.
1660    
1661    Mathematical Foundation:
1662    - Input domain: [0, 100] (percentage lightness)
1663    - Output range: [0, 100] (adjusted lightness)
1664    - Control points: (0,0), (20,shadows), (40,blacks), (60,mediums), (80,whites), (100,highlights)
1665    - Interpolation: Cubic B-spline with C² continuity
1666    
1667    Layout Structure:
1668    +------------------------------------------+
1669    | [Matplotlib Curve Visualization]        |
1670    +------------------------------------------+
1671    | [Auto Curve Generation Button]          |
1672    +------------------------------------------+
1673    | highlights: [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1674    | whites:     [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1675    | mediums:    [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1676    | blacks:     [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1677    | shadows:    [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1678    +------------------------------------------+
1679    
1680    Attributes:
1681        - controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller for curve calculations
1682        - curve (FigureWidget): Matplotlib figure widget for curve display
1683        - autoCurve (QPushButton): Semi-automatic curve generation button
1684        - sliderShadows, sliderBlacks, sliderMediums, sliderWhites, sliderHighlights: 
1685            Individual tone range control sliders (0-100 range)
1686        - editShadows, editBlacks, editMediums, editWhites, editHighlights:
1687            Text input fields showing current slider values
1688        - resetShadows, resetBlacks, resetMediums, resetWhites, resetHighlights:
1689            Reset buttons for individual tone ranges
1690        - labelShadows, labelBlacks, labelMediums, labelWhites, labelHighlights:
1691            Descriptive labels for each tone range
1692    
1693    Usage Example:
1694        The tone curve allows precise control over image tonality:
1695        - Lift shadows (increase slider) to reveal dark detail
1696        - Lower highlights (decrease slider) to recover bright detail  
1697        - Adjust mediums for overall contrast and brightness
1698        - Use auto curve for intelligent initial settings
1699        
1700    Technical Notes:
1701        - All slider values represent percentage adjustments (0-100)
1702        - Curve updates trigger real-time image processing
1703        - B-spline ensures smooth transitions between control points
1704        - Auto curve analyzes image histogram for optimal settings
1705    """
1706
1707    def __init__(self, controller):
1708        """
1709        Initialize B-spline tone curve editing interface.
1710        
1711        Creates the complete tone curve editing interface with matplotlib
1712        visualization and individual control sliders for five tonal ranges.
1713        Sets up all UI components, connects callbacks, and initializes
1714        default parameter values.
1715        
1716        Args:
1717            controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller instance
1718                that handles curve calculations and image processing
1719        """
1720        super().__init__()
1721        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1722
1723        self.controller = controller
1724
1725        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1726
1727        # figure
1728        self.curve = FigureWidget(self) 
1729        self.curve.setMinimumSize(200, 600)
1730
1731        self.curve.plot([0.0,100],[0.0,100.0],'r--')
1732
1733        #containers
1734        
1735        # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1736        self.containerAuto = QFrame() 
1737        self.hboxAuto = QHBoxLayout() 
1738        self.containerAuto.setLayout(self.hboxAuto)
1739        # zj add for semi-auto curve end                                
1740        self.containerShadows = QFrame()
1741        self.hboxShadows = QHBoxLayout()
1742        self.containerShadows.setLayout(self.hboxShadows)
1743        
1744        self.containerBlacks = QFrame()
1745        self.hboxBlacks = QHBoxLayout()
1746        self.containerBlacks.setLayout(self.hboxBlacks)
1747
1748        self.containerMediums = QFrame()
1749        self.hboxMediums = QHBoxLayout()
1750        self.containerMediums.setLayout(self.hboxMediums)
1751
1752        self.containerWhites = QFrame()
1753        self.hboxWhites = QHBoxLayout()
1754        self.containerWhites.setLayout(self.hboxWhites)
1755
1756        self.containerHighlights = QFrame()
1757        self.hboxHighlights = QHBoxLayout()
1758        self.containerHighlights.setLayout(self.hboxHighlights)
1759
1760        self.vbox.addWidget(self.curve)
1761        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerAuto) #  zj add for semi-auto curve                                                                       
1762        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerHighlights)
1763        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerWhites)
1764        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerMediums)
1765        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerBlacks)
1766        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerShadows)
1767
1768        # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1769        # autoCurve button
1770        self.autoCurve = QPushButton("auto")
1771        self.hboxAuto.addWidget(self.autoCurve)
1772        self.hboxAuto.setAlignment(Qt.AlignCenter)
1773        # zj add for semi-auto curve end
1774        # shadows
1775        self.labelShadows = QLabel("shadows")
1776        self.sliderShadows = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1777        self.sliderShadows.setRange(0,100)
1778        self.sliderShadows.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1779        self.editShadows = QLineEdit()
1780        self.editShadows.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1781        self.resetShadows = QPushButton("reset")
1782        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.labelShadows)
1783        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.sliderShadows)
1784        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.editShadows)
1785        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.resetShadows)
1786
1787        # blacks
1788        self.labelBlacks = QLabel("  blacks  ")
1789        self.sliderBlacks = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1790        self.sliderBlacks.setRange(0,100)
1791        self.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['blacks'][1]))
1792        self.editBlacks = QLineEdit()
1793        self.editBlacks.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['blacks'][1]))
1794        self.resetBlacks = QPushButton("reset")
1795        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.labelBlacks)
1796        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.sliderBlacks)
1797        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.editBlacks)
1798        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.resetBlacks)
1799
1800        # mediums
1801        self.labelMediums = QLabel("mediums")
1802        self.sliderMediums = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1803        self.sliderMediums.setRange(0,100)
1804        self.sliderMediums.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['mediums'][1]))
1805        self.editMediums = QLineEdit()
1806        self.editMediums.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['mediums'][1]))
1807        self.resetMediums = QPushButton("reset")
1808        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.labelMediums)
1809        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.sliderMediums)
1810        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.editMediums)
1811        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.resetMediums)
1812
1813        # whites
1814        self.labelWhites = QLabel("  whites  ")
1815        self.sliderWhites = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1816        self.sliderWhites.setRange(0,100)
1817        self.sliderWhites.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['whites'][1]))
1818        self.editWhites = QLineEdit()
1819        self.editWhites.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['whites'][1]))
1820        self.resetWhites = QPushButton("reset")
1821        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.labelWhites)
1822        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.sliderWhites)
1823        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.editWhites)
1824        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.resetWhites)
1825
1826        # highlights
1827        self.labelHighlights = QLabel("highlights")
1828        self.sliderHighlights = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1829        self.sliderHighlights.setRange(0,100)
1830        self.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['highlights'][1]))
1831        self.editHighlights = QLineEdit()
1832        self.editHighlights.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['highlights'][1]))
1833        self.resetHighlights = QPushButton("reset")
1834        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.labelHighlights)
1835        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.sliderHighlights)
1836        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.editHighlights)
1837        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.resetHighlights)
1838
1839        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1840
1841        # callBackFunctions slider/reset
1842        self.sliderShadows.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderShadowsChange)
1843        self.sliderBlacks.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderBlacksChange)
1844        self.sliderMediums.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderMediumsChange)
1845        self.sliderWhites.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderWhitesChange)
1846        self.sliderHighlights.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHighlightsChange)
1847
1848        self.resetShadows.clicked.connect(self.resetShadowsCB)
1849        self.resetBlacks.clicked.connect(self.resetBlacksCB)
1850        self.resetMediums.clicked.connect(self.resetMediumsCB)
1851        self.resetWhites.clicked.connect(self.resetWhitesCB)
1852        self.resetHighlights.clicked.connect(self.resetHighlightsCB)
1853        self.autoCurve.clicked.connect(self.controller.autoCurve)  #  zj add for semi-auto curve 
1854                                                                                         
1855
1856    def sliderShadowsChange(self):
1857        """
1858        Handle shadows slider value changes and update tone curve.
1859        
1860        Called when the shadows slider (0-20% tonal range) is moved.
1861        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1862        if callbacks are active.
1863        """
1864        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1865            value = self.sliderShadows.value()
1866            self.controller.sliderChange("shadows", value)
1867
1868    def sliderBlacksChange(self):
1869        """
1870        Handle blacks slider value changes and update tone curve.
1871        
1872        Called when the blacks slider (20-40% tonal range) is moved.
1873        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1874        if callbacks are active.
1875        """
1876        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1877            value = self.sliderBlacks.value()
1878            self.controller.sliderChange("blacks", value)
1879
1880    def sliderMediumsChange(self):
1881        """
1882        Handle mediums slider value changes and update tone curve.
1883        
1884        Called when the mediums slider (40-60% tonal range) is moved.
1885        This controls mid-tone contrast and overall image brightness.
1886        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1887        if callbacks are active.
1888        """
1889        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1890            value = self.sliderMediums.value()
1891            self.controller.sliderChange("mediums", value)
1892
1893    def sliderWhitesChange(self):
1894        """
1895        Handle whites slider value changes and update tone curve.
1896        
1897        Called when the whites slider (60-80% tonal range) is moved.
1898        Used for bright tone refinement and highlight detail control.
1899        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1900        if callbacks are active.
1901        """
1902        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1903            value = self.sliderWhites.value()
1904            self.controller.sliderChange("whites", value)
1905
1906    def sliderHighlightsChange(self):
1907        """
1908        Handle highlights slider value changes and update tone curve.
1909        
1910        Called when the highlights slider (80-100% tonal range) is moved.
1911        Controls the brightest image regions and highlight detail recovery.
1912        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1913        if callbacks are active.
1914        """
1915        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1916            value = self.sliderHighlights.value()
1917            self.controller.sliderChange("highlights", value)
1918
1919    def resetShadowsCB(self):
1920        """Reset shadows slider to default value and update curve."""
1921        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("shadows")
1922
1923    def resetBlacksCB(self):
1924        """Reset blacks slider to default value and update curve."""
1925        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("blacks")
1926    
1927    def resetMediumsCB(self):
1928        """Reset mediums slider to default value and update curve."""
1929        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("mediums")
1930
1931    def resetWhitesCB(self):
1932        """Reset whites slider to default value and update curve."""
1933        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("whites")
1934
1935    def resetHighlightsCB(self):
1936        """Reset highlights slider to default value and update curve."""
1937        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("highlights")
1938# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1939# --- class LightnessMaskView(QGroupBox) ---------------------------------------------------
1940# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1941class LightnessMaskView(QGroupBox):
1942    """
1943    Lightness-based masking control interface for selective tone editing.
1944    
1945    Provides checkbox controls for enabling/disabling tone range masks that allow
1946    selective application of editing adjustments to specific lightness regions.
1947    Works in conjunction with tone curve editing to provide precise control over
1948    which tonal ranges are affected by parameter changes.
1949    
1950    Tone Range Masking:
1951    The interface allows independent masking of five distinct lightness ranges
1952    corresponding to the tone curve control points:
1953    
1954    - Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions
1955      * Deep shadows, true blacks, dark details
1956      * Useful for shadow lifting without affecting other tones
1957      
1958    - Blacks (20-40%): Lower mid-tone range
1959      * Dark greys, low-key lighting areas
1960      * Controls separation between shadows and mid-tones
1961      
1962    - Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone range
1963      * Standard exposure areas, skin tones, neutral greys
1964      * Primary brightness and contrast control zone
1965      
1966    - Whites (60-80%): Upper mid-tone range  
1967      * Bright areas, light greys, highlight transitions
1968      * Controls separation between mid-tones and highlights
1969      
1970    - Highlights (80-100%): Brightest image regions
1971      * Specular highlights, light sources, bright reflections
1972      * Useful for highlight recovery and bright detail control
1973    
1974    Masking Functionality:
1975    When checkboxes are enabled, subsequent editing operations (exposure,
1976    contrast, color adjustments) are selectively applied only to pixels
1977    within the specified lightness ranges. This allows for:
1978    
1979    - Targeted shadow lifting without brightening highlights
1980    - Selective highlight recovery without darkening shadows
1981    - Mid-tone contrast adjustments without clipping extremes
1982    - Color corrections limited to specific tonal ranges
1983    - Fine-tuned local adjustments for advanced workflow
1984    
1985    Layout Structure:
1986    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1987    | mask lightness                                               |
1988    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1989    | [✓] shadows [✓] blacks [✓] mediums [✓] whites [✓] highlights|
1990    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1991    
1992    Integration:
1993    The mask settings work seamlessly with other editing controls in the
1994    EditImageView, providing a non-destructive workflow where masks can
1995    be enabled, adjusted, and disabled without losing editing progress.
1996    
1997    Attributes:
1998        - controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller for mask logic
1999        - checkboxShadows (QCheckBox): Shadows range mask toggle
2000        - checkboxBlacks (QCheckBox): Blacks range mask toggle  
2001        - checkboxMediums (QCheckBox): Mediums range mask toggle
2002        - checkboxWhites (QCheckBox): Whites range mask toggle
2003        - checkboxHighlights (QCheckBox): Highlights range mask toggle
2004        - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for checkbox arrangement
2005
2006    Usage Example:
2007        # Enable shadow and highlight masking for targeted adjustment
2008        mask_view.checkboxShadows.setChecked(True)
2009        mask_view.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(True)
2010        
2011        # Apply selective exposure adjustment
2012        # (affects only shadows and highlights)
2013        
2014    Technical Notes:
2015        - Mask ranges correspond to tone curve control points
2016        - Multiple masks can be active simultaneously
2017        - Masks affect all subsequent editing operations
2018        - Checkbox state is preserved in ProcessPipe parameters
2019        - Real-time mask preview available through color editors
2020    """
2021    def __init__(self, _controller):
2022        """
2023        Initialize lightness masking interface with five tone range checkboxes.
2024        
2025        Creates a horizontal arrangement of checkboxes for controlling tone range
2026        masks. Sets up callback connections for real-time mask updates and
2027        initializes all masks as disabled by default.
2028        
2029        Args:
2030            _controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller implementing
2031                maskChange() method for handling mask state updates
2032                
2033        Interface Layout:
2034            All checkboxes are arranged horizontally in reading order:
2035            [Shadows] [Blacks] [Mediums] [Whites] [Highlights]
2036            
2037        Default State:
2038            All masks are initially disabled (unchecked) to allow normal
2039            full-range editing operations.
2040        """
2041        super().__init__("mask lightness")
2042        #self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2043
2044        self.controller = _controller
2045
2046        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
2047        self.setLayout(self.hbox)
2048
2049        self.checkboxShadows = QCheckBox("shadows")
2050        self.checkboxShadows.setChecked(False)
2051        self.checkboxBlacks = QCheckBox("blacks")
2052        self.checkboxBlacks.setChecked(False)
2053        self.checkboxMediums = QCheckBox("mediums")
2054        self.checkboxMediums.setChecked(False)
2055        self.checkboxWhites = QCheckBox("whites")
2056        self.checkboxWhites.setChecked(False)
2057        self.checkboxHighlights = QCheckBox("highlights")
2058        self.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(False)
2059
2060        self.checkboxShadows.toggled.connect(self.clickShadows)
2061        self.checkboxBlacks.toggled.connect(self.clickBlacks)
2062        self.checkboxMediums.toggled.connect(self.clickMediums)
2063        self.checkboxWhites.toggled.connect(self.clickWhites)
2064        self.checkboxHighlights.toggled.connect(self.clickHighlights)
2065
2066        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxShadows)
2067        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxBlacks)
2068        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxMediums)
2069        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxWhites)
2070        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxHighlights)
2071
2072    # callbacks
2073    def clickShadows(self):
2074        """
2075        Handle shadows mask checkbox toggle.
2076        
2077        Activates or deactivates masking for the shadows tone range (0-20%)
2078        when the shadows checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2079        of the darkest image regions.
2080        """
2081        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2082            self.controller.maskChange("shadows", self.checkboxShadows.isChecked())
2083            
2084    def clickBlacks(self):
2085        """
2086        Handle blacks mask checkbox toggle.
2087        
2088        Activates or deactivates masking for the blacks tone range (20-40%)
2089        when the blacks checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2090        of dark mid-tone regions.
2091        """
2092        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2093            self.controller.maskChange("blacks", self.checkboxBlacks.isChecked())
2094            
2095    def clickMediums(self):
2096        """
2097        Handle mediums mask checkbox toggle.
2098        
2099        Activates or deactivates masking for the mediums tone range (40-60%)
2100        when the mediums checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2101        of mid-tone regions including skin tones and neutral greys.
2102        """
2103        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2104            self.controller.maskChange("mediums", self.checkboxMediums.isChecked())
2105            
2106    def clickWhites(self):
2107        """
2108        Handle whites mask checkbox toggle.
2109        
2110        Activates or deactivates masking for the whites tone range (60-80%)
2111        when the whites checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2112        of bright mid-tone regions and highlight transitions.
2113        """
2114        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2115            self.controller.maskChange("whites", self.checkboxWhites.isChecked())
2116            
2117    def clickHighlights(self):
2118        """
2119        Handle highlights mask checkbox toggle.
2120        
2121        Activates or deactivates masking for the highlights tone range (80-100%)
2122        when the highlights checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2123        of the brightest image regions and specular highlights.
2124        """
2125        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2126            self.controller.maskChange("highlights", self.checkboxHighlights.isChecked())
2127# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2128# --- class HDRviewerView(QFrame) ----------------------------------------------------------
2129# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2130class HDRviewerView(QFrame):
2131    """
2132    HDR display preview control interface for external HDR monitor management.
2133    
2134    Provides essential controls for managing real-time HDR image preview on external
2135    HDR-capable displays. Enables workflow acceleration through live preview updates
2136    and side-by-side comparison capabilities for professional HDR image editing.
2137    
2138    HDR Display Features:
2139    - Real-time preview: Live updates of edited HDR images on external HDR displays
2140    - Automatic updates: Optional real-time synchronization with editing parameters
2141    - Raw/edited comparison: Side-by-side visualization of original vs processed images
2142    - Display reset: Clear HDR display and return to neutral state
2143    - Manual updates: On-demand refresh for selective preview control
2144    
2145    Workflow Integration:
2146    The HDR viewer integrates seamlessly with the editing workflow by providing
2147    immediate visual feedback on actual HDR hardware. This allows colorists and
2148    HDR specialists to:
2149    
2150    - Evaluate tone mapping accuracy on target display technology
2151    - Assess color gamut utilization and saturation levels
2152    - Verify highlight detail preservation and shadow lifting
2153    - Compare multiple editing iterations efficiently
2154    - Validate HDR content for delivery and mastering
2155    
2156    Display Requirements:
2157    Requires external HDR-capable monitor configured through preferences system.
2158    Supports various HDR display standards and peak brightness levels based on
2159    hardware capabilities and preference configuration.
2160    
2161    Layout Structure:
2162    +------------------------------------------+
2163    | hdr preview                    [reset]   |  <- Top row
2164    +------------------------------------------+
2165    | [✓] auto  [update]  [compare]           |  <- Bottom row
2166    +------------------------------------------+
2167    
2168    Control Functions:
2169    - Auto checkbox: Enable/disable automatic preview updates during editing
2170    - Update button: Manual refresh of HDR display with current image state
2171    - Compare button: Side-by-side display of raw and edited versions
2172    - Reset button: Clear HDR display and show default splash screen
2173    
2174    Performance Considerations:
2175    Auto-update mode may impact editing performance due to continuous HDR image
2176    processing and display updates. Manual update mode provides better responsiveness
2177    for complex editing operations while maintaining preview capability.
2178    
2179    Attributes:
2180        - controller (HDRController): Parent controller managing HDR display hardware
2181        - label (QLabel): "hdr preview" identifier label
2182        - resetButton (QPushButton): Clear HDR display control
2183        - updateButton (QPushButton): Manual HDR preview refresh
2184        - compareButton (QPushButton): Raw/edited comparison display
2185        - autoCheckBox (QCheckBox): Automatic update toggle
2186        - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Main vertical layout container
2187        - hboxUp, hboxDown (QHBoxLayout): Top and bottom control row layouts
2188        - hboxUpContainer, hboxDownContainer (QFrame): Layout containers
2189
2190    Usage Example:
2191        # Enable auto-preview for real-time editing feedback
2192        hdr_viewer.autoCheckBox.setChecked(True)
2193        
2194        # Manual update after complex editing operations
2195        hdr_viewer.updateButton.click()
2196        
2197        # Compare original and edited versions
2198        hdr_viewer.compareButton.click()
2199    
2200    Integration Notes:
2201        - Works with AppView menu shortcuts (Ctrl+H, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+K)
2202        - Synchronized with EditImageController editing operations
2203        - Respects HDR display preferences and configuration
2204        - Supports multiple HDR display standards and devices
2205    """
2206    def __init__(self, _controller= None, build = False):
2207        """
2208        Initialize HDR preview control interface with display management capabilities.
2209        
2210        Creates the HDR viewer interface with auto-update checkbox, manual control
2211        buttons, and proper layout arrangement. Optionally restores previous auto-update
2212        state when rebuilding the interface.
2213        
2214        Args:
2215            _controller (HDRController, optional): Parent HDR display controller
2216                managing external HDR hardware and display operations
2217            build (bool): Whether to restore previous auto-update state from
2218                existing model. Used when rebuilding interface during dock switching.
2219                
2220        Interface Setup:
2221            - Top row: "hdr preview" label + reset button
2222            - Bottom row: auto checkbox + update button + compare button
2223            - All controls connected to appropriate controller callbacks
2224            
2225        State Restoration:
2226            When build=True, retrieves previous autoPreviewHDR setting from
2227            the editing model to maintain consistent user preferences across
2228            interface rebuilds and dock panel switches.
2229        """
2230        super().__init__()
2231        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2232
2233        self.controller = _controller
2234
2235        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2236        self.hboxUp = QHBoxLayout()
2237        self.hboxDown = QHBoxLayout()
2238
2239        self.label= QLabel("hdr preview")
2240        self.resetButton = QPushButton("reset")
2241        self.updateButton = QPushButton("update")
2242        self.compareButton = QPushButton("compare")
2243        self.autoCheckBox = QCheckBox("auto")
2244
2245        if build:
2246            cValue = self.controller.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR
2247            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(cValue)
2248        else:
2249            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(False)
2250
2251        self.hboxUpContainer = QFrame()
2252        self.hboxUpContainer.setLayout(self.hboxUp)
2253        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.label)
2254        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.resetButton)
2255
2256        self.hboxDownContainer = QFrame()
2257        self.hboxDownContainer.setLayout(self.hboxDown)
2258        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.autoCheckBox)
2259        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.updateButton)
2260        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.compareButton)
2261
2262        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxUpContainer)
2263        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxDownContainer)
2264
2265        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2266
2267        self.resetButton.clicked.connect(self.reset)
2268        self.updateButton.clicked.connect(self.update)
2269        self.compareButton.clicked.connect(self.compare)
2270        self.autoCheckBox.toggled.connect(self.auto)
2271
2272    def reset(self):
2273        """
2274        Clear HDR display and show default splash screen.
2275        
2276        Resets the external HDR monitor to a neutral state by displaying
2277        the default splash screen. Useful for clearing previous previews
2278        and returning to a known baseline state.
2279        """
2280        self.controller.displaySplash()
2281
2282    def update(self):
2283        """
2284        Manually refresh HDR display with current image state.
2285        
2286        Triggers immediate update of the external HDR display with the
2287        currently processed image, reflecting all current editing parameters.
2288        Provides on-demand preview control for performance optimization.
2289        """
2290        self.controller.callBackUpdate()
2291
2292    def compare(self):
2293        """
2294        Display side-by-side raw and edited image comparison.
2295        
2296        Shows both the original unprocessed image and the current edited
2297        version simultaneously on the HDR display for direct visual
2298        comparison. Essential for evaluating editing effectiveness and
2299        maintaining reference to original image characteristics.
2300        """
2301        self.controller.callBackCompare()
2302
2303    def auto(self):
2304        """
2305        Toggle automatic HDR preview updates based on checkbox state.
2306        
2307        Enables or disables real-time HDR display updates that synchronize
2308        automatically with editing parameter changes. When enabled, provides
2309        immediate visual feedback but may impact editing performance.
2310        """
2311        self.controller.callBackAuto(self.autoCheckBox.isChecked())
2312# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2313# --- class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame) ---------------------------------------------------
2314# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2315class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame):
2316    """
2317    LCH color space selection and editing interface.
2318    
2319    Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space
2320    with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls.
2321    Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.
2322    
2323    Color Selection Components:
2324    - Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360°)
2325    - Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
2326    - Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
2327    - Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component
2328    
2329    Color Editing Components:
2330    - Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180° to +180°)
2331    - Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
2332    - Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
2333    - Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)
2334    
2335    Additional Features:
2336    - Selection mask preview
2337    - Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
2338    - Real-time color bar updates based on selection
2339    
2340    Layout Structure:
2341    +------------------------------------------+
2342    | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector      |
2343    +------------------------------------------+
2344    | [Hue Color Bar Visualization]           |
2345    | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider]       |
2346    | [Selected Hue Range Bar]                |
2347    +------------------------------------------+
2348    | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization]        |
2349    | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] |
2350    +------------------------------------------+
2351    | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization]     |
2352    | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider]   |
2353    +------------------------------------------+
2354    | [Reset Selection]                        |
2355    +------------------------------------------+
2356    | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation |
2357    | hue shift:  [slider] [value]            |
2358    | saturation: [slider] [value]            |
2359    | exposure:   [slider] [value]            |
2360    | contrast:   [slider] [value]            |
2361    | [x] show selection                       |
2362    | [Reset Edit]                             |
2363    +------------------------------------------+
2364    
2365    Attributes:
2366        - controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference
2367        - imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays
2368        - imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization
2369        - sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders
2370        - sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders
2371        - sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders
2372        - sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls
2373        - valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays
2374        - checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle
2375        - resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons
2376    """
2377    def __init__(self, _controller, defaultValues=None):
2378        """
2379        Initialize LCH color selector interface.
2380        
2381        Args:
2382            _controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller instance
2383            defaultValues: Optional default parameter values
2384        """
2385        super().__init__()
2386        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2387        self.controller = _controller
2388
2389        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2390
2391        self.labelSelector = QLabel("Hue Chroma Lighness color selector")
2392        # procedural image: Hue bar
2393        hueBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2394        hueBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2395        self.imageHueController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2396        self.imageHueController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2397        self.imageHueController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2398        hueBar2Lch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2399        hueBar2RGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBar2Lch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2400        self.imageHueRangeController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2401        self.imageHueRangeController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2402        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2403        # slider min
2404        self.sliderHueMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2405        self.sliderHueMin.setRange(0,360)
2406        self.sliderHueMin.setValue(0)
2407        self.sliderHueMin.setSingleStep(1)
2408        # slider max
2409        self.sliderHueMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2410        self.sliderHueMax.setRange(0,360)
2411        self.sliderHueMax.setValue(360)
2412        self.sliderHueMax.setSingleStep(1)
2413
2414        # procedural image: Saturation bar
2415        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (180,180), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2416        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2417        self.imageSaturationController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2418        self.imageSaturationController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2419        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2420        # slider min
2421        self.sliderChromaMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2422        self.sliderChromaMin.setRange(0,100)
2423        self.sliderChromaMin.setValue(0)
2424        self.sliderChromaMin.setSingleStep(1)
2425        # slider max
2426        self.sliderChromaMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2427        self.sliderChromaMax.setRange(0,100)
2428        self.sliderChromaMax.setValue(100)
2429        self.sliderChromaMax.setSingleStep(1)
2430
2431        # procedural image:lightness bar
2432        lightnessBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((0,100), (0,0), (180,180), (20,720), width='L', height='c')
2433        lightnessBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(lightnessBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2434        self.imageLightnessController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2435        self.imageLightnessController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2436        self.imageLightnessController.setImage(lightnessBarRGB)
2437        # slider min
2438        self.sliderLightMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2439        self.sliderLightMin.setRange(0,300)
2440        self.sliderLightMin.setValue(0)
2441        self.sliderLightMin.setSingleStep(1)        
2442        # slider max
2443        self.sliderLightMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2444        self.sliderLightMax.setRange(0,300)
2445        self.sliderLightMax.setValue(300)
2446        self.sliderLightMax.setSingleStep(1)
2447
2448        # editor
2449        self.labelEditor =      QLabel("color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation")
2450
2451        # hue shift [-180,+180]
2452        self.frameHueShift = QFrame()
2453        self.layoutHueShift = QHBoxLayout()
2454        self.frameHueShift.setLayout(self.layoutHueShift)
2455        self.sliderHueShift =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2456        self.sliderHueShift.setRange(-180,+180)
2457        self.sliderHueShift.setValue(0)
2458        self.sliderHueShift.setSingleStep(1) 
2459        self.valueHueShift = QLineEdit()
2460        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(0.0))  
2461        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(QLabel("hue shift"))
2462        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.sliderHueShift)
2463        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.valueHueShift)
2464
2465        # exposure [-3 , +3]
2466        self.frameExposure = QFrame()
2467        self.layoutExposure = QHBoxLayout()
2468        self.frameExposure.setLayout(self.layoutExposure)
2469        self.sliderExposure =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2470        self.sliderExposure.setRange(-90,+90)
2471        self.sliderExposure.setValue(0)
2472        self.sliderExposure.setSingleStep(1) 
2473        self.valueExposure = QLineEdit()
2474        self.valueExposure.setText(str(0.0))  
2475        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(QLabel("exposure"))
2476        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(self.sliderExposure)
2477        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(self.valueExposure)
2478
2479        # contrast [-100 , +100]
2480        self.frameContrast = QFrame()
2481        self.layoutContrast = QHBoxLayout()
2482        self.frameContrast.setLayout(self.layoutContrast)
2483        self.sliderContrast =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2484        self.sliderContrast.setRange(-100,+100)
2485        self.sliderContrast.setValue(0)
2486        self.sliderContrast.setSingleStep(1) 
2487        self.valueContrast = QLineEdit()
2488        self.valueContrast.setText(str(0.0))  
2489        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(QLabel("contrast"))
2490        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(self.sliderContrast)
2491        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(self.valueContrast)
2492
2493        # saturation [-100 , +100]
2494        self.frameSaturation = QFrame()
2495        self.layoutSaturation = QHBoxLayout()
2496        self.frameSaturation.setLayout(self.layoutSaturation)
2497        self.sliderSaturation =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2498        self.sliderSaturation.setRange(-100,+100)
2499        self.sliderSaturation.setValue(0)
2500        self.sliderSaturation.setSingleStep(1) 
2501        self.valueSaturation = QLineEdit()
2502        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(0.0))  
2503        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(QLabel("saturation"))
2504        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(self.sliderSaturation)
2505        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(self.valueSaturation)
2506
2507        # -----
2508        self.resetSelection  = QPushButton("reset selection")
2509        self.resetEdit  = QPushButton("reset edit")
2510        # -----
2511
2512        # mask
2513        self.checkboxMask = QCheckBox("show selection")
2514        self.checkboxMask.setChecked(False)
2515
2516        self.vbox.addWidget(self.labelSelector)
2517
2518        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageHueController.view)
2519        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderHueMin)
2520        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderHueMax)
2521        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageHueRangeController.view)
2522
2523
2524        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageSaturationController.view)
2525        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderChromaMin)
2526        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderChromaMax)
2527
2528        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageLightnessController.view)
2529        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderLightMin)
2530        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderLightMax)
2531
2532        # -----
2533        self.vbox.addWidget(self.resetSelection)
2534        # -----
2535
2536
2537        self.vbox.addWidget(self.labelEditor)
2538        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameHueShift)
2539        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameSaturation)
2540        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameExposure)
2541        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameContrast)
2542
2543        self.vbox.addWidget(self.checkboxMask)
2544        # -----
2545        self.vbox.addWidget(self.resetEdit)
2546        # -----
2547        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2548
2549        # callbacks  
2550        self.sliderHueMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueChange)
2551        self.sliderHueMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueChange)
2552        self.sliderChromaMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderChromaChange)
2553        self.sliderChromaMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderChromaChange)
2554        self.sliderLightMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderLightnessChange)
2555        self.sliderLightMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderLightnessChange)
2556        self.sliderExposure.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderExposureChange)
2557        self.sliderSaturation.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderSaturationChange)
2558        self.sliderContrast.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderContrastChange)
2559        self.sliderHueShift.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueShiftChange)
2560        self.checkboxMask.toggled.connect(self.checkboxMaskChange)
2561        # -----
2562        self.resetSelection.clicked.connect(self.controller.resetSelection)
2563        self.resetEdit.clicked.connect(self.controller.resetEdit)
2564
2565
2566    # callbacks
2567    def sliderHueChange(self):
2568        """
2569        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2570        
2571        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2572        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2573        """
2574        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2575        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2576
2577        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2578        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2579        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2580        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2581        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2582        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2583        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2584
2585        # call controller
2586        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)
2587
2588    def sliderChromaChange(self):
2589        """Handle chroma range selection changes."""
2590        vmin = self.sliderChromaMin.value()
2591        vmax = self.sliderChromaMax.value()
2592        # call controller
2593        self.controller.sliderChromaChange(vmin,vmax)
2594
2595    def sliderLightnessChange(self):
2596        """Handle lightness range selection changes."""
2597        vmin = self.sliderLightMin.value()/3.0
2598        vmax = self.sliderLightMax.value()/3.0
2599        # call controller
2600        self.controller.sliderLightnessChange(vmin,vmax)
2601
2602    def sliderExposureChange(self):
2603        """Handle exposure editing changes with 0.1 stop precision."""
2604        ev = round(self.sliderExposure.value()/30,1)
2605        # force to 0.1 precision
2606        self.valueExposure.setText(str(ev))
2607        self.controller.sliderExposureChange(ev)
2608
2609    def sliderSaturationChange(self):
2610        """Handle saturation editing changes."""
2611        ev = self.sliderSaturation.value()
2612        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(ev))
2613        self.controller.sliderSaturationChange(ev)
2614
2615    def sliderContrastChange(self):
2616        """Handle contrast editing changes."""
2617        ev = self.sliderContrast.value()
2618        self.valueContrast.setText(str(ev))
2619        self.controller.sliderContrastChange(ev)
2620
2621    def sliderHueShiftChange(self):
2622        """Handle hue shift editing changes."""
2623        hs = self.sliderHueShift.value()
2624        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(hs))
2625        self.controller.sliderHueShiftChange(hs)
2626
2627    def checkboxMaskChange(self):
2628        """Handle selection mask preview toggle."""
2629        self.controller.checkboxMaskChange(self.checkboxMask.isChecked())
2630# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2631# --- class GeometryView(QFrame) -----------------------------------------------------------
2632# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2633class GeometryView(QFrame):
2634    """
2635    Geometric transformation controls for rotation and cropping adjustments.
2636    
2637    Provides sliders for basic geometric corrections including:
2638    - Vertical cropping adjustment: Fine-tune vertical positioning for aspect ratio cropping
2639    - Rotation: Small angle corrections for straightening images
2640    
2641    Layout:
2642    +------------------------------------------+
2643    | cropping adj. [slider] [value]          |
2644    | rotation      [slider] [value]          |
2645    +------------------------------------------+
2646    
2647    Attributes:
2648        - controller (GeometryController): Parent controller reference
2649        - sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement: Vertical cropping offset slider
2650        - valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement: Cropping adjustment value display
2651        - sliderRotation: Rotation angle slider
2652        - valueRotation: Rotation value display
2653    """
2654    def __init__(self, _controller):
2655        """
2656        Initialize geometry transformation interface.
2657        
2658        Args:
2659            _controller (GeometryController): Parent controller instance
2660        """
2661        super().__init__()
2662        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2663        self.controller = _controller
2664
2665        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2666
2667        # cropping adjustement 
2668        self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QFrame()
2669        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QHBoxLayout()
2670        self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setLayout(self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2671        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2672        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setRange(-100,+100)
2673        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setValue(0)
2674        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setSingleStep(1) 
2675        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QLineEdit()
2676        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setText(str(0.0))  
2677        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(QLabel("cropping adj."))
2678        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2679        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2680
2681        # rotation 
2682        self.frameRotation = QFrame()
2683        self.layoutRotation = QHBoxLayout()
2684        self.frameRotation.setLayout(self.layoutRotation)
2685        self.sliderRotation =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2686        self.sliderRotation.setRange(-60,+60)
2687        self.sliderRotation.setValue(0)
2688        self.sliderRotation.setSingleStep(1) 
2689        self.valueRotation = QLineEdit()
2690        self.valueRotation.setText(str(0.0))  
2691        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(QLabel("rotation"))
2692        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(self.sliderRotation)
2693        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(self.valueRotation)
2694
2695        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2696        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameRotation)
2697
2698        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2699
2700        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange)
2701        self.sliderRotation.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderRotationChange)
2702
2703    # callbacks
2704    def sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange(self):
2705        """Handle vertical cropping adjustment changes."""
2706        v = self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.value()
2707        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setText(str(v))
2708        # call controller
2709        self.controller.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange(v)
2710
2711    def sliderRotationChange(self):
2712        """Handle rotation angle changes with 1/6 degree precision."""
2713        v = self.sliderRotation.value()/6
2714        self.valueRotation.setText(str(v))
2715        # call controller
2716        self.controller.sliderRotationChange(v)
2717# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2718# --- class ImageAestheticsView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------
2719# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2720class ImageAestheticsView(QSplitter):
2721    """
2722    Image aesthetics analysis and color palette visualization interface.
2723    
2724    Provides tools for analyzing image aesthetics including dominant color
2725    extraction, color palette generation, and visual composition analysis.
2726    Uses K-means clustering for color palette extraction with configurable
2727    parameters.
2728    
2729    Layout Structure:
2730    - Top: Image preview showing current processing result
2731    - Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
2732      * Process output selector (which processing step to analyze)
2733      * Number of colors configuration (2-8 colors)
2734      * Generated color palette visualization
2735    
2736    Analysis Features:
2737    - Dominant color extraction using K-means clustering
2738    - Configurable color count (2-8 dominant colors)
2739    - Process step selection for analysis input
2740    - Visual color palette representation
2741    - Extensible for composition and strength line analysis
2742    
2743    Layout:
2744    +------------------------------------------+
2745    | [Image Preview]                          |
2746    +------------------------------------------+
2747    | color palette                            |
2748    | process output: [dropdown]               |
2749    | number of colors: [spinbox]              |
2750    | [Color Palette Visualization]           |
2751    +------------------------------------------+
2752    
2753    Attributes:
2754        - controller (ImageAestheticsController): Parent controller reference
2755        - imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Main image display
2756        - labelColorPalette: Color palette section label
2757        - labelNodeSelector: Process output selection label
2758        - nodeSelector (QComboBox): Process step selection dropdown
2759        - labelColorsNumber: Color count configuration label
2760        - nbColors (QSpinBox): Number of colors to extract (2-8)
2761        - paletteImageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Color palette display
2762        - scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for controls
2763    """
2764    def __init__(self, _controller, build=False):
2765        """
2766        Initialize image aesthetics analysis interface.
2767        
2768        Args:
2769            _controller (ImageAestheticsController): Parent controller instance
2770            build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction
2771        """
2772        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> AestheticsImageView.__init__(",")")
2773        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
2774
2775        self.controller = _controller
2776
2777        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2778
2779        self.layout = QVBoxLayout()
2780
2781        # --------------- color palette: node selector(node name), color number, palette image.
2782        self.labelColorPalette = QLabel("color palette")
2783        self.labelNodeSelector = QLabel("process output:")
2784        self.nodeSelector = QComboBox(self)
2785
2786        # recover process nodes names from buildProcessPipe
2787        processNodeNameList = []
2788        emptyProcessPipe = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
2789        for node in emptyProcessPipe.processNodes: processNodeNameList.append(node.name)
2790
2791        # add 'output' at the end to help user
2792        processNodeNameList.append('output')
2793
2794        self.nodeSelector.addItems(processNodeNameList)
2795        self.nodeSelector.setCurrentIndex(len(processNodeNameList)-1)
2796
2797        # QSpinBox
2798        self.labelColorsNumber = QLabel("number of colors:")
2799        self.nbColors = QSpinBox(self)
2800        self.nbColors.setRange(2,8)
2801        self.nbColors.setValue(5)
2802
2803        self.paletteImageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2804        imgPalette = hdrCore.aesthetics.Palette('defaultLab5',np.linspace([0,0,0],[100,0,0],5),hdrCore.image.ColorSpace.build('Lab'), hdrCore.image.imageType.SDR).createImageOfPalette()
2805        self.paletteImageWidgetController.setImage(imgPalette)
2806        self.paletteImageWidgetController.view.setMinimumSize(40, 10)
2807
2808        # add widgets to layout
2809        self.layout.addWidget(self.labelColorPalette)
2810        self.layout.addWidget(self.labelNodeSelector)
2811        self.layout.addWidget(self.nodeSelector)
2812        self.layout.addWidget(self.labelColorsNumber)
2813        self.layout.addWidget(self.nbColors)
2814        self.layout.addWidget(self.paletteImageWidgetController.view)
2815
2816        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
2817
2818        # scroll and etc.
2819        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
2820        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
2821        self.container = QLabel()
2822        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
2823        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
2824        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
2825
2826        # add widget to QSplitter
2827        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
2828        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
2829        self.setSizes([60,40])
2830        # --------------- composition:
2831        # --------------- strength line:
2832
2833    def setProcessPipe(self,processPipe, paletteImg):
2834        """
2835        Update display with new ProcessPipe and color palette.
2836        
2837        Args:
2838            processPipe (ProcessPipe): New processing pipeline to display
2839            paletteImg (numpy.ndarray): Generated color palette visualization
2840        """
2841        self.imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
2842        self.paletteImageWidgetController.setImage(paletteImg)
2843# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2844# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2845class ColorEditorsAutoView(QPushButton):
2846    """
2847    Automatic color editor configuration button.
2848    
2849    Provides a single button interface for automatically configuring
2850    multiple color editors based on K-means analysis of image colors.
2851    When activated, analyzes the current image to extract dominant colors
2852    and sets up color editors with appropriate selection ranges.
2853    
2854    Warning: Activating this function will reset all existing color
2855    editor configurations to the automatically generated settings.
2856    
2857    Attributes:
2858        - controller (ColorEditorsAutoController): Parent controller reference
2859    """
2860    def __init__(self,controller):
2861        """
2862        Initialize automatic color editor configuration button.
2863        
2864        Args:
2865            controller (ColorEditorsAutoController): Parent controller instance
2866        """
2867        super().__init__("auto color selection [! reset edit]")
2868        self.controller = controller
2869
2870        self.clicked.connect(self.controller.auto)
2871# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
class ImageWidgetView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QWidget): 
 94class ImageWidgetView(QWidget):
 95    """
 96    Basic image display widget for showing numpy arrays or HDR images.
 97    
 98    Provides a simple image viewer widget that can display color data
 99    as QPixmap with automatic scaling and aspect ratio preservation.
100    Handles clipping and conversion from floating-point HDR data to
101    8-bit RGB for Qt display.
102    
103    Attributes:
104        - controller: Reference to controlling ImageWidgetController
105        - label (QLabel): Qt label widget for pixmap display
106        - imagePixmap (QPixmap): Current pixmap for display
107    """
108
109    def __init__(self,controller,colorData = None):
110        """
111        Initialize image widget view.
112        
113        Args:
114            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
115            colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display
116        """
117        super().__init__()
118        self.controller = controller
119        self.label = QLabel(self)   # create a QtLabel for pixmap
120        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
121        # self.colorData = colorData  # image content attributes           
122        self.setPixmap(colorData)  
123
124    def resize(self):
125        """
126        Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.
127        
128        Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget
129        while preserving aspect ratio.
130        """
131        self.label.resize(self.size())
132        self.label.setPixmap(self.imagePixmap.scaled(self.size(),Qt.KeepAspectRatio))
133
134    def resizeEvent(self,event):
135        """
136        Handle Qt resize events.
137        
138        Args:
139            event: Qt resize event object
140        """
141        self.resize()
142        super().resizeEvent(event)
143
144    def setPixmap(self,colorData):
145        """
146        Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.
147        
148        Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.
149        Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.
150        
151        Args:
152            colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)
153            
154        Returns:
155            QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display
156        """
157        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): 
158            colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
159        # self.colorData = colorData
160        height, width, channel = colorData.shape   # compute pixmap
161        bytesPerLine = channel * width
162        # clip
163        colorData[colorData>1.0] = 1.0
164        colorData[colorData<0.0] = 0.0
165
166        qImg = QImage((colorData*255).astype(np.uint8), width, height, bytesPerLine, QImage.Format_RGB888) # QImage
167        self.imagePixmap = QPixmap.fromImage(qImg)
168        self.resize()
169
170        return self.imagePixmap
171
172    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
173        """
174        Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.
175        
176        Args:
177            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display
178        """
179        self.imagePixmap = qPixmap
180        self.resize()
181
182    def emptyImageColorData(): 
183        """
184        Generate default placeholder image for empty display.
185        
186        Returns:
187            numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3) 
188        """
189        return np.ones((90,160,3))*(220/255)

Basic image display widget for showing numpy arrays or HDR images.

Provides a simple image viewer widget that can display color data as QPixmap with automatic scaling and aspect ratio preservation. Handles clipping and conversion from floating-point HDR data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.

Attributes: - controller: Reference to controlling ImageWidgetController - label (QLabel): Qt label widget for pixmap display - imagePixmap (QPixmap): Current pixmap for display

ImageWidgetView(controller, colorData=None) 
109    def __init__(self,controller,colorData = None):
110        """
111        Initialize image widget view.
112        
113        Args:
114            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
115            colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display
116        """
117        super().__init__()
118        self.controller = controller
119        self.label = QLabel(self)   # create a QtLabel for pixmap
120        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
121        # self.colorData = colorData  # image content attributes           
122        self.setPixmap(colorData)

Initialize image widget view.

Args: controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display

controller
label
def resize(self): 
124    def resize(self):
125        """
126        Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.
127        
128        Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget
129        while preserving aspect ratio.
130        """
131        self.label.resize(self.size())
132        self.label.setPixmap(self.imagePixmap.scaled(self.size(),Qt.KeepAspectRatio))

Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.

Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget while preserving aspect ratio.

def resizeEvent(self, event): 
134    def resizeEvent(self,event):
135        """
136        Handle Qt resize events.
137        
138        Args:
139            event: Qt resize event object
140        """
141        self.resize()
142        super().resizeEvent(event)

Handle Qt resize events.

Args: event: Qt resize event object

def setPixmap(self, colorData): 
144    def setPixmap(self,colorData):
145        """
146        Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.
147        
148        Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.
149        Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.
150        
151        Args:
152            colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)
153            
154        Returns:
155            QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display
156        """
157        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): 
158            colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
159        # self.colorData = colorData
160        height, width, channel = colorData.shape   # compute pixmap
161        bytesPerLine = channel * width
162        # clip
163        colorData[colorData>1.0] = 1.0
164        colorData[colorData<0.0] = 0.0
165
166        qImg = QImage((colorData*255).astype(np.uint8), width, height, bytesPerLine, QImage.Format_RGB888) # QImage
167        self.imagePixmap = QPixmap.fromImage(qImg)
168        self.resize()
169
170        return self.imagePixmap

Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.

Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display. Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.

Args: colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)

Returns: QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display

def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap): 
172    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
173        """
174        Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.
175        
176        Args:
177            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display
178        """
179        self.imagePixmap = qPixmap
180        self.resize()

Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.

Args: qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display

def emptyImageColorData(): 
182    def emptyImageColorData(): 
183        """
184        Generate default placeholder image for empty display.
185        
186        Returns:
187            numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3) 
188        """
189        return np.ones((90,160,3))*(220/255)

Generate default placeholder image for empty display.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3)

class FigureWidget(matplotlib.backends.backend_qtagg.FigureCanvasQTAgg): 
193class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas):
194    """
195    Matplotlib figure widget for embedding plots in Qt interface.
196    
197    Provides matplotlib integration for displaying curves, histograms,
198    and other plots within the Qt GUI. Used primarily for tone curve
199    visualization and editing.
200    
201    Attributes:
202        - fig (Figure): Matplotlib figure object
203        - axes: Matplotlib axes for plotting
204    """
205
206    def __init__(self, parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100):
207        """
208        Initialize matplotlib figure widget.
209        
210        Args:
211            parent: Parent Qt widget
212            width (int): Figure width in inches
213            height (int): Figure height in inches
214            dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch
215        """
216        # create Figure
217        self.fig = Figure(figsize=(width, height), dpi=dpi)
218        self.axes = self.fig.add_subplot(111)
219        FigureCanvas.__init__(self, self.fig)    # explicite call of super constructor
220        self.setParent(parent)
221        FigureCanvas.updateGeometry(self)
222        self.setMinimumSize(200, 200)
223
224    def plot(self,X,Y,mode, clear=False):
225        """
226        Draw line plot with specified data and style.
227        
228        Args:
229            X (array-like): X-coordinate data points
230            Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points
231            mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-')
232            clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing
233        """
234        if clear: self.axes.clear()
235        self.axes.plot(X,Y,mode)
236        try:
237            self.fig.canvas.draw()
238        except Exception:
239            time.sleep(0.5)
240            self.fig.canvas.draw()

Matplotlib figure widget for embedding plots in Qt interface.

Provides matplotlib integration for displaying curves, histograms, and other plots within the Qt GUI. Used primarily for tone curve visualization and editing.

Attributes: - fig (Figure): Matplotlib figure object - axes: Matplotlib axes for plotting

FigureWidget(parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100) 
206    def __init__(self, parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100):
207        """
208        Initialize matplotlib figure widget.
209        
210        Args:
211            parent: Parent Qt widget
212            width (int): Figure width in inches
213            height (int): Figure height in inches
214            dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch
215        """
216        # create Figure
217        self.fig = Figure(figsize=(width, height), dpi=dpi)
218        self.axes = self.fig.add_subplot(111)
219        FigureCanvas.__init__(self, self.fig)    # explicite call of super constructor
220        self.setParent(parent)
221        FigureCanvas.updateGeometry(self)
222        self.setMinimumSize(200, 200)

Initialize matplotlib figure widget.

Args: parent: Parent Qt widget width (int): Figure width in inches height (int): Figure height in inches dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch

fig
axes
def plot(self, X, Y, mode, clear=False): 
224    def plot(self,X,Y,mode, clear=False):
225        """
226        Draw line plot with specified data and style.
227        
228        Args:
229            X (array-like): X-coordinate data points
230            Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points
231            mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-')
232            clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing
233        """
234        if clear: self.axes.clear()
235        self.axes.plot(X,Y,mode)
236        try:
237            self.fig.canvas.draw()
238        except Exception:
239            time.sleep(0.5)
240            self.fig.canvas.draw()

Draw line plot with specified data and style.

Args: X (array-like): X-coordinate data points Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-') clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing

class ImageGalleryView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QSplitter): 
245class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter):
246    """
247    Grid-based image gallery with pagination and navigation controls.
248    
249    Displays multiple images in a configurable grid layout with pagination
250    support for large image collections. Provides interactive navigation
251    buttons and supports different grid configurations (1x1, 3x2, 6x4, 9x6).
252    
253    Layout Structure:
254        +-------------------------------------------+
255        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | \
256        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
257        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
258        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
259        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
260        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
261        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |   >   GridLayout
262        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
263        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
264        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
265        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
266        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | /
267        +-------------------------------------------+  <    splitter
268        | [<] [1x1][3x2][6x4][9x6][page number] [>] |       [pushButton] HorizontalLayout
269        +-------------------------------------------+
270    
271    Attributes:
272        - controller: Reference to ImageGalleryController
273        - shapeMode: Current grid layout mode (GalleryMode enum)
274        - pageNumber (int): Current page index (0-based)
275        - imagesControllers (list): List of ImageWidgetController instances
276        - images (QFrame): Frame containing image grid
277        - imagesLayout (QGridLayout): Grid layout for images
278        - buttons (QWidget): Navigation button container
279        - pageNumberLabel (QLabel): Current page display
280    """
281    def __init__(self,controller_=None,shapeMode=None):
282        """
283        Initialize image gallery view.
284        
285        Args:
286            controller_: Parent ImageGalleryController instance
287            shapeMode: Initial grid layout mode (defaults to 3x2)
288        """
289        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.__init__(",")")
290
291        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
292
293        self.controller= controller_
294        self.shapeMode = controller.GalleryMode._3x2 if not shapeMode else shapeMode    # default display mode 
295        self.pageNumber =0
296
297        self.imagesControllers = []
298
299        self.images = QFrame()
300        self.images.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
301        self.imagesLayout = QGridLayout()
302        self.images.setLayout(self.imagesLayout)
303
304        self.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
305
306        self.previousPageButton =   QPushButton('<')
307        self.previousPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_previousPage)
308        self._1x1Button =           QPushButton('1x1')
309        self._1x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_1x1)
310        self._2x1Button =           QPushButton('2x1')
311        self._2x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_2x1)
312        self._3x2Button =           QPushButton('3x2')
313        self._3x2Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_3x2)
314        self._6x4Button =           QPushButton('6x4')
315        self._6x4Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_6x4)
316        self._9x6Button =           QPushButton('9x6')
317        self._9x6Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_9x6)
318        self.nextPageButton =       QPushButton('>')
319        self.nextPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_nextPage)
320
321        self.pageNumberLabel = QLabel(str(self.pageNumber)+"/ ...")
322
323        self.buttons = QWidget()
324        self.buttonsLayout = QHBoxLayout()
325        self.buttons.setLayout(self.buttonsLayout)
326        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.previousPageButton)
327        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._1x1Button)
328        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._2x1Button)
329        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._3x2Button)
330        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._6x4Button)
331        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._9x6Button)
332        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.nextPageButton)
333
334        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.pageNumberLabel)
335
336        self.addWidget(self.images)
337        self.addWidget(self.buttons)
338        self.setSizes([1525,82])
339
340    def currentPage(self): 
341        """
342        Get current page number.
343        
344        Returns:
345            int: Current page index (0-based)
346        """
347        return self.pageNumber
348
349    def changePageNumber(self,step):
350        """
351        Navigate to different page with wraparound.
352        
353        Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic
354        wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.
355        
356        Args:
357            step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)
358        """
359        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(",step,")")
360
361        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
362        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
363
364        if len(self.controller.model.processPipes) > 0 :
365
