class EditImageView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QSplitter): 
1012class EditImageView(QSplitter):
1013    """
1014    Comprehensive HDR image editing interface with all editing controls.
1015    
1016    Provides the complete HDR editing interface with real-time preview and
1017    extensive parameter controls. Includes exposure, contrast, tone curves,
1018    color editing, geometry transformations, and HDR preview capabilities.
1019    
1020    Layout Structure:
1021    - Top: Image preview showing real-time edits
1022    - Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
1023      * Basic adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1024      * Advanced tone curve with B-spline control points
1025      * Lightness masking for selective editing
1026      * Five independent color editors in LCH space
1027      * Automatic color selection tools
1028      * Geometry transformations (rotation, cropping)
1029      * HDR preview controls
1030    
1031    Attributes:
1032        - controller (EditImageController): Parent controller reference
1033        - imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
1034        - exposure, contrast, saturation (AdvanceSliderController): Basic adjustment controls
1035        - tonecurve (ToneCurveController): B-spline tone curve editor
1036        - lightnessmask (LightnessMaskController): Tone range masking
1037        - colorEditor0-4 (LchColorSelectorController): Independent color editors
1038        - colorEditorsAuto (ColorEditorsAutoController): Automatic color selection
1039        - geometry (GeometryController): Rotation and cropping controls
1040        - hdrPreview (HDRviewerView): HDR display preview interface
1041        - scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for all controls
1042    """
1043
1044    def __init__(self, _controller, build=False):
1045        """
1046        Initialize comprehensive HDR editing interface.
1047        
1048        Creates all editing controls and sets up the scrollable interface
1049        with proper callback connections for real-time parameter updates.
1050        
1051        Args:
1052            _controller (EditImageController): Parent controller instance
1053            build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction
1054        """
1055        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.__init__(",")")
1056        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
1057
1058        self.controller = _controller
1059
1060        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1061
1062        self.layout = QVBoxLayout()
1063
1064        # exposure ----------------------
1065        self.exposure = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "exposure",0,(-10,+10),0.25)
1066        # call back functions
1067        self.exposure.callBackAutoPush = self.autoExposure
1068        self.exposure.callBackValueChange = self.changeExposure
1069        self.layout.addWidget(self.exposure.view)
1070
1071        # contrast ----------------------
1072        self.contrast = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "contrast",0,(-100,+100),1)
1073        # call back functions
1074        self.contrast.callBackAutoPush = self.autoContrast
1075        self.contrast.callBackValueChange = self.changeContrast
1076        self.layout.addWidget(self.contrast.view)
1077
1078        # tonecurve ----------------------
1079        self.tonecurve = controller.ToneCurveController(self)        
1080        self.layout.addWidget(self.tonecurve.view)                   
1081
1082        # mask ----------------------
1083        self.lightnessmask = controller.LightnessMaskController(self)        
1084        self.layout.addWidget(self.lightnessmask.view)                   
1085 
1086        # saturation ----------------------
1087        self.saturation = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "saturation",0,(-100,+100),1)
1088        # call back functions
1089        self.saturation.callBackAutoPush = self.autoSaturation
1090        self.saturation.callBackValueChange = self.changeSaturation
1091        self.layout.addWidget(self.saturation.view)
1092
1093        # color0 ----------------------
1094        self.colorEditor0 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor0")
1095        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor0.view)
1096
1097        # color1 ----------------------
1098        self.colorEditor1 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor1")
1099        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor1.view)
1100
1101        # color2 ----------------------
1102        self.colorEditor2 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor2")
1103        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor2.view)
1104
1105        # color3 ----------------------
1106        self.colorEditor3 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor3")
1107        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor3.view)
1108
1109        # color1 ----------------------
1110        self.colorEditor4 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor4")
1111        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor4.view)
1112
1113        # auto color selection ----------------------
1114        # -----
1115        self.colorEditorsAuto = controller.ColorEditorsAutoController(self,
1116                                                                      [self.colorEditor0,
1117                                                                       self.colorEditor1,
1118                                                                       self.colorEditor2,
1119                                                                       self.colorEditor3,
1120                                                                       self.colorEditor4],
1121                                                                       "saturation")
1122        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditorsAuto.view)
1123        # -----
1124
1125        # geometry ----------------------
1126        self.geometry = controller.GeometryController(self)
1127        self.layout.addWidget(self.geometry.view)
1128
1129        # hdr preview ----------------------
1130        self.hdrPreview = HDRviewerView(self.controller.controllerHDR, build)
1131        self.controller.controllerHDR.setView(self.hdrPreview)
1132        self.layout.addWidget(self.hdrPreview)
1133
1134        # scroll ------------------------------------------------
1135        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
1136
1137        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
1138        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
1139        self.container = QLabel()
1140        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
1141        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
1142        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
1143
1144        # adding widgets to self (QSplitter)
1145        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
1146        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
1147        self.setSizes([60,40])
1148
1149    def setImage(self,image):
1150        """
1151        Update the image preview display.
1152        
1153        Args:
1154            image (hdrCore.image.Image): Image to display in preview
1155            
1156        Returns:
1157            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
1158        """
1159        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setImage(",image.name,")")
1160        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image)
1161
1162    def autoExposure(self):
1163        """
1164        Trigger automatic exposure calculation.
1165        
1166        Delegates to controller for automatic exposure value computation
1167        based on image histogram analysis.
1168        """
1169        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoExposure(",")")
1170
1171        self.controller.autoExposure()
1172        pass
1173
1174    def changeExposure(self, value):
1175        """
1176        Handle manual exposure adjustment changes.
1177        
1178        Args:
1179            value (float): New exposure value in EV stops
1180        """
1181        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeExposure(",")")
1182
1183        self.controller.changeExposure(value)
1184        pass
1185
1186    def autoContrast(self):
1187        """
1188        Trigger automatic contrast calculation.
1189        
1190        Placeholder for automatic contrast adjustment functionality.
1191        """
1192        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoContrast(",")")
1193        pass
1194
1195    def changeContrast(self, value):
1196        """
1197        Handle manual contrast adjustment changes.
1198        
1199        Args:
1200            value (float): New contrast value
1201        """
1202        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeContrast(",")")
1203
1204        self.controller.changeContrast(value)
1205        pass
1206
1207    def autoSaturation(self):
1208        """
1209        Trigger automatic saturation calculation.
1210        
1211        Placeholder for automatic saturation adjustment functionality.
1212        """
1213        print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoSaturation(",")")
1214        pass
1215
1216    def changeSaturation(self,value):   ### TO DO
1217        """
1218        Handle manual saturation adjustment changes.
1219        
1220        Args:
1221            value (float): New saturation value
1222        """
1223        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.changeSaturation(",")")
1224        self.controller.changeSaturation(value)
1225
1226    def plotToneCurve(self): 
1227        """
1228        Update tone curve visualization in the curve editor.
1229        """
1230        self.tonecurve.plotCurve()
1231 
1232    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1233        """
1234        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1235        
1236        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1237        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1238        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1239        consistent editing state.
1240        
1241        Args:
1242            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1243        """
1244        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1245
1246        # exposure
1247        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1248        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1249        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1250        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1251
1252        # contrast
1253        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1254        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1255        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1256        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1257
1258        # tonecurve
1259        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1260        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1261        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1262        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1263
1264        # lightnessmask
1265        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1266        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1267        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1268        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1269
1270        # saturation
1271        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1272        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1273        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1274        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1275
1276        # colorEditor0
1277        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1278        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1279        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1280        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1281
1282        # colorEditor1
1283        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1284        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1285        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1286        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1287
1288        # colorEditor2
1289        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1290        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1291        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1292        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1293
1294        # colorEditor3
1295        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1296        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor3")
1297        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1298        self.colorEditor3.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1299        
1300        # colorEditor4
1301        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1302        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor4")
1303        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1304        self.colorEditor4.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1305        
1306        # geometry
1307        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1308        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
1309        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1310        self.geometry.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)

Comprehensive HDR image editing interface with all editing controls.

Provides the complete HDR editing interface with real-time preview and extensive parameter controls. Includes exposure, contrast, tone curves, color editing, geometry transformations, and HDR preview capabilities.

Layout Structure:

  • Top: Image preview showing real-time edits
  • Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
    • Basic adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
    • Advanced tone curve with B-spline control points
    • Lightness masking for selective editing
    • Five independent color editors in LCH space
    • Automatic color selection tools
    • Geometry transformations (rotation, cropping)
    • HDR preview controls

Attributes: - controller (EditImageController): Parent controller reference - imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller - exposure, contrast, saturation (AdvanceSliderController): Basic adjustment controls - tonecurve (ToneCurveController): B-spline tone curve editor - lightnessmask (LightnessMaskController): Tone range masking - colorEditor0-4 (LchColorSelectorController): Independent color editors - colorEditorsAuto (ColorEditorsAutoController): Automatic color selection - geometry (GeometryController): Rotation and cropping controls - hdrPreview (HDRviewerView): HDR display preview interface - scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for all controls

EditImageView(_controller, build=False) 
1044    def __init__(self, _controller, build=False):
1045        """
1046        Initialize comprehensive HDR editing interface.
1047        
1048        Creates all editing controls and sets up the scrollable interface
1049        with proper callback connections for real-time parameter updates.
1050        
1051        Args:
1052            _controller (EditImageController): Parent controller instance
1053            build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction
1054        """
1055        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.__init__(",")")
1056        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
1057
1058        self.controller = _controller
1059
1060        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1061
1062        self.layout = QVBoxLayout()
1063
1064        # exposure ----------------------
1065        self.exposure = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "exposure",0,(-10,+10),0.25)
1066        # call back functions
1067        self.exposure.callBackAutoPush = self.autoExposure
1068        self.exposure.callBackValueChange = self.changeExposure
1069        self.layout.addWidget(self.exposure.view)
1070
1071        # contrast ----------------------
1072        self.contrast = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "contrast",0,(-100,+100),1)
1073        # call back functions
1074        self.contrast.callBackAutoPush = self.autoContrast
1075        self.contrast.callBackValueChange = self.changeContrast
1076        self.layout.addWidget(self.contrast.view)
1077
1078        # tonecurve ----------------------
1079        self.tonecurve = controller.ToneCurveController(self)        
1080        self.layout.addWidget(self.tonecurve.view)                   
1081
1082        # mask ----------------------
1083        self.lightnessmask = controller.LightnessMaskController(self)        
1084        self.layout.addWidget(self.lightnessmask.view)                   
1085 
1086        # saturation ----------------------
1087        self.saturation = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "saturation",0,(-100,+100),1)
1088        # call back functions
1089        self.saturation.callBackAutoPush = self.autoSaturation
1090        self.saturation.callBackValueChange = self.changeSaturation
1091        self.layout.addWidget(self.saturation.view)

1095        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor0.view)

1107        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor3.view)
1108

1110        self.colorEditor4 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor4")
1111        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor4.view)
1112
1113        # auto color selection ----------------------
1114        # -----
1115        self.colorEditorsAuto = controller.ColorEditorsAutoController(self,
1116                                                                      [self.colorEditor0,
1117                                                                       self.colorEditor1,
1118                                                                       self.colorEditor2,
1119                                                                       self.colorEditor3,
1120                                                                       self.colorEditor4],
1121                                                                       "saturation")
1122        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditorsAuto.view)
1123        # -----
1124
1125        # geometry ----------------------
1126        self.geometry = controller.GeometryController(self)
1127        self.layout.addWidget(self.geometry.view)
1128
1129        # hdr preview ----------------------
1130        self.hdrPreview = HDRviewerView(self.controller.controllerHDR, build)
1131        self.controller.controllerHDR.setView(self.hdrPreview)
1132        self.layout.addWidget(self.hdrPreview)
1133
1134        # scroll ------------------------------------------------
1135        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
1136
1137        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
1138        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
1139        self.container = QLabel()
1140        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
1141        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
1142        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
1143
1144        # adding widgets to self (QSplitter)
1145        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
1146        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
1147        self.setSizes([60,40])

Initialize comprehensive HDR editing interface.

Creates all editing controls and sets up the scrollable interface with proper callback connections for real-time parameter updates.

Args: _controller (EditImageController): Parent controller instance build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction

controller
imageWidgetController
def layout(unknown):

contrast

saturation
colorEditor0
colorEditor1
colorEditor2
colorEditor3
colorEditor4
colorEditorsAuto
def geometry(unknown):
hdrPreview
def scroll(unknown):
container
def setImage(self, image):

1151        Update the image preview display.
1152

1154            image (hdrCore.image.Image): Image to display in preview
1155            
1156        Returns:
1157            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
1158        """

1160        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image)

def autoExposure(self):

1164        Trigger automatic exposure calculation.
1165        
1166        Delegates to controller for automatic exposure value computation
1167        based on image histogram analysis.
1168        """
1169        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> EditImageView.autoExposure(",")")
1170
1171        self.controller.autoExposure()
1172        pass

def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
1232    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1233        """
1234        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1235        
1236        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1237        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1238        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1239        consistent editing state.
1240        
1241        Args:
1242            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1243        """
1244        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1245
1246        # exposure
1247        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1248        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1249        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1250        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1251
1252        # contrast
1253        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1254        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1255        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1256        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1257
1258        # tonecurve
1259        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1260        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1261        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1262        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1263
1264        # lightnessmask
1265        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1266        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1267        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1268        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1269
1270        # saturation
1271        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1272        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1273        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1274        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1275
1276        # colorEditor0
1277        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1278        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1279        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1280        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1281
1282        # colorEditor1
1283        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1284        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1285        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1286        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1287
1288        # colorEditor2
1289        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1290        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1291        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1292        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1293
1294        # colorEditor3
1295        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1296        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor3")
1297        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1298        self.colorEditor3.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1299        
1300        # colorEditor4
1301        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1302        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor4")
1303        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1304        self.colorEditor4.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1305        
1306        # geometry
1307        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1308        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
1309        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1310        self.geometry.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)

Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.

Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration. This method is called when switching between images to maintain consistent editing state.

Args: processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters

class MultiDockView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDockWidget): 
1314class MultiDockView(QDockWidget):
1315    """
1316    Multi-panel dockable widget for uHDR right-side interface.
1317    
1318    Provides a switchable dock widget that can display different interface panels
1319    for HDR image editing workflow. Manages three distinct child controllers
1320    that handle different aspects of image processing: editing controls, metadata
1321    information, and aesthetics analysis.
1322    
1323    Panel Types:
1324    - Panel 0: Edit Image Controls (EditImageController)
1325      * HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1326      * Tone curve editing with B-spline controls
1327      * Color space editing in LCH coordinates
1328      * Geometry transformations and HDR preview
1329      
1330    - Panel 1: Image Information & Metadata (ImageInfoController)
1331      * EXIF data display and technical parameters
1332      * User-defined workflow tags and classification
1333      * File information and processing metadata
1334      
1335    - Panel 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis (ImageAestheticsController)
1336      * Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
1337      * Dominant color visualization and analysis
1338      * Aesthetic composition metrics
1339    
1340    Architecture:
1341    The MultiDockView implements a container pattern where child controllers
1342    manage their own views and business logic. The dock handles view switching,
1343    memory management, and state synchronization between panels.
1344    
1345    Docking Behavior:
1346    - Allowed areas: Left or Right dock areas only
1347    - Default position: Right side of main window
1348    - Resizable and detachable following Qt dock widget standards
1349    - Panel switching preserves current ProcessPipe state
1350    
1351    State Management:
1352    When switching panels, the dock:
1353    1. Destroys the current view to free memory
1354    2. Rebuilds the target view with current ProcessPipe
1355    3. Updates the dock widget content
1356    4. Maintains consistent state across panels
1357    
1358    Memory Optimization:
1359    Views are dynamically created/destroyed during switching to minimize
1360    memory usage, especially important for the complex editing interface
1361    with matplotlib components and HDR preview capabilities.
1362    
1363    Attributes:
1364        - controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller for dock management
1365        - childControllers (list): List of three child controllers:
1366            [0] EditImageController - editing interface
1367            [1] ImageInfoController - metadata interface  
1368            [2] ImageAestheticsController - aesthetics interface
1369        - childController: Currently active child controller
1370        - active (int): Index of currently displayed panel (0, 1, or 2)
1371    
1372    Usage Example:
1373        # Create multi-dock with HDR support
1374        dock = MultiDockView(controller, HDRcontroller)
1375        
1376        # Switch to metadata panel
1377        dock.switch(1)
1378        
1379        # Update with new image
1380        dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
1381    
1382    Integration:
1383    The MultiDockView integrates with the main AppView through menu
1384    shortcuts (Ctrl+E, Ctrl+I, Ctrl+A) that trigger panel switching
1385    for efficient workflow navigation.
1386    """
1387    def __init__(self, _controller, HDRcontroller=None):
1388        """
1389        Initialize multi-panel dock widget with child controllers.
1390        
1391        Creates the dock widget with three child controllers for different
1392        interface panels. Sets up docking constraints, initializes the
1393        editing panel as default, and establishes parent-child relationships.
1394        
1395        Args:
1396            _controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller managing dock behavior
1397            HDRcontroller (HDRController, optional): HDR display controller for
1398                real-time HDR preview functionality in editing panel
1399                
1400        Child Controllers Created:
1401            - EditImageController: Complete HDR editing interface with tone curves,
1402              color editors, geometry controls, and HDR preview
1403            - ImageInfoController: Metadata display and user tag management
1404            - ImageAestheticsController: Color palette and aesthetic analysis
1405        """
1406        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.__init__(",")")
1407
1408        super().__init__("Image Edit/Info")
1409        self.controller = _controller
1410
1411        self.setAllowedAreas(Qt.LeftDockWidgetArea | Qt.RightDockWidgetArea)
1412      
1413        self.childControllers = [
1414            controller.EditImageController(self, HDRcontroller), 
1415            controller.ImageInfoController(self), 
1416            controller.ImageAestheticsController(self)]
1417            #controller.ImageQualityController(self, HDRcontroller)]
1418        self.childController = self.childControllers[0]
1419        self.active = 0
1420        self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1421        self.repaint()
1422    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1423    def switch(self,nb):
1424        """
1425        Switch to different dock panel and rebuild interface.
1426        
1427        Changes the active dock panel by destroying the current view,
1428        selecting the target child controller, rebuilding the view with
1429        current ProcessPipe state, and updating the dock widget content.
1430        
1431        Panel Selection:
1432        - nb = 0: Edit Image Controls
1433          * HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1434          * Tone curve editing and lightness masking
1435          * Color space editing in LCH coordinates
1436          * Geometry transformations and HDR preview
1437          
1438        - nb = 1: Image Information & Metadata  
1439          * EXIF data display and technical parameters
1440          * User-defined workflow tags and classification
1441          * File information and processing metadata
1442          
1443        - nb = 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis
1444          * Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
1445          * Dominant color visualization and analysis
1446          * Aesthetic composition analysis
1447        
1448        Memory Management:
1449        The method performs proper cleanup by calling deleteLater() on the
1450        current view before creating the new one, preventing memory leaks
1451        from complex widgets like matplotlib figures and HDR previews.
1452        
1453        Args:
1454            nb (int): Target panel index (0, 1, or 2). Values outside range
1455                     are wrapped using modulo operation for safety.
1456                     
1457        State Preservation:
1458        Current ProcessPipe is retrieved and passed to the new panel to
1459        maintain consistent state across interface switches.
1460        """
1461        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.switch(",nb,")")
1462
1463        if nb != self.active:
1464     
1465            self.active = (nb)%len(self.childControllers)
1466            self.childController.view.deleteLater()
1467            self.childController = self.childControllers[self.active]
1468            # rebuild view 
1469            processPipe = self.controller.parent.imageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1470            self.childController.buildView(processPipe)
1471            self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1472            self.repaint()
1473    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1474    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1475        """
1476        Update current panel with new ProcessPipe data.
1477        
1478        Delegates ProcessPipe updates to the currently active child controller,
1479        allowing each panel to refresh its content and interface state based
1480        on the new image and processing parameters.
1481        
1482        Panel-Specific Behavior:
1483        - Edit Panel: Restores all editing parameters (exposure, contrast, 
1484          tone curves, color editors, geometry) from ProcessPipe nodes
1485        - Info Panel: Updates metadata display, EXIF data, and user tags
1486        - Aesthetics Panel: Regenerates color palette and analysis visualization
1487        
1488        Args:
1489            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image
1490                and all associated editing parameters and metadata
1491                
1492        Returns:
1493            Result of active child controller's setProcessPipe() method,
1494            typically the updated image or processing result
1495            
1496        Note:
1497            This method provides a unified interface for ProcessPipe updates
1498            regardless of which panel is currently active, simplifying the
1499            dock management logic in the parent controller.
1500        """
1501        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
1502        return self.childController.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

Multi-panel dockable widget for uHDR right-side interface.

Provides a switchable dock widget that can display different interface panels for HDR image editing workflow. Manages three distinct child controllers that handle different aspects of image processing: editing controls, metadata information, and aesthetics analysis.

Panel Types:

  • Panel 0: Edit Image Controls (EditImageController)
    • HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
    • Tone curve editing with B-spline controls
    • Color space editing in LCH coordinates
    • Geometry transformations and HDR preview

  • Panel 1: Image Information & Metadata (ImageInfoController)

    • EXIF data display and technical parameters
    • User-defined workflow tags and classification
    • File information and processing metadata

  • Panel 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis (ImageAestheticsController)

    • Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
    • Dominant color visualization and analysis
    • Aesthetic composition metrics

Architecture: The MultiDockView implements a container pattern where child controllers manage their own views and business logic. The dock handles view switching, memory management, and state synchronization between panels.

Docking Behavior:

  • Allowed areas: Left or Right dock areas only
  • Default position: Right side of main window
  • Resizable and detachable following Qt dock widget standards
  • Panel switching preserves current ProcessPipe state

State Management: When switching panels, the dock:

  1. Destroys the current view to free memory
  2. Rebuilds the target view with current ProcessPipe
  3. Updates the dock widget content
  4. Maintains consistent state across panels

Memory Optimization: Views are dynamically created/destroyed during switching to minimize memory usage, especially important for the complex editing interface with matplotlib components and HDR preview capabilities.

Attributes: - controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller for dock management - childControllers (list): List of three child controllers: [0] EditImageController - editing interface [1] ImageInfoController - metadata interface
[2] ImageAestheticsController - aesthetics interface - childController: Currently active child controller - active (int): Index of currently displayed panel (0, 1, or 2)

Usage Example: # Create multi-dock with HDR support dock = MultiDockView(controller, HDRcontroller)

# Switch to metadata panel
dock.switch(1)

# Update with new image
dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

Integration: The MultiDockView integrates with the main AppView through menu shortcuts (Ctrl+E, Ctrl+I, Ctrl+A) that trigger panel switching for efficient workflow navigation.

MultiDockView(_controller, HDRcontroller=None) 
1387    def __init__(self, _controller, HDRcontroller=None):
1388        """
1389        Initialize multi-panel dock widget with child controllers.
1390        
1391        Creates the dock widget with three child controllers for different
1392        interface panels. Sets up docking constraints, initializes the
1393        editing panel as default, and establishes parent-child relationships.
1394        
1395        Args:
1396            _controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller managing dock behavior
1397            HDRcontroller (HDRController, optional): HDR display controller for
1398                real-time HDR preview functionality in editing panel
1399                
1400        Child Controllers Created:
1401            - EditImageController: Complete HDR editing interface with tone curves,
1402              color editors, geometry controls, and HDR preview
1403            - ImageInfoController: Metadata display and user tag management
1404            - ImageAestheticsController: Color palette and aesthetic analysis
1405        """
1406        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.__init__(",")")
1407
1408        super().__init__("Image Edit/Info")
1409        self.controller = _controller
1410
1411        self.setAllowedAreas(Qt.LeftDockWidgetArea | Qt.RightDockWidgetArea)
1412      
1413        self.childControllers = [
1414            controller.EditImageController(self, HDRcontroller), 
1415            controller.ImageInfoController(self), 
1416            controller.ImageAestheticsController(self)]
1417            #controller.ImageQualityController(self, HDRcontroller)]
1418        self.childController = self.childControllers[0]
1419        self.active = 0
1420        self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1421        self.repaint()

Initialize multi-panel dock widget with child controllers.

Creates the dock widget with three child controllers for different interface panels. Sets up docking constraints, initializes the editing panel as default, and establishes parent-child relationships.

Args: _controller (MultiDockController): Parent controller managing dock behavior HDRcontroller (HDRController, optional): HDR display controller for real-time HDR preview functionality in editing panel

Child Controllers Created: - EditImageController: Complete HDR editing interface with tone curves, color editors, geometry controls, and HDR preview - ImageInfoController: Metadata display and user tag management - ImageAestheticsController: Color palette and aesthetic analysis

controller
childControllers
childController
active
def switch(self, nb): 
1423    def switch(self,nb):
1424        """
1425        Switch to different dock panel and rebuild interface.
1426        
1427        Changes the active dock panel by destroying the current view,
1428        selecting the target child controller, rebuilding the view with
1429        current ProcessPipe state, and updating the dock widget content.
1430        
1431        Panel Selection:
1432        - nb = 0: Edit Image Controls
1433          * HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1434          * Tone curve editing and lightness masking
1435          * Color space editing in LCH coordinates
1436          * Geometry transformations and HDR preview
1437          
1438        - nb = 1: Image Information & Metadata  
1439          * EXIF data display and technical parameters
1440          * User-defined workflow tags and classification
1441          * File information and processing metadata
1442          
1443        - nb = 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis
1444          * Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
1445          * Dominant color visualization and analysis
1446          * Aesthetic composition analysis
1447        
1448        Memory Management:
1449        The method performs proper cleanup by calling deleteLater() on the
1450        current view before creating the new one, preventing memory leaks
1451        from complex widgets like matplotlib figures and HDR previews.
1452        
1453        Args:
1454            nb (int): Target panel index (0, 1, or 2). Values outside range
1455                     are wrapped using modulo operation for safety.
1456                     
1457        State Preservation:
1458        Current ProcessPipe is retrieved and passed to the new panel to
1459        maintain consistent state across interface switches.
1460        """
1461        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.switch(",nb,")")
1462
1463        if nb != self.active:
1464     
1465            self.active = (nb)%len(self.childControllers)
1466            self.childController.view.deleteLater()
1467            self.childController = self.childControllers[self.active]
1468            # rebuild view 
1469            processPipe = self.controller.parent.imageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1470            self.childController.buildView(processPipe)
1471            self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1472            self.repaint()

Switch to different dock panel and rebuild interface.

Changes the active dock panel by destroying the current view, selecting the target child controller, rebuilding the view with current ProcessPipe state, and updating the dock widget content.

Panel Selection:

  • nb = 0: Edit Image Controls
    • HDR parameter adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
    • Tone curve editing and lightness masking
    • Color space editing in LCH coordinates
    • Geometry transformations and HDR preview

  • nb = 1: Image Information & Metadata

    • EXIF data display and technical parameters
    • User-defined workflow tags and classification
    • File information and processing metadata

  • nb = 2: Image Aesthetics Analysis

    • Color palette extraction using K-means clustering
    • Dominant color visualization and analysis
    • Aesthetic composition analysis

Memory Management: The method performs proper cleanup by calling deleteLater() on the current view before creating the new one, preventing memory leaks from complex widgets like matplotlib figures and HDR previews.

Args: nb (int): Target panel index (0, 1, or 2). Values outside range are wrapped using modulo operation for safety.

State Preservation: Current ProcessPipe is retrieved and passed to the new panel to maintain consistent state across interface switches.

def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
1474    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1475        """
1476        Update current panel with new ProcessPipe data.
1477        
1478        Delegates ProcessPipe updates to the currently active child controller,
1479        allowing each panel to refresh its content and interface state based
1480        on the new image and processing parameters.
1481        
1482        Panel-Specific Behavior:
1483        - Edit Panel: Restores all editing parameters (exposure, contrast, 
1484          tone curves, color editors, geometry) from ProcessPipe nodes
1485        - Info Panel: Updates metadata display, EXIF data, and user tags
1486        - Aesthetics Panel: Regenerates color palette and analysis visualization
1487        
1488        Args:
1489            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image
1490                and all associated editing parameters and metadata
1491                
1492        Returns:
1493            Result of active child controller's setProcessPipe() method,
1494            typically the updated image or processing result
1495            
1496        Note:
1497            This method provides a unified interface for ProcessPipe updates
1498            regardless of which panel is currently active, simplifying the
1499            dock management logic in the parent controller.
1500        """
1501        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
1502        return self.childController.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

Update current panel with new ProcessPipe data.

Delegates ProcessPipe updates to the currently active child controller, allowing each panel to refresh its content and interface state based on the new image and processing parameters.

Panel-Specific Behavior:

  • Edit Panel: Restores all editing parameters (exposure, contrast, tone curves, color editors, geometry) from ProcessPipe nodes
  • Info Panel: Updates metadata display, EXIF data, and user tags
  • Aesthetics Panel: Regenerates color palette and analysis visualization

Args: processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image and all associated editing parameters and metadata

Returns: Result of active child controller's setProcessPipe() method, typically the updated image or processing result

Note: This method provides a unified interface for ProcessPipe updates regardless of which panel is currently active, simplifying the dock management logic in the parent controller.

class AdvanceSliderView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame): 
1508class AdvanceSliderView(QFrame):
1509    """
1510    Enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality and numerical input.
1511    
1512    Provides a comprehensive parameter adjustment interface combining a horizontal
1513    slider with automatic calculation, manual reset, and direct numerical input
1514    capabilities. Used extensively throughout uHDR for real-time parameter
1515    adjustments in exposure, contrast, saturation, and other image processing
1516    controls.
1517    
1518    Widget Components:
1519    - Descriptive label: Parameter name display
1520    - Auto button: Triggers automatic parameter calculation
1521    - Value editor: Direct numerical input with validation
1522    - Reset button: Restores default parameter value
1523    - Horizontal slider: Continuous parameter adjustment
1524    
1525    Value Handling:
1526    The widget internally scales slider positions based on step size for
1527    precise control. Slider range is calculated as (range[0]/step, range[1]/step)
1528    to provide appropriate granularity for different parameter types.
1529    
1530    Layout Structure:
1531    +------------------------------------------+
1532    | [Label] [Auto] [Value Input] [Reset]    |  <- First row (horizontal)
1533    +------------------------------------------+
1534    | [========== Slider =================]   |  <- Second row
1535    +------------------------------------------+
1536    
1537    Callback Integration:
1538    All user interactions automatically trigger controller callbacks:
1539    - Slider movement: controller.sliderChange()
1540    - Reset button: controller.reset()
1541    - Auto button: controller.auto()
1542    
1543    Value input changes are handled through slider synchronization.
1544    
1545    Attributes:
1546        - controller: Parent controller for callback delegation
1547        - firstrow (QFrame): Container for top row controls
1548        - label (QLabel): Parameter name display
1549        - auto (QPushButton): Automatic parameter calculation trigger
1550        - editValue (QLineEdit): Direct numerical input field with validation
1551        - reset (QPushButton): Default value restoration button
1552        - slider (QSlider): Main parameter adjustment control
1553        - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Vertical layout manager
1554        - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for first row
1555    
1556    Example Usage:
1557        # Exposure control with ±10 EV range and 0.25 step
1558        exposure_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0, (-10, 10), 0.25)
1559        
1560        # Contrast control with ±100 range and 1.0 step  
1561        contrast_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0, (-100, 100), 1.0)
1562    
1563    Technical Notes:
1564        - QDoubleValidator ensures only valid numerical input
1565        - Step size determines slider precision and scaling
1566        - Range values should be compatible with step size
1567        - Controller callbacks handle actual parameter application
1568        - Widget maintains internal consistency between slider and text input
1569    """
1570    def __init__(self, controller, name,defaultValue, range, step):
1571        """
1572        Initialize enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality.
1573        
1574        Creates a complete parameter adjustment interface with slider, buttons,
1575        and text input. Automatically configures scaling, validation, and
1576        callback connections for seamless integration.
1577        
1578        Args:
1579            controller: Parent controller object implementing callback methods:
1580                - sliderChange(): Handle slider value changes
1581                - reset(): Restore default parameter value  
1582                - auto(): Calculate automatic parameter value
1583            name (str): Human-readable parameter name for label display
1584            defaultValue (float): Initial parameter value and reset target
1585            range (tuple): Parameter range as (min_value, max_value)
1586            step (float): Parameter adjustment granularity and slider scaling factor
1587                
1588        Example:
1589            # Create exposure slider: -10 to +10 EV, 0.25 EV steps
1590            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0.0, (-10.0, 10.0), 0.25)
1591            
1592            # Create contrast slider: -100 to +100, 1.0 steps  
1593            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0.0, (-100.0, 100.0), 1.0)
1594        """
1595        super().__init__()
1596        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1597        self.controller = controller
1598        self.firstrow = QFrame()
1599
1600        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1601        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
1602        
1603        self.firstrow.setLayout(self.hbox)
1604
1605        self.label= QLabel(name)
1606        self.auto = QPushButton("auto")
1607        self.editValue = QLineEdit()
1608        self.editValue.setValidator(QDoubleValidator())
1609        self.editValue.setText(str(defaultValue))
1610        self.reset = QPushButton("reset")
1611
1612        self.hbox.addWidget(self.label)
1613        self.hbox.addWidget(self.auto)
1614        self.hbox.addWidget(self.editValue)
1615        self.hbox.addWidget(self.reset)
1616
1617        self.slider = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1618        self.slider.setRange(int(range[0]/step),int(range[1]/step))
1619        self.slider.setValue(int(defaultValue/step))
1620        self.slider.setSingleStep(1) 
1621
1622        self.vbox.addWidget(self.firstrow)
1623        self.vbox.addWidget(self.slider)
1624
1625        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1626
1627        # callBackFunctions slider/reset/auto
1628        self.slider.valueChanged.connect(self.controller.sliderChange)
1629        self.reset.clicked.connect(self.controller.reset)
1630        self.auto.clicked.connect(self.controller.auto)

Enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality and numerical input.

Provides a comprehensive parameter adjustment interface combining a horizontal slider with automatic calculation, manual reset, and direct numerical input capabilities. Used extensively throughout uHDR for real-time parameter adjustments in exposure, contrast, saturation, and other image processing controls.

Widget Components:

  • Descriptive label: Parameter name display
  • Auto button: Triggers automatic parameter calculation
  • Value editor: Direct numerical input with validation
  • Reset button: Restores default parameter value
  • Horizontal slider: Continuous parameter adjustment

Value Handling: The widget internally scales slider positions based on step size for precise control. Slider range is calculated as (range[0]/step, range[1]/step) to provide appropriate granularity for different parameter types.

Layout Structure: +------------------------------------------+ | [Label] [Auto] [Value Input] [Reset] | <- First row (horizontal) +------------------------------------------+ | [========== Slider =================] | <- Second row +------------------------------------------+

Callback Integration: All user interactions automatically trigger controller callbacks:

  • Slider movement: controller.sliderChange()
  • Reset button: controller.reset()
  • Auto button: controller.auto()

Value input changes are handled through slider synchronization.

Attributes: - controller: Parent controller for callback delegation - firstrow (QFrame): Container for top row controls - label (QLabel): Parameter name display - auto (QPushButton): Automatic parameter calculation trigger - editValue (QLineEdit): Direct numerical input field with validation - reset (QPushButton): Default value restoration button - slider (QSlider): Main parameter adjustment control - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Vertical layout manager - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for first row

Example Usage: # Exposure control with ±10 EV range and 0.25 step exposure_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0, (-10, 10), 0.25)

# Contrast control with ±100 range and 1.0 step  
contrast_slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0, (-100, 100), 1.0)

Technical Notes: - QDoubleValidator ensures only valid numerical input - Step size determines slider precision and scaling - Range values should be compatible with step size - Controller callbacks handle actual parameter application - Widget maintains internal consistency between slider and text input

AdvanceSliderView(controller, name, defaultValue, range, step) 
1570    def __init__(self, controller, name,defaultValue, range, step):
1571        """
1572        Initialize enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality.
1573        
1574        Creates a complete parameter adjustment interface with slider, buttons,
1575        and text input. Automatically configures scaling, validation, and
1576        callback connections for seamless integration.
1577        
1578        Args:
1579            controller: Parent controller object implementing callback methods:
1580                - sliderChange(): Handle slider value changes
1581                - reset(): Restore default parameter value  
1582                - auto(): Calculate automatic parameter value
1583            name (str): Human-readable parameter name for label display
1584            defaultValue (float): Initial parameter value and reset target
1585            range (tuple): Parameter range as (min_value, max_value)
1586            step (float): Parameter adjustment granularity and slider scaling factor
1587                
1588        Example:
1589            # Create exposure slider: -10 to +10 EV, 0.25 EV steps
1590            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0.0, (-10.0, 10.0), 0.25)
1591            
1592            # Create contrast slider: -100 to +100, 1.0 steps  
1593            slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0.0, (-100.0, 100.0), 1.0)
1594        """
1595        super().__init__()
1596        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1597        self.controller = controller
1598        self.firstrow = QFrame()
1599
1600        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1601        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
1602        
1603        self.firstrow.setLayout(self.hbox)
1604
1605        self.label= QLabel(name)
1606        self.auto = QPushButton("auto")
1607        self.editValue = QLineEdit()
1608        self.editValue.setValidator(QDoubleValidator())
1609        self.editValue.setText(str(defaultValue))
1610        self.reset = QPushButton("reset")
1611
1612        self.hbox.addWidget(self.label)
1613        self.hbox.addWidget(self.auto)
1614        self.hbox.addWidget(self.editValue)
1615        self.hbox.addWidget(self.reset)
1616
1617        self.slider = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1618        self.slider.setRange(int(range[0]/step),int(range[1]/step))
1619        self.slider.setValue(int(defaultValue/step))
1620        self.slider.setSingleStep(1) 
1621
1622        self.vbox.addWidget(self.firstrow)
1623        self.vbox.addWidget(self.slider)
1624
1625        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1626
1627        # callBackFunctions slider/reset/auto
1628        self.slider.valueChanged.connect(self.controller.sliderChange)
1629        self.reset.clicked.connect(self.controller.reset)
1630        self.auto.clicked.connect(self.controller.auto)

Initialize enhanced slider widget with auto/reset functionality.

Creates a complete parameter adjustment interface with slider, buttons, and text input. Automatically configures scaling, validation, and callback connections for seamless integration.

Args: controller: Parent controller object implementing callback methods: - sliderChange(): Handle slider value changes - reset(): Restore default parameter value
- auto(): Calculate automatic parameter value name (str): Human-readable parameter name for label display defaultValue (float): Initial parameter value and reset target range (tuple): Parameter range as (min_value, max_value) step (float): Parameter adjustment granularity and slider scaling factor

Example: # Create exposure slider: -10 to +10 EV, 0.25 EV steps slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "exposure", 0.0, (-10.0, 10.0), 0.25)

# Create contrast slider: -100 to +100, 1.0 steps  
slider = AdvanceSliderView(controller, "contrast", 0.0, (-100.0, 100.0), 1.0)

class ToneCurveView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame): 
1634class ToneCurveView(QFrame):
1635    """
1636    B-spline tone curve editing interface with matplotlib visualization.
1637    
1638    Provides comprehensive tone curve editing capabilities using B-spline interpolation
1639    with individual control over five tonal ranges: shadows, blacks, mediums, whites,
1640    and highlights. Features real-time curve visualization and semi-automatic curve
1641    generation for enhanced workflow efficiency.
1642    
1643    Tone Curve Controls:
1644    - Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions control
1645    - Blacks (20-40%): Dark tone adjustments  
1646    - Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone contrast and brightness
1647    - Whites (60-80%): Bright tone refinement
1648    - Highlights (80-100%): Brightest regions control
1649    
1650    Interface Features:
1651    - Real-time B-spline curve visualization using matplotlib
1652    - Individual sliders for each tonal range (0-100 scale)
1653    - Reset buttons for selective parameter restoration
1654    - Semi-automatic curve generation based on image analysis
1655    - Live curve updates during parameter adjustment
1656    
1657    B-spline Implementation:
1658    The tone curve uses B-spline interpolation with fixed control points
1659    at the five tonal boundaries. User adjustments modify the Y-coordinates
1660    of these control points while maintaining smooth curve transitions.
1661    
1662    Mathematical Foundation:
1663    - Input domain: [0, 100] (percentage lightness)
1664    - Output range: [0, 100] (adjusted lightness)
1665    - Control points: (0,0), (20,shadows), (40,blacks), (60,mediums), (80,whites), (100,highlights)
1666    - Interpolation: Cubic B-spline with C² continuity
1667    
1668    Layout Structure:
1669    +------------------------------------------+
1670    | [Matplotlib Curve Visualization]        |
1671    +------------------------------------------+
1672    | [Auto Curve Generation Button]          |
1673    +------------------------------------------+
1674    | highlights: [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1675    | whites:     [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1676    | mediums:    [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1677    | blacks:     [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1678    | shadows:    [slider] [value] [reset]    |
1679    +------------------------------------------+
1680    
1681    Attributes:
1682        - controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller for curve calculations
1683        - curve (FigureWidget): Matplotlib figure widget for curve display
1684        - autoCurve (QPushButton): Semi-automatic curve generation button
1685        - sliderShadows, sliderBlacks, sliderMediums, sliderWhites, sliderHighlights: 
1686            Individual tone range control sliders (0-100 range)
1687        - editShadows, editBlacks, editMediums, editWhites, editHighlights:
1688            Text input fields showing current slider values
1689        - resetShadows, resetBlacks, resetMediums, resetWhites, resetHighlights:
1690            Reset buttons for individual tone ranges
1691        - labelShadows, labelBlacks, labelMediums, labelWhites, labelHighlights:
1692            Descriptive labels for each tone range
1693    
1694    Usage Example:
1695        The tone curve allows precise control over image tonality:
1696        - Lift shadows (increase slider) to reveal dark detail
1697        - Lower highlights (decrease slider) to recover bright detail  
1698        - Adjust mediums for overall contrast and brightness
1699        - Use auto curve for intelligent initial settings
1700        
1701    Technical Notes:
1702        - All slider values represent percentage adjustments (0-100)
1703        - Curve updates trigger real-time image processing
1704        - B-spline ensures smooth transitions between control points
1705        - Auto curve analyzes image histogram for optimal settings
1706    """
1707
1708    def __init__(self, controller):
1709        """
1710        Initialize B-spline tone curve editing interface.
1711        
1712        Creates the complete tone curve editing interface with matplotlib
1713        visualization and individual control sliders for five tonal ranges.
1714        Sets up all UI components, connects callbacks, and initializes
1715        default parameter values.
1716        
1717        Args:
1718            controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller instance
1719                that handles curve calculations and image processing
1720        """

1722        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1723
1724        self.controller = controller
1725
1726        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1727

1729        self.curve = FigureWidget(self) 
1730        self.curve.setMinimumSize(200, 600)

1743        self.containerShadows.setLayout(self.hboxShadows)
1744        
1745        self.containerBlacks = QFrame()

1747        self.containerBlacks.setLayout(self.hboxBlacks)

1755        self.containerWhites.setLayout(self.hboxWhites)

1758        self.hboxHighlights = QHBoxLayout()
1759        self.containerHighlights.setLayout(self.hboxHighlights)
1760

1762        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerAuto) #  zj add for semi-auto curve                                                                       
1763        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerHighlights)
1764        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerWhites)
1765        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerMediums)
1766        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerBlacks)
1767        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerShadows)
1768

1770        # autoCurve button
1771        self.autoCurve = QPushButton("auto")

1773        self.hboxAuto.setAlignment(Qt.AlignCenter)
1774        # zj add for semi-auto curve end

1777        self.sliderShadows = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1778        self.sliderShadows.setRange(0,100)
1779        self.sliderShadows.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1780        self.editShadows = QLineEdit()
1781        self.editShadows.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1782        self.resetShadows = QPushButton("reset")
1783        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.labelShadows)
1784        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.sliderShadows)
1785        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.editShadows)
1786        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.resetShadows)
1787

1791        self.sliderBlacks.setRange(0,100)
1792        self.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['blacks'][1]))

1831        self.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['highlights'][1]))
