1842        # callBackFunctions slider/reset
1843        self.sliderShadows.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderShadowsChange)
1844        self.sliderBlacks.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderBlacksChange)
1845        self.sliderMediums.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderMediumsChange)
1846        self.sliderWhites.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderWhitesChange)
1847        self.sliderHighlights.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHighlightsChange)
1848
1849        self.resetShadows.clicked.connect(self.resetShadowsCB)
1850        self.resetBlacks.clicked.connect(self.resetBlacksCB)
1851        self.resetMediums.clicked.connect(self.resetMediumsCB)
1852        self.resetWhites.clicked.connect(self.resetWhitesCB)
1853        self.resetHighlights.clicked.connect(self.resetHighlightsCB)
1854        self.autoCurve.clicked.connect(self.controller.autoCurve)  #  zj add for semi-auto curve 
1855                                                                                         
1856
1857    def sliderShadowsChange(self):
1858        """
1859        Handle shadows slider value changes and update tone curve.
1860        
1861        Called when the shadows slider (0-20% tonal range) is moved.
1862        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1863        if callbacks are active.
1864        """
1865        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1866            value = self.sliderShadows.value()
1867            self.controller.sliderChange("shadows", value)
1868
1869    def sliderBlacksChange(self):
1870        """
1871        Handle blacks slider value changes and update tone curve.
1872        
1873        Called when the blacks slider (20-40% tonal range) is moved.
1874        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1875        if callbacks are active.
1876        """
1877        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1878            value = self.sliderBlacks.value()
1879            self.controller.sliderChange("blacks", value)
1880
1881    def sliderMediumsChange(self):
1882        """
1883        Handle mediums slider value changes and update tone curve.
1884        
1885        Called when the mediums slider (40-60% tonal range) is moved.
1886        This controls mid-tone contrast and overall image brightness.
1887        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1888        if callbacks are active.
1889        """
1890        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1891            value = self.sliderMediums.value()
1892            self.controller.sliderChange("mediums", value)
1893
1894    def sliderWhitesChange(self):
1895        """
1896        Handle whites slider value changes and update tone curve.
1897        
1898        Called when the whites slider (60-80% tonal range) is moved.
1899        Used for bright tone refinement and highlight detail control.
1900        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1901        if callbacks are active.
1902        """
1903        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1904            value = self.sliderWhites.value()
1905            self.controller.sliderChange("whites", value)
1906
1907    def sliderHighlightsChange(self):
1908        """
1909        Handle highlights slider value changes and update tone curve.
1910        
1911        Called when the highlights slider (80-100% tonal range) is moved.
1912        Controls the brightest image regions and highlight detail recovery.
1913        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1914        if callbacks are active.
1915        """
1916        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1917            value = self.sliderHighlights.value()
1918            self.controller.sliderChange("highlights", value)
1919
1920    def resetShadowsCB(self):
1921        """Reset shadows slider to default value and update curve."""
1922        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("shadows")
1923
1924    def resetBlacksCB(self):
1925        """Reset blacks slider to default value and update curve."""
1926        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("blacks")
1927    
1928    def resetMediumsCB(self):
1929        """Reset mediums slider to default value and update curve."""
1930        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("mediums")
1931
1932    def resetWhitesCB(self):
1933        """Reset whites slider to default value and update curve."""
1934        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("whites")
1935
1936    def resetHighlightsCB(self):
1937        """Reset highlights slider to default value and update curve."""
1938        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.reset("highlights")

B-spline tone curve editing interface with matplotlib visualization.

Provides comprehensive tone curve editing capabilities using B-spline interpolation with individual control over five tonal ranges: shadows, blacks, mediums, whites, and highlights. Features real-time curve visualization and semi-automatic curve generation for enhanced workflow efficiency.

Tone Curve Controls:

  • Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions control
  • Blacks (20-40%): Dark tone adjustments
  • Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone contrast and brightness
  • Whites (60-80%): Bright tone refinement
  • Highlights (80-100%): Brightest regions control

Interface Features:

  • Real-time B-spline curve visualization using matplotlib
  • Individual sliders for each tonal range (0-100 scale)
  • Reset buttons for selective parameter restoration
  • Semi-automatic curve generation based on image analysis
  • Live curve updates during parameter adjustment

B-spline Implementation: The tone curve uses B-spline interpolation with fixed control points at the five tonal boundaries. User adjustments modify the Y-coordinates of these control points while maintaining smooth curve transitions.

Mathematical Foundation:

  • Input domain: [0, 100] (percentage lightness)
  • Output range: [0, 100] (adjusted lightness)
  • Control points: (0,0), (20,shadows), (40,blacks), (60,mediums), (80,whites), (100,highlights)
  • Interpolation: Cubic B-spline with C² continuity

Layout Structure: +------------------------------------------+ | [Matplotlib Curve Visualization] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Auto Curve Generation Button] | +------------------------------------------+ | highlights: [slider] [value] [reset] | | whites: [slider] [value] [reset] | | mediums: [slider] [value] [reset] | | blacks: [slider] [value] [reset] | | shadows: [slider] [value] [reset] | +------------------------------------------+

Attributes: - controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller for curve calculations - curve (FigureWidget): Matplotlib figure widget for curve display - autoCurve (QPushButton): Semi-automatic curve generation button - sliderShadows, sliderBlacks, sliderMediums, sliderWhites, sliderHighlights: Individual tone range control sliders (0-100 range) - editShadows, editBlacks, editMediums, editWhites, editHighlights: Text input fields showing current slider values - resetShadows, resetBlacks, resetMediums, resetWhites, resetHighlights: Reset buttons for individual tone ranges - labelShadows, labelBlacks, labelMediums, labelWhites, labelHighlights: Descriptive labels for each tone range

Usage Example: The tone curve allows precise control over image tonality: - Lift shadows (increase slider) to reveal dark detail - Lower highlights (decrease slider) to recover bright detail
- Adjust mediums for overall contrast and brightness - Use auto curve for intelligent initial settings

Technical Notes: - All slider values represent percentage adjustments (0-100) - Curve updates trigger real-time image processing - B-spline ensures smooth transitions between control points - Auto curve analyzes image histogram for optimal settings

ToneCurveView(controller) 
1708    def __init__(self, controller):
1709        """
1710        Initialize B-spline tone curve editing interface.
1711        
1712        Creates the complete tone curve editing interface with matplotlib
1713        visualization and individual control sliders for five tonal ranges.
1714        Sets up all UI components, connects callbacks, and initializes
1715        default parameter values.
1716        
1717        Args:
1718            controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller instance
1719                that handles curve calculations and image processing
1720        """
1721        super().__init__()
1722        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1723
1724        self.controller = controller
1725
1726        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1727
1728        # figure
1729        self.curve = FigureWidget(self) 
1730        self.curve.setMinimumSize(200, 600)
1731
1732        self.curve.plot([0.0,100],[0.0,100.0],'r--')
1733
1734        #containers
1735        
1736        # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1737        self.containerAuto = QFrame() 
1738        self.hboxAuto = QHBoxLayout() 
1739        self.containerAuto.setLayout(self.hboxAuto)
1740        # zj add for semi-auto curve end                                
1741        self.containerShadows = QFrame()
1742        self.hboxShadows = QHBoxLayout()
1743        self.containerShadows.setLayout(self.hboxShadows)
1744        
1745        self.containerBlacks = QFrame()
1746        self.hboxBlacks = QHBoxLayout()
1747        self.containerBlacks.setLayout(self.hboxBlacks)
1748
1749        self.containerMediums = QFrame()
1750        self.hboxMediums = QHBoxLayout()
1751        self.containerMediums.setLayout(self.hboxMediums)
1752
1753        self.containerWhites = QFrame()
1754        self.hboxWhites = QHBoxLayout()
1755        self.containerWhites.setLayout(self.hboxWhites)
1756
1757        self.containerHighlights = QFrame()
1758        self.hboxHighlights = QHBoxLayout()
1759        self.containerHighlights.setLayout(self.hboxHighlights)
1760
1761        self.vbox.addWidget(self.curve)
1762        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerAuto) #  zj add for semi-auto curve                                                                       
1763        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerHighlights)
1764        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerWhites)
1765        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerMediums)
1766        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerBlacks)
1767        self.vbox.addWidget(self.containerShadows)
1768
1769        # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1770        # autoCurve button
1771        self.autoCurve = QPushButton("auto")
1772        self.hboxAuto.addWidget(self.autoCurve)
1773        self.hboxAuto.setAlignment(Qt.AlignCenter)
1774        # zj add for semi-auto curve end
1775        # shadows
1776        self.labelShadows = QLabel("shadows")
1777        self.sliderShadows = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1778        self.sliderShadows.setRange(0,100)
1779        self.sliderShadows.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1780        self.editShadows = QLineEdit()
1781        self.editShadows.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['shadows'][1]))
1782        self.resetShadows = QPushButton("reset")
1783        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.labelShadows)
1784        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.sliderShadows)
1785        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.editShadows)
1786        self.hboxShadows.addWidget(self.resetShadows)
1787
1788        # blacks
1789        self.labelBlacks = QLabel("  blacks  ")
1790        self.sliderBlacks = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1791        self.sliderBlacks.setRange(0,100)
1792        self.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['blacks'][1]))
1793        self.editBlacks = QLineEdit()
1794        self.editBlacks.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['blacks'][1]))
1795        self.resetBlacks = QPushButton("reset")
1796        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.labelBlacks)
1797        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.sliderBlacks)
1798        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.editBlacks)
1799        self.hboxBlacks.addWidget(self.resetBlacks)
1800
1801        # mediums
1802        self.labelMediums = QLabel("mediums")
1803        self.sliderMediums = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1804        self.sliderMediums.setRange(0,100)
1805        self.sliderMediums.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['mediums'][1]))
1806        self.editMediums = QLineEdit()
1807        self.editMediums.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['mediums'][1]))
1808        self.resetMediums = QPushButton("reset")
1809        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.labelMediums)
1810        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.sliderMediums)
1811        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.editMediums)
1812        self.hboxMediums.addWidget(self.resetMediums)
1813
1814        # whites
1815        self.labelWhites = QLabel("  whites  ")
1816        self.sliderWhites = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1817        self.sliderWhites.setRange(0,100)
1818        self.sliderWhites.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['whites'][1]))
1819        self.editWhites = QLineEdit()
1820        self.editWhites.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['whites'][1]))
1821        self.resetWhites = QPushButton("reset")
1822        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.labelWhites)
1823        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.sliderWhites)
1824        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.editWhites)
1825        self.hboxWhites.addWidget(self.resetWhites)
1826
1827        # highlights
1828        self.labelHighlights = QLabel("highlights")
1829        self.sliderHighlights = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1830        self.sliderHighlights.setRange(0,100)
1831        self.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(self.controller.model.default['highlights'][1]))
1832        self.editHighlights = QLineEdit()
1833        self.editHighlights.setText(str(self.controller.model.default['highlights'][1]))
1834        self.resetHighlights = QPushButton("reset")
1835        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.labelHighlights)
1836        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.sliderHighlights)
1837        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.editHighlights)
1838        self.hboxHighlights.addWidget(self.resetHighlights)
1839
1840        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1841
1842        # callBackFunctions slider/reset
1843        self.sliderShadows.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderShadowsChange)
1844        self.sliderBlacks.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderBlacksChange)
1845        self.sliderMediums.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderMediumsChange)
1846        self.sliderWhites.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderWhitesChange)
1847        self.sliderHighlights.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHighlightsChange)
1848
1849        self.resetShadows.clicked.connect(self.resetShadowsCB)
1850        self.resetBlacks.clicked.connect(self.resetBlacksCB)
1851        self.resetMediums.clicked.connect(self.resetMediumsCB)
1852        self.resetWhites.clicked.connect(self.resetWhitesCB)
1853        self.resetHighlights.clicked.connect(self.resetHighlightsCB)
1854        self.autoCurve.clicked.connect(self.controller.autoCurve)  #  zj add for semi-auto curve

Initialize B-spline tone curve editing interface.

Creates the complete tone curve editing interface with matplotlib visualization and individual control sliders for five tonal ranges. Sets up all UI components, connects callbacks, and initializes default parameter values.

Args: controller (ToneCurveController): Parent controller instance that handles curve calculations and image processing

def sliderShadowsChange(self): 
1857    def sliderShadowsChange(self):
1858        """
1859        Handle shadows slider value changes and update tone curve.
1860        
1861        Called when the shadows slider (0-20% tonal range) is moved.
1862        Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing
1863        if callbacks are active.
1864        """
1865        if self.controller.callBackActive:
1866            value = self.sliderShadows.value()
1867            self.controller.sliderChange("shadows", value)

Handle shadows slider value changes and update tone curve.

Called when the shadows slider (0-20% tonal range) is moved. Updates the curve visualization and triggers image processing if callbacks are active.

class LightnessMaskView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGroupBox): 
1942class LightnessMaskView(QGroupBox):
1943    """
1944    Lightness-based masking control interface for selective tone editing.
1945    
1946    Provides checkbox controls for enabling/disabling tone range masks that allow
1947    selective application of editing adjustments to specific lightness regions.
1948    Works in conjunction with tone curve editing to provide precise control over
1949    which tonal ranges are affected by parameter changes.
1950    
1951    Tone Range Masking:
1952    The interface allows independent masking of five distinct lightness ranges
1953    corresponding to the tone curve control points:
1954    
1955    - Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions
1956      * Deep shadows, true blacks, dark details
1957      * Useful for shadow lifting without affecting other tones
1958      
1959    - Blacks (20-40%): Lower mid-tone range
1960      * Dark greys, low-key lighting areas
1961      * Controls separation between shadows and mid-tones
1962      
1963    - Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone range
1964      * Standard exposure areas, skin tones, neutral greys
1965      * Primary brightness and contrast control zone
1966      
1967    - Whites (60-80%): Upper mid-tone range  
1968      * Bright areas, light greys, highlight transitions
1969      * Controls separation between mid-tones and highlights
1970      
1971    - Highlights (80-100%): Brightest image regions
1972      * Specular highlights, light sources, bright reflections
1973      * Useful for highlight recovery and bright detail control
1974    
1975    Masking Functionality:
1976    When checkboxes are enabled, subsequent editing operations (exposure,
1977    contrast, color adjustments) are selectively applied only to pixels
1978    within the specified lightness ranges. This allows for:
1979    
1980    - Targeted shadow lifting without brightening highlights
1981    - Selective highlight recovery without darkening shadows
1982    - Mid-tone contrast adjustments without clipping extremes
1983    - Color corrections limited to specific tonal ranges
1984    - Fine-tuned local adjustments for advanced workflow
1985    
1986    Layout Structure:
1987    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1988    | mask lightness                                               |
1989    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1990    | [✓] shadows [✓] blacks [✓] mediums [✓] whites [✓] highlights|
1991    +---------------------------------------------------------------+
1992    
1993    Integration:
1994    The mask settings work seamlessly with other editing controls in the
1995    EditImageView, providing a non-destructive workflow where masks can
1996    be enabled, adjusted, and disabled without losing editing progress.
1997    
1998    Attributes:
1999        - controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller for mask logic
2000        - checkboxShadows (QCheckBox): Shadows range mask toggle
2001        - checkboxBlacks (QCheckBox): Blacks range mask toggle  
2002        - checkboxMediums (QCheckBox): Mediums range mask toggle
2003        - checkboxWhites (QCheckBox): Whites range mask toggle
2004        - checkboxHighlights (QCheckBox): Highlights range mask toggle
2005        - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for checkbox arrangement
2006
2007    Usage Example:
2008        # Enable shadow and highlight masking for targeted adjustment
2009        mask_view.checkboxShadows.setChecked(True)
2010        mask_view.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(True)
2011        
2012        # Apply selective exposure adjustment
2013        # (affects only shadows and highlights)
2014        
2015    Technical Notes:
2016        - Mask ranges correspond to tone curve control points
2017        - Multiple masks can be active simultaneously
2018        - Masks affect all subsequent editing operations
2019        - Checkbox state is preserved in ProcessPipe parameters
2020        - Real-time mask preview available through color editors
2021    """
2022    def __init__(self, _controller):
2023        """
2024        Initialize lightness masking interface with five tone range checkboxes.
2025        
2026        Creates a horizontal arrangement of checkboxes for controlling tone range
2027        masks. Sets up callback connections for real-time mask updates and
2028        initializes all masks as disabled by default.
2029        
2030        Args:
2031            _controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller implementing
2032                maskChange() method for handling mask state updates
2033                
2034        Interface Layout:
2035            All checkboxes are arranged horizontally in reading order:
2036            [Shadows] [Blacks] [Mediums] [Whites] [Highlights]
2037            
2038        Default State:
2039            All masks are initially disabled (unchecked) to allow normal
2040            full-range editing operations.
2041        """
2042        super().__init__("mask lightness")
2043        #self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2044
2045        self.controller = _controller
2046
2047        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
2048        self.setLayout(self.hbox)
2049
2050        self.checkboxShadows = QCheckBox("shadows")
2051        self.checkboxShadows.setChecked(False)
2052        self.checkboxBlacks = QCheckBox("blacks")
2053        self.checkboxBlacks.setChecked(False)
2054        self.checkboxMediums = QCheckBox("mediums")
2055        self.checkboxMediums.setChecked(False)
2056        self.checkboxWhites = QCheckBox("whites")
2057        self.checkboxWhites.setChecked(False)
2058        self.checkboxHighlights = QCheckBox("highlights")
2059        self.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(False)
2060
2061        self.checkboxShadows.toggled.connect(self.clickShadows)
2062        self.checkboxBlacks.toggled.connect(self.clickBlacks)
2063        self.checkboxMediums.toggled.connect(self.clickMediums)
2064        self.checkboxWhites.toggled.connect(self.clickWhites)
2065        self.checkboxHighlights.toggled.connect(self.clickHighlights)
2066
2067        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxShadows)
2068        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxBlacks)
2069        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxMediums)
2070        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxWhites)
2071        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxHighlights)
2072
2073    # callbacks
2074    def clickShadows(self):
2075        """
2076        Handle shadows mask checkbox toggle.
2077        
2078        Activates or deactivates masking for the shadows tone range (0-20%)
2079        when the shadows checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2080        of the darkest image regions.
2081        """
2082        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2083            self.controller.maskChange("shadows", self.checkboxShadows.isChecked())
2084            
2085    def clickBlacks(self):
2086        """
2087        Handle blacks mask checkbox toggle.
2088        
2089        Activates or deactivates masking for the blacks tone range (20-40%)
2090        when the blacks checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2091        of dark mid-tone regions.
2092        """
2093        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2094            self.controller.maskChange("blacks", self.checkboxBlacks.isChecked())
2095            
2096    def clickMediums(self):
2097        """
2098        Handle mediums mask checkbox toggle.
2099        
2100        Activates or deactivates masking for the mediums tone range (40-60%)
2101        when the mediums checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2102        of mid-tone regions including skin tones and neutral greys.
2103        """
2104        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2105            self.controller.maskChange("mediums", self.checkboxMediums.isChecked())
2106            
2107    def clickWhites(self):
2108        """
2109        Handle whites mask checkbox toggle.
2110        
2111        Activates or deactivates masking for the whites tone range (60-80%)
2112        when the whites checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2113        of bright mid-tone regions and highlight transitions.
2114        """
2115        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2116            self.controller.maskChange("whites", self.checkboxWhites.isChecked())
2117            
2118    def clickHighlights(self):
2119        """
2120        Handle highlights mask checkbox toggle.
2121        
2122        Activates or deactivates masking for the highlights tone range (80-100%)
2123        when the highlights checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2124        of the brightest image regions and specular highlights.
2125        """
2126        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2127            self.controller.maskChange("highlights", self.checkboxHighlights.isChecked())

Lightness-based masking control interface for selective tone editing.

Provides checkbox controls for enabling/disabling tone range masks that allow selective application of editing adjustments to specific lightness regions. Works in conjunction with tone curve editing to provide precise control over which tonal ranges are affected by parameter changes.

Tone Range Masking: The interface allows independent masking of five distinct lightness ranges corresponding to the tone curve control points:

  • Shadows (0-20%): Darkest image regions

    • Deep shadows, true blacks, dark details
    • Useful for shadow lifting without affecting other tones

  • Blacks (20-40%): Lower mid-tone range

    • Dark greys, low-key lighting areas
    • Controls separation between shadows and mid-tones

  • Mediums (40-60%): Mid-tone range

    • Standard exposure areas, skin tones, neutral greys
    • Primary brightness and contrast control zone

  • Whites (60-80%): Upper mid-tone range

    • Bright areas, light greys, highlight transitions
    • Controls separation between mid-tones and highlights

  • Highlights (80-100%): Brightest image regions

    • Specular highlights, light sources, bright reflections
    • Useful for highlight recovery and bright detail control

Masking Functionality: When checkboxes are enabled, subsequent editing operations (exposure, contrast, color adjustments) are selectively applied only to pixels within the specified lightness ranges. This allows for:

  • Targeted shadow lifting without brightening highlights
  • Selective highlight recovery without darkening shadows
  • Mid-tone contrast adjustments without clipping extremes
  • Color corrections limited to specific tonal ranges
  • Fine-tuned local adjustments for advanced workflow

Layout Structure: +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | mask lightness | +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | [✓] shadows [✓] blacks [✓] mediums [✓] whites [✓] highlights| +---------------------------------------------------------------+

Integration: The mask settings work seamlessly with other editing controls in the EditImageView, providing a non-destructive workflow where masks can be enabled, adjusted, and disabled without losing editing progress.

Attributes: - controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller for mask logic - checkboxShadows (QCheckBox): Shadows range mask toggle - checkboxBlacks (QCheckBox): Blacks range mask toggle
- checkboxMediums (QCheckBox): Mediums range mask toggle - checkboxWhites (QCheckBox): Whites range mask toggle - checkboxHighlights (QCheckBox): Highlights range mask toggle - hbox (QHBoxLayout): Horizontal layout for checkbox arrangement

Usage Example: # Enable shadow and highlight masking for targeted adjustment mask_view.checkboxShadows.setChecked(True) mask_view.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(True)

# Apply selective exposure adjustment
# (affects only shadows and highlights)

Technical Notes: - Mask ranges correspond to tone curve control points - Multiple masks can be active simultaneously - Masks affect all subsequent editing operations - Checkbox state is preserved in ProcessPipe parameters - Real-time mask preview available through color editors

LightnessMaskView(_controller) 
2022    def __init__(self, _controller):
2023        """
2024        Initialize lightness masking interface with five tone range checkboxes.
2025        
2026        Creates a horizontal arrangement of checkboxes for controlling tone range
2027        masks. Sets up callback connections for real-time mask updates and
2028        initializes all masks as disabled by default.
2029        
2030        Args:
2031            _controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller implementing
2032                maskChange() method for handling mask state updates
2033                
2034        Interface Layout:
2035            All checkboxes are arranged horizontally in reading order:
2036            [Shadows] [Blacks] [Mediums] [Whites] [Highlights]
2037            
2038        Default State:
2039            All masks are initially disabled (unchecked) to allow normal
2040            full-range editing operations.
2041        """
2042        super().__init__("mask lightness")
2043        #self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2044
2045        self.controller = _controller
2046
2047        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
2048        self.setLayout(self.hbox)
2049
2050        self.checkboxShadows = QCheckBox("shadows")
2051        self.checkboxShadows.setChecked(False)
2052        self.checkboxBlacks = QCheckBox("blacks")
2053        self.checkboxBlacks.setChecked(False)
2054        self.checkboxMediums = QCheckBox("mediums")
2055        self.checkboxMediums.setChecked(False)
2056        self.checkboxWhites = QCheckBox("whites")
2057        self.checkboxWhites.setChecked(False)
2058        self.checkboxHighlights = QCheckBox("highlights")
2059        self.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(False)
2060
2061        self.checkboxShadows.toggled.connect(self.clickShadows)
2062        self.checkboxBlacks.toggled.connect(self.clickBlacks)
2063        self.checkboxMediums.toggled.connect(self.clickMediums)
2064        self.checkboxWhites.toggled.connect(self.clickWhites)
2065        self.checkboxHighlights.toggled.connect(self.clickHighlights)
2066
2067        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxShadows)
2068        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxBlacks)
2069        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxMediums)
2070        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxWhites)
2071        self.hbox.addWidget(self.checkboxHighlights)

Initialize lightness masking interface with five tone range checkboxes.

Creates a horizontal arrangement of checkboxes for controlling tone range masks. Sets up callback connections for real-time mask updates and initializes all masks as disabled by default.

Args: _controller (LightnessMaskController): Parent controller implementing maskChange() method for handling mask state updates

Interface Layout: All checkboxes are arranged horizontally in reading order: [Shadows] [Blacks] [Mediums] [Whites] [Highlights]

Default State: All masks are initially disabled (unchecked) to allow normal full-range editing operations.

controller
hbox
checkboxShadows
checkboxBlacks
checkboxMediums
checkboxWhites
checkboxHighlights
def clickShadows(self): 
2074    def clickShadows(self):
2075        """
2076        Handle shadows mask checkbox toggle.
2077        
2078        Activates or deactivates masking for the shadows tone range (0-20%)
2079        when the shadows checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2080        of the darkest image regions.
2081        """
2082        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2083            self.controller.maskChange("shadows", self.checkboxShadows.isChecked())

Handle shadows mask checkbox toggle.

Activates or deactivates masking for the shadows tone range (0-20%) when the shadows checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing of the darkest image regions.

def clickBlacks(self): 
2085    def clickBlacks(self):
2086        """
2087        Handle blacks mask checkbox toggle.
2088        
2089        Activates or deactivates masking for the blacks tone range (20-40%)
2090        when the blacks checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2091        of dark mid-tone regions.
2092        """
2093        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2094            self.controller.maskChange("blacks", self.checkboxBlacks.isChecked())

Handle blacks mask checkbox toggle.

Activates or deactivates masking for the blacks tone range (20-40%) when the blacks checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing of dark mid-tone regions.

def clickMediums(self): 
2096    def clickMediums(self):
2097        """
2098        Handle mediums mask checkbox toggle.
2099        
2100        Activates or deactivates masking for the mediums tone range (40-60%)
2101        when the mediums checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2102        of mid-tone regions including skin tones and neutral greys.
2103        """
2104        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2105            self.controller.maskChange("mediums", self.checkboxMediums.isChecked())

Handle mediums mask checkbox toggle.

Activates or deactivates masking for the mediums tone range (40-60%) when the mediums checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing of mid-tone regions including skin tones and neutral greys.

def clickWhites(self): 
2107    def clickWhites(self):
2108        """
2109        Handle whites mask checkbox toggle.
2110        
2111        Activates or deactivates masking for the whites tone range (60-80%)
2112        when the whites checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2113        of bright mid-tone regions and highlight transitions.
2114        """
2115        if self.controller.callBackActive:  
2116            self.controller.maskChange("whites", self.checkboxWhites.isChecked())

Handle whites mask checkbox toggle.

Activates or deactivates masking for the whites tone range (60-80%) when the whites checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing of bright mid-tone regions and highlight transitions.

def clickHighlights(self): 
2118    def clickHighlights(self):
2119        """
2120        Handle highlights mask checkbox toggle.
2121

2123        when the highlights checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing
2124        of the brightest image regions and specular highlights.
2125        """

2127            self.controller.maskChange("highlights", self.checkboxHighlights.isChecked())

Handle highlights mask checkbox toggle.

Activates or deactivates masking for the highlights tone range (80-100%) when the highlights checkbox state changes. Enables selective editing of the brightest image regions and specular highlights.

class HDRviewerView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame): 
2131class HDRviewerView(QFrame):
2132    """
2133    HDR display preview control interface for external HDR monitor management.
2134    
2135    Provides essential controls for managing real-time HDR image preview on external
2136    HDR-capable displays. Enables workflow acceleration through live preview updates
2137    and side-by-side comparison capabilities for professional HDR image editing.
2138    
2139    HDR Display Features:
2140    - Real-time preview: Live updates of edited HDR images on external HDR displays
2141    - Automatic updates: Optional real-time synchronization with editing parameters
2142    - Raw/edited comparison: Side-by-side visualization of original vs processed images
2143    - Display reset: Clear HDR display and return to neutral state
2144    - Manual updates: On-demand refresh for selective preview control
2145    
2146    Workflow Integration:
2147    The HDR viewer integrates seamlessly with the editing workflow by providing
2148    immediate visual feedback on actual HDR hardware. This allows colorists and
2149    HDR specialists to:
2150    
2151    - Evaluate tone mapping accuracy on target display technology
2152    - Assess color gamut utilization and saturation levels
2153    - Verify highlight detail preservation and shadow lifting
2154    - Compare multiple editing iterations efficiently
2155    - Validate HDR content for delivery and mastering
2156    
2157    Display Requirements:
2158    Requires external HDR-capable monitor configured through preferences system.
2159    Supports various HDR display standards and peak brightness levels based on
2160    hardware capabilities and preference configuration.
2161    
2162    Layout Structure:
2163    +------------------------------------------+
2164    | hdr preview                    [reset]   |  <- Top row
2165    +------------------------------------------+
2166    | [✓] auto  [update]  [compare]           |  <- Bottom row
2167    +------------------------------------------+
2168    
2169    Control Functions:
2170    - Auto checkbox: Enable/disable automatic preview updates during editing
2171    - Update button: Manual refresh of HDR display with current image state
2172    - Compare button: Side-by-side display of raw and edited versions
2173    - Reset button: Clear HDR display and show default splash screen
2174    
2175    Performance Considerations:
2176    Auto-update mode may impact editing performance due to continuous HDR image
2177    processing and display updates. Manual update mode provides better responsiveness
2178    for complex editing operations while maintaining preview capability.
2179    
2180    Attributes:
2181        - controller (HDRController): Parent controller managing HDR display hardware
2182        - label (QLabel): "hdr preview" identifier label
2183        - resetButton (QPushButton): Clear HDR display control
2184        - updateButton (QPushButton): Manual HDR preview refresh
2185        - compareButton (QPushButton): Raw/edited comparison display
2186        - autoCheckBox (QCheckBox): Automatic update toggle
2187        - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Main vertical layout container
2188        - hboxUp, hboxDown (QHBoxLayout): Top and bottom control row layouts
2189        - hboxUpContainer, hboxDownContainer (QFrame): Layout containers
2190
2191    Usage Example:
2192        # Enable auto-preview for real-time editing feedback
2193        hdr_viewer.autoCheckBox.setChecked(True)
2194        
2195        # Manual update after complex editing operations
2196        hdr_viewer.updateButton.click()
2197        
2198        # Compare original and edited versions
2199        hdr_viewer.compareButton.click()
2200    
2201    Integration Notes:
2202        - Works with AppView menu shortcuts (Ctrl+H, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+K)
2203        - Synchronized with EditImageController editing operations
2204        - Respects HDR display preferences and configuration
2205        - Supports multiple HDR display standards and devices
2206    """
2207    def __init__(self, _controller= None, build = False):
2208        """
2209        Initialize HDR preview control interface with display management capabilities.
2210        
2211        Creates the HDR viewer interface with auto-update checkbox, manual control
2212        buttons, and proper layout arrangement. Optionally restores previous auto-update
2213        state when rebuilding the interface.
2214        
2215        Args:
2216            _controller (HDRController, optional): Parent HDR display controller
2217                managing external HDR hardware and display operations
2218            build (bool): Whether to restore previous auto-update state from
2219                existing model. Used when rebuilding interface during dock switching.
2220                
2221        Interface Setup:
2222            - Top row: "hdr preview" label + reset button
2223            - Bottom row: auto checkbox + update button + compare button
2224            - All controls connected to appropriate controller callbacks
2225            
2226        State Restoration:
2227            When build=True, retrieves previous autoPreviewHDR setting from
2228            the editing model to maintain consistent user preferences across
2229            interface rebuilds and dock panel switches.
2230        """
2231        super().__init__()
2232        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2233
2234        self.controller = _controller
2235
2236        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2237        self.hboxUp = QHBoxLayout()
2238        self.hboxDown = QHBoxLayout()
2239
2240        self.label= QLabel("hdr preview")
2241        self.resetButton = QPushButton("reset")
2242        self.updateButton = QPushButton("update")
2243        self.compareButton = QPushButton("compare")
2244        self.autoCheckBox = QCheckBox("auto")
2245
2246        if build:
2247            cValue = self.controller.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR
2248            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(cValue)
2249        else:
2250            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(False)
2251
2252        self.hboxUpContainer = QFrame()
2253        self.hboxUpContainer.setLayout(self.hboxUp)
2254        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.label)
2255        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.resetButton)
2256
2257        self.hboxDownContainer = QFrame()
2258        self.hboxDownContainer.setLayout(self.hboxDown)
2259        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.autoCheckBox)
2260        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.updateButton)
2261        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.compareButton)
2262
2263        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxUpContainer)
2264        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxDownContainer)
2265
2266        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2267
2268        self.resetButton.clicked.connect(self.reset)
2269        self.updateButton.clicked.connect(self.update)
2270        self.compareButton.clicked.connect(self.compare)
2271        self.autoCheckBox.toggled.connect(self.auto)
2272
2273    def reset(self):
2274        """
2275        Clear HDR display and show default splash screen.
2276        
2277        Resets the external HDR monitor to a neutral state by displaying
2278        the default splash screen. Useful for clearing previous previews
2279        and returning to a known baseline state.
2280        """
2281        self.controller.displaySplash()
2282
2283    def update(self):
2284        """
2285        Manually refresh HDR display with current image state.
2286        
2287        Triggers immediate update of the external HDR display with the
2288        currently processed image, reflecting all current editing parameters.
2289        Provides on-demand preview control for performance optimization.
2290        """
2291        self.controller.callBackUpdate()
2292
2293    def compare(self):
2294        """
2295        Display side-by-side raw and edited image comparison.
2296        
2297        Shows both the original unprocessed image and the current edited
2298        version simultaneously on the HDR display for direct visual
2299        comparison. Essential for evaluating editing effectiveness and
2300        maintaining reference to original image characteristics.
2301        """
2302        self.controller.callBackCompare()
2303
2304    def auto(self):
2305        """
2306        Toggle automatic HDR preview updates based on checkbox state.
2307        
2308        Enables or disables real-time HDR display updates that synchronize
2309        automatically with editing parameter changes. When enabled, provides
2310        immediate visual feedback but may impact editing performance.
2311        """
2312        self.controller.callBackAuto(self.autoCheckBox.isChecked())

HDR display preview control interface for external HDR monitor management.

Provides essential controls for managing real-time HDR image preview on external HDR-capable displays. Enables workflow acceleration through live preview updates and side-by-side comparison capabilities for professional HDR image editing.

HDR Display Features:

  • Real-time preview: Live updates of edited HDR images on external HDR displays
  • Automatic updates: Optional real-time synchronization with editing parameters
  • Raw/edited comparison: Side-by-side visualization of original vs processed images
  • Display reset: Clear HDR display and return to neutral state
  • Manual updates: On-demand refresh for selective preview control

Workflow Integration: The HDR viewer integrates seamlessly with the editing workflow by providing immediate visual feedback on actual HDR hardware. This allows colorists and HDR specialists to:

  • Evaluate tone mapping accuracy on target display technology
  • Assess color gamut utilization and saturation levels
  • Verify highlight detail preservation and shadow lifting
  • Compare multiple editing iterations efficiently
  • Validate HDR content for delivery and mastering

Display Requirements: Requires external HDR-capable monitor configured through preferences system. Supports various HDR display standards and peak brightness levels based on hardware capabilities and preference configuration.

Layout Structure: +------------------------------------------+ | hdr preview [reset] | <- Top row +------------------------------------------+ | [✓] auto [update] [compare] | <- Bottom row +------------------------------------------+

Control Functions:

  • Auto checkbox: Enable/disable automatic preview updates during editing
  • Update button: Manual refresh of HDR display with current image state
  • Compare button: Side-by-side display of raw and edited versions
  • Reset button: Clear HDR display and show default splash screen

Performance Considerations: Auto-update mode may impact editing performance due to continuous HDR image processing and display updates. Manual update mode provides better responsiveness for complex editing operations while maintaining preview capability.

Attributes: - controller (HDRController): Parent controller managing HDR display hardware - label (QLabel): "hdr preview" identifier label - resetButton (QPushButton): Clear HDR display control - updateButton (QPushButton): Manual HDR preview refresh - compareButton (QPushButton): Raw/edited comparison display - autoCheckBox (QCheckBox): Automatic update toggle - vbox (QVBoxLayout): Main vertical layout container - hboxUp, hboxDown (QHBoxLayout): Top and bottom control row layouts - hboxUpContainer, hboxDownContainer (QFrame): Layout containers

Usage Example: # Enable auto-preview for real-time editing feedback hdr_viewer.autoCheckBox.setChecked(True)

# Manual update after complex editing operations
hdr_viewer.updateButton.click()

# Compare original and edited versions
hdr_viewer.compareButton.click()

Integration Notes: - Works with AppView menu shortcuts (Ctrl+H, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+K) - Synchronized with EditImageController editing operations - Respects HDR display preferences and configuration - Supports multiple HDR display standards and devices

HDRviewerView(_controller=None, build=False) 
2207    def __init__(self, _controller= None, build = False):
2208        """
2209        Initialize HDR preview control interface with display management capabilities.
2210        
2211        Creates the HDR viewer interface with auto-update checkbox, manual control
2212        buttons, and proper layout arrangement. Optionally restores previous auto-update
2213        state when rebuilding the interface.
2214        
2215        Args:
2216            _controller (HDRController, optional): Parent HDR display controller
2217                managing external HDR hardware and display operations
2218            build (bool): Whether to restore previous auto-update state from
2219                existing model. Used when rebuilding interface during dock switching.
2220                
2221        Interface Setup:
2222            - Top row: "hdr preview" label + reset button
2223            - Bottom row: auto checkbox + update button + compare button
2224            - All controls connected to appropriate controller callbacks
2225            
2226        State Restoration:
2227            When build=True, retrieves previous autoPreviewHDR setting from
2228            the editing model to maintain consistent user preferences across
2229            interface rebuilds and dock panel switches.
2230        """
2231        super().__init__()
2232        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2233
2234        self.controller = _controller
2235
2236        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2237        self.hboxUp = QHBoxLayout()
2238        self.hboxDown = QHBoxLayout()
2239
2240        self.label= QLabel("hdr preview")
2241        self.resetButton = QPushButton("reset")
2242        self.updateButton = QPushButton("update")
2243        self.compareButton = QPushButton("compare")
2244        self.autoCheckBox = QCheckBox("auto")
2245
2246        if build:
2247            cValue = self.controller.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR
2248            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(cValue)
2249        else:
2250            self.autoCheckBox.setChecked(False)
2251
2252        self.hboxUpContainer = QFrame()
2253        self.hboxUpContainer.setLayout(self.hboxUp)
2254        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.label)
2255        self.hboxUp.addWidget(self.resetButton)
2256
2257        self.hboxDownContainer = QFrame()
2258        self.hboxDownContainer.setLayout(self.hboxDown)
2259        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.autoCheckBox)
2260        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.updateButton)
2261        self.hboxDown.addWidget(self.compareButton)
2262
2263        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxUpContainer)
2264        self.vbox.addWidget(self.hboxDownContainer)
2265
2266        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2267
2268        self.resetButton.clicked.connect(self.reset)
2269        self.updateButton.clicked.connect(self.update)
2270        self.compareButton.clicked.connect(self.compare)
2271        self.autoCheckBox.toggled.connect(self.auto)

Initialize HDR preview control interface with display management capabilities.

Creates the HDR viewer interface with auto-update checkbox, manual control buttons, and proper layout arrangement. Optionally restores previous auto-update state when rebuilding the interface.

Args: _controller (HDRController, optional): Parent HDR display controller managing external HDR hardware and display operations build (bool): Whether to restore previous auto-update state from existing model. Used when rebuilding interface during dock switching.

Interface Setup: - Top row: "hdr preview" label + reset button - Bottom row: auto checkbox + update button + compare button - All controls connected to appropriate controller callbacks

State Restoration: When build=True, retrieves previous autoPreviewHDR setting from the editing model to maintain consistent user preferences across interface rebuilds and dock panel switches.

2305        """
2306        Toggle automatic HDR preview updates based on checkbox state.

2309        automatically with editing parameter changes. When enabled, provides

Toggle automatic HDR preview updates based on checkbox state.

Enables or disables real-time HDR display updates that synchronize automatically with editing parameter changes. When enabled, provides immediate visual feedback but may impact editing performance.

class LchColorSelectorView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame): 
2316class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame):
2317    """
2318    LCH color space selection and editing interface.
2319    
2320    Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space
2321    with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls.
2322    Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.
2323    
2324    Color Selection Components:
2325    - Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360°)
2326    - Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
2327    - Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
2328    - Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component
2329    
2330    Color Editing Components:
2331    - Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180° to +180°)
2332    - Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
2333    - Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
2334    - Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)
2335    
2336    Additional Features:
2337    - Selection mask preview
2338    - Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
2339    - Real-time color bar updates based on selection
2340    
2341    Layout Structure:
2342    +------------------------------------------+
2343    | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector      |
2344    +------------------------------------------+
2345    | [Hue Color Bar Visualization]           |
2346    | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider]       |
2347    | [Selected Hue Range Bar]                |
2348    +------------------------------------------+
2349    | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization]        |
2350    | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] |
2351    +------------------------------------------+
2352    | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization]     |
2353    | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider]   |
2354    +------------------------------------------+
2355    | [Reset Selection]                        |
2356    +------------------------------------------+
2357    | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation |
2358    | hue shift:  [slider] [value]            |
2359    | saturation: [slider] [value]            |
2360    | exposure:   [slider] [value]            |
2361    | contrast:   [slider] [value]            |
2362    | [x] show selection                       |
2363    | [Reset Edit]                             |
2364    +------------------------------------------+
2365    
2366    Attributes:
2367        - controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference
2368        - imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays
2369        - imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization
2370        - sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders
2371        - sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders
2372        - sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders
2373        - sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls
2374        - valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays
2375        - checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle
2376        - resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons
2377    """
2378    def __init__(self, _controller, defaultValues=None):
2379        """
2380        Initialize LCH color selector interface.
2381        
2382        Args:
2383            _controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller instance
2384            defaultValues: Optional default parameter values
2385        """
2386        super().__init__()
2387        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2388        self.controller = _controller
2389
2390        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2391
2392        self.labelSelector = QLabel("Hue Chroma Lighness color selector")
2393        # procedural image: Hue bar
2394        hueBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2395        hueBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2396        self.imageHueController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2397        self.imageHueController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2398        self.imageHueController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2399        hueBar2Lch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2400        hueBar2RGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBar2Lch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2401        self.imageHueRangeController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2402        self.imageHueRangeController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2403        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2404        # slider min
2405        self.sliderHueMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2406        self.sliderHueMin.setRange(0,360)
2407        self.sliderHueMin.setValue(0)
2408        self.sliderHueMin.setSingleStep(1)
2409        # slider max
2410        self.sliderHueMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2411        self.sliderHueMax.setRange(0,360)
2412        self.sliderHueMax.setValue(360)
2413        self.sliderHueMax.setSingleStep(1)
2414
2415        # procedural image: Saturation bar
2416        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (180,180), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2417        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2418        self.imageSaturationController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2419        self.imageSaturationController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2420        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2421        # slider min
2422        self.sliderChromaMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2423        self.sliderChromaMin.setRange(0,100)
2424        self.sliderChromaMin.setValue(0)
2425        self.sliderChromaMin.setSingleStep(1)
2426        # slider max
2427        self.sliderChromaMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2428        self.sliderChromaMax.setRange(0,100)
2429        self.sliderChromaMax.setValue(100)
2430        self.sliderChromaMax.setSingleStep(1)
2431
2432        # procedural image:lightness bar
2433        lightnessBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((0,100), (0,0), (180,180), (20,720), width='L', height='c')
2434        lightnessBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(lightnessBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2435        self.imageLightnessController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2436        self.imageLightnessController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2437        self.imageLightnessController.setImage(lightnessBarRGB)
2438        # slider min
2439        self.sliderLightMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2440        self.sliderLightMin.setRange(0,300)
2441        self.sliderLightMin.setValue(0)
2442        self.sliderLightMin.setSingleStep(1)        
2443        # slider max
2444        self.sliderLightMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2445        self.sliderLightMax.setRange(0,300)
2446        self.sliderLightMax.setValue(300)
2447        self.sliderLightMax.setSingleStep(1)
2448
2449        # editor
2450        self.labelEditor =      QLabel("color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation")
2451
2452        # hue shift [-180,+180]
2453        self.frameHueShift = QFrame()
2454        self.layoutHueShift = QHBoxLayout()
2455        self.frameHueShift.setLayout(self.layoutHueShift)
2456        self.sliderHueShift =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2457        self.sliderHueShift.setRange(-180,+180)
2458        self.sliderHueShift.setValue(0)
2459        self.sliderHueShift.setSingleStep(1) 
2460        self.valueHueShift = QLineEdit()
2461        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(0.0))  
2462        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(QLabel("hue shift"))
2463        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.sliderHueShift)
2464        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.valueHueShift)
2465
2466        # exposure [-3 , +3]
2467        self.frameExposure = QFrame()
2468        self.layoutExposure = QHBoxLayout()
2469        self.frameExposure.setLayout(self.layoutExposure)
2470        self.sliderExposure =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2471        self.sliderExposure.setRange(-90,+90)
2472        self.sliderExposure.setValue(0)
2473        self.sliderExposure.setSingleStep(1) 
2474        self.valueExposure = QLineEdit()
2475        self.valueExposure.setText(str(0.0))  
2476        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(QLabel("exposure"))
2477        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(self.sliderExposure)
2478        self.layoutExposure.addWidget(self.valueExposure)
2479
2480        # contrast [-100 , +100]
2481        self.frameContrast = QFrame()
2482        self.layoutContrast = QHBoxLayout()
2483        self.frameContrast.setLayout(self.layoutContrast)
2484        self.sliderContrast =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2485        self.sliderContrast.setRange(-100,+100)
2486        self.sliderContrast.setValue(0)
2487        self.sliderContrast.setSingleStep(1) 
2488        self.valueContrast = QLineEdit()
2489        self.valueContrast.setText(str(0.0))  
2490        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(QLabel("contrast"))
2491        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(self.sliderContrast)
2492        self.layoutContrast.addWidget(self.valueContrast)
2493
2494        # saturation [-100 , +100]
2495        self.frameSaturation = QFrame()
2496        self.layoutSaturation = QHBoxLayout()
2497        self.frameSaturation.setLayout(self.layoutSaturation)
2498        self.sliderSaturation =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2499        self.sliderSaturation.setRange(-100,+100)
2500        self.sliderSaturation.setValue(0)
2501        self.sliderSaturation.setSingleStep(1) 
2502        self.valueSaturation = QLineEdit()
2503        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(0.0))  
2504        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(QLabel("saturation"))
2505        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(self.sliderSaturation)
2506        self.layoutSaturation.addWidget(self.valueSaturation)
2507
2508        # -----
2509        self.resetSelection  = QPushButton("reset selection")
2510        self.resetEdit  = QPushButton("reset edit")
2511        # -----
2512
2513        # mask
2514        self.checkboxMask = QCheckBox("show selection")
2515        self.checkboxMask.setChecked(False)
2516
2517        self.vbox.addWidget(self.labelSelector)
2518
2519        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageHueController.view)
2520        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderHueMin)
2521        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderHueMax)
2522        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageHueRangeController.view)
2523
2524
2525        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageSaturationController.view)
2526        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderChromaMin)
2527        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderChromaMax)
2528
2529        self.vbox.addWidget(self.imageLightnessController.view)
2530        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderLightMin)
2531        self.vbox.addWidget(self.sliderLightMax)
2532
2533        # -----
2534        self.vbox.addWidget(self.resetSelection)
2535        # -----
2536
2537
2538        self.vbox.addWidget(self.labelEditor)
2539        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameHueShift)
2540        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameSaturation)
2541        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameExposure)
2542        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameContrast)
2543
2544        self.vbox.addWidget(self.checkboxMask)
2545        # -----
2546        self.vbox.addWidget(self.resetEdit)
2547        # -----
2548        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2549
2550        # callbacks  
2551        self.sliderHueMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueChange)
2552        self.sliderHueMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueChange)
2553        self.sliderChromaMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderChromaChange)
2554        self.sliderChromaMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderChromaChange)
2555        self.sliderLightMin.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderLightnessChange)
2556        self.sliderLightMax.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderLightnessChange)
2557        self.sliderExposure.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderExposureChange)
2558        self.sliderSaturation.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderSaturationChange)
2559        self.sliderContrast.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderContrastChange)
2560        self.sliderHueShift.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderHueShiftChange)
2561        self.checkboxMask.toggled.connect(self.checkboxMaskChange)
2562        # -----
2563        self.resetSelection.clicked.connect(self.controller.resetSelection)
2564        self.resetEdit.clicked.connect(self.controller.resetEdit)
2565
2566
2567    # callbacks
2568    def sliderHueChange(self):
2569        """
2570        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2571        
2572        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2573        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2574        """
2575        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2576        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2577
2578        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2579        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2580        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2581        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2582        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2583        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2584        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2585
2586        # call controller
2587        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)
2588
2589    def sliderChromaChange(self):
2590        """Handle chroma range selection changes."""
2591        vmin = self.sliderChromaMin.value()
2592        vmax = self.sliderChromaMax.value()
2593        # call controller
2594        self.controller.sliderChromaChange(vmin,vmax)
2595
2596    def sliderLightnessChange(self):
2597        """Handle lightness range selection changes."""
2598        vmin = self.sliderLightMin.value()/3.0
2599        vmax = self.sliderLightMax.value()/3.0
2600        # call controller
2601        self.controller.sliderLightnessChange(vmin,vmax)
2602
2603    def sliderExposureChange(self):
2604        """Handle exposure editing changes with 0.1 stop precision."""
2605        ev = round(self.sliderExposure.value()/30,1)
2606        # force to 0.1 precision
2607        self.valueExposure.setText(str(ev))
2608        self.controller.sliderExposureChange(ev)
2609
2610    def sliderSaturationChange(self):
2611        """Handle saturation editing changes."""
2612        ev = self.sliderSaturation.value()
2613        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(ev))
2614        self.controller.sliderSaturationChange(ev)
2615
2616    def sliderContrastChange(self):
2617        """Handle contrast editing changes."""
2618        ev = self.sliderContrast.value()
2619        self.valueContrast.setText(str(ev))
2620        self.controller.sliderContrastChange(ev)
2621
2622    def sliderHueShiftChange(self):
2623        """Handle hue shift editing changes."""
2624        hs = self.sliderHueShift.value()
2625        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(hs))
2626        self.controller.sliderHueShiftChange(hs)
2627
2628    def checkboxMaskChange(self):
2629        """Handle selection mask preview toggle."""
2630        self.controller.checkboxMaskChange(self.checkboxMask.isChecked())

LCH color space selection and editing interface.

Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls. Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.

Color Selection Components:

  • Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360°)
  • Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
  • Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
  • Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component

Color Editing Components:

  • Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180° to +180°)
  • Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
  • Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
  • Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)

Additional Features:

  • Selection mask preview
  • Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
  • Real-time color bar updates based on selection

Layout Structure: +------------------------------------------+ | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector | +------------------------------------------+ | [Hue Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider] | | [Selected Hue Range Bar] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Reset Selection] | +------------------------------------------+ | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation | | hue shift: [slider] [value] | | saturation: [slider] [value] | | exposure: [slider] [value] | | contrast: [slider] [value] | | [x] show selection | | [Reset Edit] | +------------------------------------------+

Attributes: - controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference - imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays - imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization - sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders - sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders - sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders - sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls - valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays - checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle - resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons

LchColorSelectorView(_controller, defaultValues=None) 
2378    def __init__(self, _controller, defaultValues=None):
2379        """
2380        Initialize LCH color selector interface.
2381        
2382        Args:
2383            _controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller instance
2384            defaultValues: Optional default parameter values
2385        """
2386        super().__init__()
2387        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2388        self.controller = _controller
2389
2390        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2391
2392        self.labelSelector = QLabel("Hue Chroma Lighness color selector")
2393        # procedural image: Hue bar
2394        hueBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2395        hueBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2396        self.imageHueController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2397        self.imageHueController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2398        self.imageHueController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2399        hueBar2Lch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2400        hueBar2RGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBar2Lch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2401        self.imageHueRangeController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2402        self.imageHueRangeController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2403        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
2404        # slider min
2405        self.sliderHueMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2406        self.sliderHueMin.setRange(0,360)
2407        self.sliderHueMin.setValue(0)
2408        self.sliderHueMin.setSingleStep(1)
2409        # slider max
2410        self.sliderHueMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2411        self.sliderHueMax.setRange(0,360)
2412        self.sliderHueMax.setValue(360)
2413        self.sliderHueMax.setSingleStep(1)
2414
2415        # procedural image: Saturation bar
2416        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (180,180), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2417        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2418        self.imageSaturationController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2419        self.imageSaturationController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2420        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2421        # slider min
2422        self.sliderChromaMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2423        self.sliderChromaMin.setRange(0,100)
2424        self.sliderChromaMin.setValue(0)
2425        self.sliderChromaMin.setSingleStep(1)
2426        # slider max
2427        self.sliderChromaMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2428        self.sliderChromaMax.setRange(0,100)
2429        self.sliderChromaMax.setValue(100)
2430        self.sliderChromaMax.setSingleStep(1)
2431
2432        # procedural image:lightness bar
2433        lightnessBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((0,100), (0,0), (180,180), (20,720), width='L', height='c')
2434        lightnessBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(lightnessBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2435        self.imageLightnessController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
2436        self.imageLightnessController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
2437        self.imageLightnessController.setImage(lightnessBarRGB)
2438        # slider min
2439        self.sliderLightMin = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2440        self.sliderLightMin.setRange(0,300)
2441        self.sliderLightMin.setValue(0)
2442        self.sliderLightMin.setSingleStep(1)        
2443        # slider max
2444        self.sliderLightMax = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2445        self.sliderLightMax.setRange(0,300)
2446        self.sliderLightMax.setValue(300)
2447        self.sliderLightMax.setSingleStep(1)
2448
2449        # editor
2450        self.labelEditor =      QLabel("color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation")
2451
2452        # hue shift [-180,+180]
2453        self.frameHueShift = QFrame()
2454        self.layoutHueShift = QHBoxLayout()
2455        self.frameHueShift.setLayout(self.layoutHueShift)
2456        self.sliderHueShift =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2457        self.sliderHueShift.setRange(-180,+180)
2458        self.sliderHueShift.setValue(0)
2459        self.sliderHueShift.setSingleStep(1) 
2460        self.valueHueShift = QLineEdit()
2461        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(0.0))  
2462        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(QLabel("hue shift"))
2463        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.sliderHueShift)
2464        self.layoutHueShift.addWidget(self.valueHueShift)
2465
2466        # exposure [-3 , +3]
2467        self.frameExposure = QFrame()
2468        self.layoutExposure = QHBoxLayout()
2469        self.frameExposure.setLayout(self.layoutExposure)
2470        self.sliderExposure =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2471        self.sliderExposure.setRange(-90,+90)
2472        self.sliderExposure.setValue(0)
2473        self.sliderExposure.setSingleStep(1) 
2474        self.valueExposure = QLineEdit()

def sliderHueChange(self): 
2568    def sliderHueChange(self):
2569        """
2570        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2571        
2572        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2573        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2574        """
2575        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2576        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2577
2578        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2579        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2580        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2581        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2582        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2583        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2584        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2585
2586        # call controller
2587        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)
